loans.name: Mumikatu

texts.en: Munikatu I. is 35 years, married with 4 children. She lives in Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells ice fish. Mumikatu has been in this business since 1999. She needs the loan to buy more fish for sale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
Janeth is 25 years old and has a little daughter, Margiori, who has become her main reason to improve and succeed. Janeth owns a motorcycle that can be used as a taxi. As it is her main source of income, she would like to improve the motorbike’s standing so she can raise the standard of living of her household.

Let’s grant her petition so that in a short time this young mother can build the transportation company she longs to have.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Janeth de 25 años de edad, tiene una hijita de nombre Margiori, quien se ha convertido en su mejor motivo de progreso, es propietaria de un mototaxi.Su continuo deseo de procurarle bienestar a su pequeña la conducen a solicitar un préstamo para mejorar las condiciones de su herramienta de trabajo a fin de elevar el nivel de vida de su hogar.

Posibilitemos su petición para que dentro de poco esta joven madre pueda constituir su ansiada empresa de transportes.

loans.use: Buy spareparts to improve the standing of her taxi-motorcycle

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbozi, Tanzania! This is 39 year old Lucy N.. She is married with three children, aged 17, 12 and 2. In 2005, Lucy established a bar, and now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of beer, liquor, and soft drinks. She thanks you for your support.

It is said that Coca Cola® is one of the most recognized symbols or ‘words’ in the world. And it is true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of ‘bar’ selling Coke, Fanta, and Guiness. The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing; a very cheap marketing tool indeed. This explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture, whether you are the CEO of Coca Cola Ltd in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania!

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of beer, liquor, and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Rukia Nianjema Group

texts.en:
Rukia M., age 46, is married and has 4 children (ages 18, 15, 13 and 11). She has a small stand at the market, a business which she began 8 years ago. She works from 6am to 8pm daily and has managed to make a monthly profit of about US$ 44.

In the past, Rukia has taken out three loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to expand her business, and she started a fish business as well. She hopes for a new loan to further expand both businesses. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in selling fish, running a beauty salon, a shop and selling food.

In the picture Rukia is 1st on the right

loans.use: to expand available business capital

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
As a good father that has to care for the well-being and security of his family, Edilberto has found himself with the need to postpone his university studies and start working so that his dear, young wife and daughter not have economic difficulties. With the savings that he has and the money that his parents have given him, he decided to buy his work tool in order to provide transportation services to the population of Juliaca. Since his dear wife Celia, who cares for their baby, also wishes to help with the expenses of their new household she is planning on buying a weaving machine in order to make beautiful garments of clothing and generate extra income to cover the basic necessities of the household. Your contribution will help to make real the project of this young couple.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Como buen padre que tiene que velar por el bienestar y seguridad de su familia Edilberto se ha visto en la necesidad de postergar sus estudios superiores y ponerse a trabajar para que su querida y joven esposa e hija no pasen limitaciones económicas.Con los ahorros que tenía y el apoyo económico que sus padres le brindaron decidió comprar su herramienta de trabajo para brindar servicios de movilidad urbana a la población Juliaqueña.En tanto su querida esposa, Celia, que se encarga del cuidado de su bebé, desea también colaborar con los gastos de su nuevo hogar, es por ello que tiene pensado comprar una máquina de tejer, para confeccionar hermosas prendas de vestir y generar ingresos extras para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hoga; debido a que ambos poseen mucha habilidad para confeccionar prendas han decidio adquirir las herrameintas necesarias para poner en marcha su gran proyecto. “Vuestro aporte permitirá concretar el proyecto de esta joven pareja”

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to start a textile business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Business Loan

loans.name: Ernesto Ariari

texts.es:
Ernesto is requesting financing to invest in improving his home so he can replace the roof on his house. He has worked for the Rafaela Herrera school in the colony of La Fonseca in the municipality of Nueva Guinea for five years.

Ernesto is a young man who is currently working on his bachelor's degree. He carries out his work with much responsibility, honesty, and many dreams of improving himself. Although he doesn't have children, he assumes the responsibility of caring for his parents. Since he is the youngest child, it is he who lives with them and assumes the expenses of the home.

It is fitting to point out that Ernesto is known for being a fighter and being enterprising. He is an example for all young Nicaraguans who love our country.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Ernesto esta solicitando su financiamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, como es cambiarle el zinc a la casa que habita; labora para la Escuela Rafaela Herrera en la colonia La Fonseca del municipio de Nueva Guinea desde hace 5 años

Ernesto es un joven que actualmente está estudiando una licenciatura, desempeña su labor con mucha responsabilidad, honestidad y mucho deseo de superacion personal. A pesar que no tiene hijos, asume la responsabilidad del cuido de sus padres, ya que como hijo menor es el que vive con ellos y asume los gastos del hogar.

Cabe resaltar que se caracteriza por ser luchador y emprendedor, es un ejemplo para todos los jovenes Nicaragüenses que amamos nuestro pais.

loans.use: To replace the roof on his house

loans.name: Thi Hang's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Hang (ID number: 060005) is 32 years old. She used the first loan to purchase more beans and soy beans to make tofu and bean sprouts. She realised that as her inventory expanded, she was able to save more and her daily income increased because she had more stocks to sell. Thus, she would like to request for a second loan. Her group had already repaid the first loan fully. This time, she wants to borrow 2,714,000VND to purchase more beans and soy beans. Her husband also helps out with the business to earn more profits. They have three school-going children. Their average daily income is 120,000VND (about 8USD). Her group also consists of:

Mrs. N. Thi Nhi (ID number: 060007), borrows 2,714,000VND to purchase more stocks for her general store. She joined in the first time and repaid fully.

Mrs. N. Thi Hong (ID number: 060019), borrows 2,714,000VND to purchase more eggs to sell. She joined in the first time and repaid fully.

Mrs. M. Thi Dat (ID number: 060020), borrows 2,714,000VND to breed pigs. She joined in the first time and repaid fully.

Mrs. N. Thi Loan (ID number: 060021), borrows 2,714,000VND to purchase more eggs to sell. She joined in the first time and repaid fully.

Mrs. N. Thi Tham (ID number: 060026), borrows 2,006,000VND to purchase more stocks for her general store.

Mrs. N. Thi Nhi (ID number: 060027), borrows 2,006,000VND to purchase pig feeds.

The total amount requested is 1,050USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Ngô Thị Hằng (MS: 060005), năm nay 32 tuổi. Lần một chị vay về mua thêm đỗ làm giá đỗ, đậu phục vụ chăn nuôi. Chị thấy mình có thêm vốn và tiết kiệm được hơn, mức thu nhập trên ngày cũng cao hơn vì chị có nhiều hàng hơn để bán. Chị thấy thích và tiếp tục tham gia lần hai. Chị và cả nhóm đã hoàn trả xong rất tốt lần một. Lần hai chị vay 2.714.000 để đầu tư vào việc mua giá đỗ làm đậu giá. Chồng chị cũng giúp chị trong việc đi chợ để có thêm thu nhập. Gia đình chị có ba con hiện còn đang đi học. Múc thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị là 120.000 VND/ ngày. Trong nhóm còn có:

  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Nhị (MS: 060007), vay 2.714.000 VND để mua bán hàng tiêu dùng. Chị đã tham gia ở kỳ trước và đã trả hết.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Hồng (MS: 060019), vay 2.714.000 VND để bổ xung vốn buôn bán trứng. Chị đã tham gia ở kỳ trước và đã hoàn trả hết.
  • Chị Mẫn Thị Đạt (MS: 060020), vay 2.714.000 VND để lấy vốn chăn nuôi lợn. Chị đã tham gia vay ở kỳ trước và đã trả hết.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Loan (MS: 060021), vay 2.714.000 VND để đi mua bán trứng. Chị đã tham gia ở kỳ trước và đã trả hết.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Thẩm (MS: 060026), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua bán hàng tiêu dùng.
  • Chị Mẫn Thị Linh (MS: 060027), vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn mua cám chăn nuôi lợn.

loans.use: Retail and agriculture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to produce sweet cream beans.

loans.name: Nihifadhi

texts.en:
Nihifadhi is 42 years old. She is divorced with 3 children aged 19, 7 and 6 years old. She has run her own phone accessories shop since 2006. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Nihifadhi now hopes for a loan to buy phone accessories to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more phone accessories to expand her business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 28 años de edad, estudió Superior Técnico, es casada y madre de dos hijos varones de 05 y 03 años de edad, vive en la avenida Tacna s/n en el distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao, Puno.

En el año 2002 decidió integrar el Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” en Mazocruz. En un inicio obtuvo S/.300 con el que compró conjuntos para bebes, chompas, pantalones de lana. 

Doña Teresa quedó huérfana de padre a los 12 años de edad, a los 13 años ya vendía gelatina, cuando cumplió los 21 años formó su hogar y se inició con la venta de ropa, confeccionaba buzos, tapetes para televisores, compraba su mercadería en la ciudad de Juliaca y vendía en la ciudad de Puno. Desde hace 02 años cambió de negocio, en la actualidad atiende en su restaurante.

Con este crédito de S/.2,200 Nuevos Soles, el cual será cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprará 02 cabezas de ganado vacuno para engorde.

Su meta es comprar su casa en la ciudad de Puno, instalar su Snack–cafetería y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Teresa is 28 years old and studied high technology in school. She's married and a mother of two boys, ages 5 and 3. She lives on Tacna Avenue in the town of Mazocruz. In 2002, she decided to join the Generation 2000 Community Bank, and with her initial loan she purchased outfits for infants, jackets, and wool pants. Teresa was orphaned at age 12, and the next year she started selling gelatins. When she turned 21, she started a family and began selling clothes, making sweaters and cloths for TVs. She purchased her supplies in the city of Juliaca and sold them in the city of Puno. Two years ago she changed her business, and currently tends to her restaurant. With the loan, which she plans to repay in four months, she will purchase two heads of cattle to fatten. Her goal is to purchase a home in Puno and to set up a snack bar so she can provide for her sons' education.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two heads of cattle to fatten

loans.name: Consolatha Mahagama's Kipunguni B Group

texts.en:
Consolatha M., age 40, is married with six children. She runs a business selling chicken and vegetables wholesale to shop owners in the city center. She started this business in 1996 and works daily from 1am until 8am. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about US$ 80.

This will be Consolatha’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the loans to increase her business inventory. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose.

Consolatha will share this loan with subgroup B of the Kipunguni group. The subgroup has 7 members. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Consolatha is in a red dress, second from the right.

loans.use: To increase inventory of vegetables and chicken

loans.name: Perpetual

texts.en:
Perpetual is a 46-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are currently in school. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her source of livelihood. More specifically, for the past twenty years, she has been selling yams, peppers, and smoked and dried fish to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of yams and peppers from farmers, and she buys her fish from fish mongers. By doing so, she avoids dealing with middlemen, who buy from the farmers and fish mongers and then resell to her at higher prices.

She is now seeking a loan to buy yams, peppers, and assorted fish in bulk to better serve her customers. In turn, she hopes to use some of her profits to support her kids in school.

Perpetual is a member of a community group known as The Voice Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other's loans as social collateral (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. She notes that she does not sell any of her goods on days when her group meets, and that her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To expand her inventory and to avoid middlemen by purchasing yams, peppers, and fish directly from farmers and fish mongers

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en: Hayat is a 43-year-old widow who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with her child. She has owned a grocery and clothing store since 1996. Hayat sells clothes, food and candy. She requested a loan of $500 US Dollars from Al Majmoua in order to reimburse her debts. This is her second cycle and she has always paid on time. When she first started her business, she didn’t have enough cash, but now, the loans have been helping her improve her income. In the future, she plans to purchase more merchandise for her shop.

loans.use: Hayat needs the loan to reimburse her debts.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Getrude Wisso from Dar es Salaam She is married. She is also responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents can not take care of them. Getrude has been running a pharmacy since 2005. Her business is doing well. She works at the business for 14 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by her husband and one employee. Getrude currently earns about 300 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 225 USD in order to purchase additional medicine. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her medicines. Getrude thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional medicine

loans.name: Violeth

texts.en:
Violeth W. M. runs a shop and a café at Kigamboni, in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She sells a variety of food, including beans, maize flour, wheat flour, ground nuts, and cashew nuts. She sometimes purchases these products at the Kariakoo city market, and sometimes directly from the producers.

She plans to runs a wholesale shop, but has limited funds. She requests a loan of $1075 (1,400,000 TZS) to purchase more items to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: Purchase more food items to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. is fifty-six years old. She is a married woman with two children, a boy and a girl. She says both of her children have completed school and are working. Mary says she lives with her husband and daughter in a rented apartment in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region. Berekum is a busy business centre which is about twenty-five minutes drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Mary’s husband is a farmer. She sells textiles and infants' layettes: baby’s cots, napkins, diapers, etc. She says she procures her goods from the nearby cities and sells in Berekum. Mary also treks to nearby towns to sell. She does not own a shop to sell in. Therefore, she hawks to sell her products. She has been in business for three years. Mary wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure more goods. She desires to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy infants' layettes and textiles for re-sale

loans.name: Nicolsa Emperatriz

texts.es: La Señora Nicolasa Emperatriz Paladino Cáceres tiene la edad de 59 años, su estado civil es casada. La actividad económica de Doña Nicolasa es producción de panadería. Hace mas de tres años que se dedica a este negocio es aquí donde realiza la elaboración de pan dulce y pan simple por lo que este negocio nace por la necesidad de proporcionar a su familia un medio de ingreso. Los propósitos de Doña Nicolasa son de mejorar la calidad de sus productos ya que así no perdería a sus clientes. Es por este motivo que Doña Nicolasa solicita el financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo ya que con esto podrá realizar su producción de pan. Los deseos de Doña Nicolasa son de establecer una tienda de ropa y así poseer ambos negocios. La cantidad que solicita es de C$8.500 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nicolasa Emperatriz Paladino Cáceres is 59 years old and married. Nicolasa is a baker. She has been baking for more than three years, making sweet bread and traditional bread. This business was born of a necessity to provide economically for her family. Nicolasa plans to improve the quality of her products so as not to lose any customers. It is for this motive that Nicolasa seeks financing for working capital in order to be able to make her bread. Nicolasa wishes to establish a clothing store and in this way have both businesses. She seeks C$8.500 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.es:
La señora Tatiana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Victorias”, vive en el Jr. Trujillo cdra. 06 – Barrió la Merced, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 24 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Se inicio con  S/. 20.00 motivada por su mamá, empezó vendiendo comidas en su misma casa, y poco a poco fue comprando mas enseres, para implementar su negocio. Tiene 02 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio, siendo sus principales clientes  los moradores de la comunidad, vecinos y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 que cancelará en 06 meses, desea invertir en la compra de insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como sacos de arroz, azúcar; aceites en paquetes, pollos en javas y también  mesas, sillas, vasos y ollas, para una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Ella toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. Hoy se siente una Mujer independiente, más responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Tatiana, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como Mujer y Empresaria.
texts.en:
Tatiana is a member of the "Victories" Communal Bank. She lives in the La Merced neighborhood, District of Juanjui, Department of San Martín. She is 24, the mother of two children who are dependents, and lives with her partner. Tatiana started her business with a small contribution from her mother. She began selling meals from her own home, and little by little began buying equipment for her business. She is still working in the same business, with residents of the community, neighbors and friends as her main customers. She has been working with the Bank for two years. With a loan of $500 to be repaid in 6 months, she would like to invest in the purchase of items to use in the daily preparation of foods and to better serve her clients, including sacks of rice, sugar, packaged oils, and chickens, as well as tables, chairs, glasses and pots. Tatiana makes decisions with respect to the earnings of her company. Today she feels like an independent woman, responsible for making her own loan payments. Tatiana gives thanks to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to grow as a person and as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale rice, sugar, oils, chickens. Purchase of chairs, glasses, pots.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 34-year-old divorced man who lives in Bekaa. Mohamad has owned a grocery store for three years. He requested a loan of $1,500 US dollars from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan.

Mohamad is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business he had financial issues and he also had health problems. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Nery Maria

texts.es:
la sra. Nery N. tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, desde hace 3 años, la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia "NELY".  Ella es casada y madre de 4 hijos, todos depende de ella y su esposo, tres de sus hijos estan cursando la educacion secundaria y primaria.
La Señora N. es una mujer muy emprendedora y con espiritu de superacion, ella comenta que con los ingresos que le genera el negocio ella apoya a su esposo con los gastos del hogar,  el esposo trabaja en Danli,  es comerciante y los ingresos que le genera el negocio se  apoyan mutuamente para  cumplir con los compromisos y poder salir adelante.

Actualmente ella necesita surtir un poco mas su negocio ya que en las pulperias vende el que mejor surtido tiene.
texts.en:
Ms. Nery N. has owned a general store, located inside her home, for three years. It operates under the name of Pulperia “NELY.” She is a married mother with 4 children, all of whom depend on her and her husband. Three of her children are in elementary and secondary school.

Ms. N. is an enterprising woman with a spirit of self-improvement. She states that with the profits that she generates from the business, she helps her husband with the household expenses. Her husband works in Danli. He, too, has his own business. He helps out his wife with the profits from his business so that they can take care of any commitments they have, thus being able to get ahead.

She currently needs to restock her shop because the general stores that offer the best products sell more.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lard, sugar, rice, soap, bathroom tissue, coffee, soft drinks, and dairy products

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Debora F. is thirty-two years of age, single, and has no child. She lives with her two younger siblings in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Debora is a trader, trading in gas cylinders and their accoutrements such as the tubes, valves, pipes, etc. She sells at a gas-filling station in her town. Debora buys her wares from wholesalers in Kumasi at a cost-effective prices.

Debora has been in business for two years now and wants a loan to procure more goods. She is hopeful to expand her business and increase her profit margin to be able to take proper care of her younger siblings.

loans.use: To buy gas cylinders to sell

loans.name: Justino

texts.es: Justino cuenta con 18 años de experiencia en la actividad como transportista, es casado, tiene casa propia, cuenta con dos hijos. Su negocio es de transporte con 18 años de experiencia y la esposa cuenta ingresos por venta de ganado ovino con experiencia de 32 años. La competencia en el mercado es alta. EL destino del crédito es para capital de operación (compra de repuestos). Este es su tercer crédito en la institución, cuenta con créditos en otras entidades financieras, Justino es un cliente antiguo en las otras instituciones y en AgroCapital cuenta con 20 meses de antigüedad.
texts.en:
Justino has 18 years of experience in transportation. He is married, owns his home and has two children. His business is transportation, which he has been doing for 18 years and his wife earns an income raising and selling sheep, which she has been doing for 32 years. Competition in the market is stiff. This loan will be used as working capital to buy spare parts. This is his third loan with our institution. He has loans with other financial institutions. Justino is a long-standing client with other financial institutions and has been a client of AgroCapital for 20 months.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Flor De Vida Group

texts.es: En el Centro Focal “Villa Adela” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Flor de vida” con 13 integrantes, todas tienen diferentes negocios como; venta de medias, juguetes, detergentes, fruta, carne y otros, ellas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería y así tener mayor movimiento económico, solo como ejemplo Julia M. necesita el préstamo para diversificar sus productos, ahora quiere comprar deportivos porque  ha visto que tiene más demanda.
texts.en:
In the community center of Villa Adela, you will find the “Flor de Vida” communal bank group with its 13 members. All of them have different retail businesses: socks, toys, detergents, fruit, meat and other items. They need a loan to purchase merchandise and improve their cash flow.

One example is Julia M., who needs a loan to diversify her inventory of products. She wants to buy sportswear since it is in great demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en: Simaila is involved in the sale of dry goods as well as soap production. She has been in the business for the past four years in the Bassa town area. Simaila is a primary school dropout. She is married with four children ranging in age from 2 months – 10 years, with no dependent. One of her children is in the 2nd grade. She says her dream is to have a bigger business and to be able to educate all of her children.

loans.use: To buy additional goods and soap making products

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia U. is from the village of D'BAN. She is 56 years old. Antonia is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Antonia owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Antonia has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2002, Antonia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Antonia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Antonia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria G. is 50 years old and she is married to Wilson. They are blessed with four children: Gloran John, 23 years, a graduate of a two year course; Glowil John, 21 years old, a graduate of a Hotel and Restaurant Management course; Gerald John, 15 years old, 3rd year high school student, and Glenn John, 10 years old, grade IV.

Gloria owns a tricycle unit where her husband serves as the driver. Aside from that she also sells frozen foods, fish, and meat. She would like to improve her business because she wants to provide for all the needs of her family.

Both Gloria and Wilson are doing all their best so that they can send their two younger children to school. With the additional support of PHP18000 from Kiva lenders, they will be able to maintenance their motorcycle and her vending business.

loans.use: Additional Capital.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
Anastasio es productor de leche de vaca, misma que  comercializa a la empresa PIL (Planta Industrializadora de Leche); esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con  que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos. Vive en la comunidad de Achacachi, Provincia Omasuyos ( a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito lo destinará para comprar alimentos (Forraje) para los ganados que producen leche.
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por el cliente.
texts.en:
Anastasio works in a dairy producing milk that is sold by PIL (Planta Industrializadora de Leche). This business is his primary source of income to cover the household expenses of his three children. He lives in the community of Achacachi, in the province of Omasuyos, three hours away from the city of La Paz. He will use the loan to buy fodder for the milk cows. This is his third loan with Impro whose evaluation process has approved the loan requested by Anastasio.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fodder for milk cows

loans.name: Mariana Azucena

texts.es: Mariana Azucena esta solicitando su 5to crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para repellar la habitación  en su casa,    y asi mejorar las condiciones del hogar, vive en la zona # 6, trabaja en el instituto Rubèn Dario desde hace 20 años como docente de Español, ama su trabajo,   es una profesional muy responsable, honesta, ha demostrado  buena conducta y moral crediticia,  tiene dos hijas la mayor tiene 17 años estudia su quinto año de educaciòn secundaria y la menor de 13 años de edad estudia su sexto grado de educaciòn primaria, a pesar que no ha tenido la ayuda del papà de sus hijas  ella ha luchado para que a sus dos hijas no le falte nada,  ellos son una familia muy unida y todos comparten con los gastos familiares,  Mariana con el crédito anterior logro satisfactoriamente construir una habitación para una mejor comodidad, aspira tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, tener estabilidad laboral y salud.
texts.en:
Mariana Azucena is requesting her 5th loan from AFODENIC to repair a room in her house, and this way improve the conditions in her home. She lives in zone #6, she has worked in the Ruben Dario institute for 20 years as a Spanish teacher. She loves her work; she is a very responsible and honest worker. She has shown good behavior and credit history. She has two daughters; the oldest is 17 years old and studies the 5th grade of high school and the youngest is 13 years old and is in the 6th grade. Even though she hasn't gotten any help from the father of the girls, she has fought so that her two daughters have everything they need. They are a very closely knit family and they all share their family expenses. With the previous loan, Mariana managed to succesfully build a room for greater comfort. She aspires to have a home with better conditions, work stability and health.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair a room

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 30 years old and married without a child. She owns a bakery along with her husband and has been in the business since eight years.

Patricia is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more bags of flour and an oven for baking. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase an oven and bags of flour for baking

loans.name: Heroina Del Consuelo

texts.es: Heroína Consuelo R. S. tiene 52 años, hace más de 13 años que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de raspado. Este un helado típico que se vende a un precio accesible y su elaboración es muy fácil. Además  ella labora como docente en un colegio público, pero sus ingresos no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos necesarios de su familia, es por eso que acude a esta actividad económica que inicio vendiendo estos productos de manera ambulante en las calles, por lo que ha ido creciendo poco a poco hasta ahora tiene un triciclo en donde ofrece sus productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo. ella sueña con poder ofrecerle a su hijo los estudios universitarios ya que actualmente no pude ofrecerle esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Heroína Consuelo R. S. is 52 years old and has been in the shaved ice business for 13 years. This is icy treat that is sold at a reasonable price and is very easy to make. She is also a docent at a public school, but her income isn’t enough to cover her family’s expenses, which is why she began selling her products as a mobile vendor. Her business has grown little by little, and now has a tricycle from which she sells her shaved ice. The financing she is requesting will go towards working capital. Her dream is to provide her son with a university education, as she cannot currently afford to provide him with one.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: C2554 Twungubumwe 2 Group

texts.en:
Beatha is 35 years old, married with 2 children, aged 3 and 7 years. Beatha operates the business of selling foodstuffs at Kabuga, which is just under an hour's drive from Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.  A proven entrepreneur, she has been the president of a group called “TWUNGUBUMWE 2” since 2001. The hours of their business require that they work from 8 AM to 10 PM every day.

This group is requesting its first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their business through purchasing some additional foodstuffs that are in demand like potatoes and groundnuts. With this additional business, this group hopes that their life will change progressively as they can make more money through their efforts, continue to pay school fees for their children, and set aside some savings for their futures.

loans.use: A VARIETY OF AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTS

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana, age 47, is an entrepreneur who raises pigs. She is married to Rito and has 4 children. She also sells vegetables to earn additional income. She would like to buy additional pigs and more feed for her pig business. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. because she has limited capital.

Rosana has requested a loan of 15,000 Php. This loan will enable her to continue raising pigs and earn income for her family.

loans.use: Pigs and feed

loans.name: Naty Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Naty es socia del Banco Comunal “Lupakas” desD. hace 3 años atrás, del distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao, departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 50 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 6 hijos,  D. los cuales 4 viven con ella. Estudió Primaria completa. Cuenta con una tienda D. abarrotes y paralelamente se dedica a la compra y venta D. animales y venta D. sogas.
Naty nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital y comprar sogas en fardo.
Ella solicitará un crédito D. S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar una vaca.
Su sueño para el futuro es comprar un tractor y tener su capital propio.
Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y la puntualidad que existe.
texts.en:
Naty has been a member of the “Lupakas” communal bank for the past 3 years. It is in the Pilcuyo district, in the El Collao province, in the department of Puno. She is 50 years old, married, and has 6 children, 4 of which live with her. She completed primary school. She has a grocery store, buys and sells animals, and sells ropes.

Naty tells us that with her first loan at Movimiento Manuela Ramos, which was for 300 PEN, she was able to increase her capital and purchase ropes in bundles.

She is asking for a loan of 2500 PEN, with which she will be able to purchase a cow. Her dream is to purchase a tractor and to have her own capital. What she likes most about her communal bank are the meetings and the punctuality that exists.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Nelly tiene 40 años, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos dos de sus hijos dependen de ella. Jose Luis tiene 18 años, y Floriana tiene 12 años y ambos estudian. La socia Nelly es natural de la ciudad de Urubamba departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI” de la Asociación Arariwa. La socia desde muy temprano del día hace sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno para su esposo y sus hijos, limpiar la casa y cocinar para el almuerzo. La socia después de hacer sus actividades del hogar tiene que cocinar para los obreros que trabajan en la reconstrucción del monumento arqueológico de “Huayna Cute” que se encuentra a dos horas de la ciudad de Urubamba. Nuestra socia nos cuenta que hace un año atrás se dedicaba al negocio de venta de artesanía y lo dejo el negocio. Nuestra socia en el mes de marzo del año 2010 va retomar su negocio de venta de artesanía y por ese motivo requiere el préstamo para comprar artesanía que lo va trae de las ciudades del Cusco y Ayacucho y después va distribuir a los comerciantes minoristas de las ciudades de Ollaytaytambo, Pisaq, Calca y Machupicchu.

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

La ciudad de Urubamba se encuentra a 78 Km. de la Ciudad del Cusco aproximadamente a una hora y media de viaje. La ciudad de Urubamba se halla en el corazón del Valle Sagrado. En la época prehispánica fue un centro agrícola muy importante.
texts.en:
Nely is 40, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Two of her children are dependent upon her. Jose Luis is 18, and Floriana is 12. Both of them go to school. Nelly is from the city of Urubamba in the Cusco department. She belongs to the José Carlo Mariategui Communal Bank with the Arariwa Association. She starts her day very early. She does the household chores like making breakfast for her husband and children, cleaning house, and cooking lunch. After her household chores, she has to cook for the workers who work on the reconstruction of the Huayna Cute archeological monument, which is two hours from the city of Urubamba. She says that a year ago she sold handicrafts, and she left the business. In the month of March of 2010 she will restart her business of selling handicrafts. That is why she needs a loan in order to buy handicrafts in the cities of Cusco and Ayacucho. Later she will distribute them to retail merchants in the cities of Ollaytaytambo, Pisaq, Calca, and Machupicchu. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time. The city of Urubamba is 78 kilometers from the city of Cusco, which is approximately an hour and a half trip. The city of Urubamba can be found in the heart of the Sacred Valley. In the Prehispanic era it was the most important agricultural center.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy handicrafts

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma A. is from the village of Langcata-on, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is married and has five school-aged children. Elma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Elma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. Elma is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 5th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 58 years old and is divorced with 4 children. She is a friendly and hard-working woman. She sells foodstuffs like bags of garri (cassava flakes) to make a living. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to sell at wholesale prices to her customers in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell.

loans.name: Somaia

texts.en:
Somaia is a hardworking mother who takes care of her two sons and one daughter, who are respectively eight, six and five years old. She works in a sewing workshop to help her husband who is an employee of the Palestinian Medical Relief to afford household expenses.

Somaia and her husband managed to start building their own house in their home city of Jenin and this consumes most of their income; so Somaia thought of taking a $3,000 loan from FATEN to cover the last payment they have to make in order to have the house completed.

The family is hoping to move in to the new house as soon as possible, Somaia and her husband are the ones in the picture above leaving FATEN's office in Jineen.

loans.use: To complete the construction of her house

loans.name: Howard Joel

texts.es:
Este joven tiene 28 años de edad, es casado, con tres hijos, los tres son menores de edad, aún no están en edad escolar, vive en un municipio llamado Posoltega de donde son originarios su señora y él, trabaja en la Alcaldía de este municipio desde hace cuatro años desempeñándose como Responsable de Administración Tributaria, su esposa trabaja en la casa en un pequeños negocio que juntos llevan a cabo, el negocio consiste en un Ciber y Juego de Nintendo. 

Los dos primeros créditos otorgados fueron para compra de equipos para el negocio y ampliación del mismo, este último es para realizar mejoras en el local, como repello de paredes y puesta del piso de cerámica.

En los dos créditos otorgados anteriormente este joven ha sido muy responsable.
texts.en:
This young man is 28 years old, married, and has three dependent children who are not yet in school. He lives in the town of Posoltega, which is where he and his wife are originally from. Howard has been working for the municipal government for four years and serves as the Head of Tax Administration. His wife manages a small business at home that they started together. It consists of a cyber-café and a Nintendo game parlor.

The first two loans he received were used to buy equipment for the business and pay for expansion costs. This latest loan will be used to improve his home by plastering the walls and installing a ceramic floor. Howard was very responsible with his two previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to plaster the walls of his house and install a ceramic floor

loans.name: Nakigalala South Ilado Dorothy Group

texts.en:
I. Dorothy is a 30-year-old married mother of two children, one of whom attends school. She also looks after one dependant who is in school as well.
Dorothy is a hardworking businesswoman who has a retail shop that she has been running for over two years. She is using her loan to purchase retail items, such as sugar, soap, salt, cooking oil and so forth, for resale. She is an encouraging businesswoman whose dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as sugar, soap, salt, cooking oil and so forth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng S., 55, is married and resides with her husband and three children. They live in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She raises pigs for an income of about USD $5 per day. Her husband sells sugar cane juice, earning an income of USD $5.90 per day to help cover the family's expenses.  

S. has requested a loan of USD $300 to purchase a machine to squeeze sugar cane juice. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits from the loan to make repairs to her house. This is her fourth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva Field Partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband is pictured at CREDIT's office in Kampong Chnang.

loans.use: To buy a machine to squeeze sugar cane juice

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with six children and two of her children go to school. Rose takes care of additional family members. She deals in local gin, which she gets from the districts of Fort Portal, Kasese, Kabarole and Kyenjojo in southwestern Uganda.  She uses public transport to and from buying local gin  (alcohol). She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of local gin. She has been in this business for 20 years. Besides this liquor business, she also owns rental rooms near her home. Rose sells at wholesale only. Rose works seven days a week. Her business challenges include transportation and the rainy season. She aspires to buy a plot of land and build other rental houses. She joined MCDT because it was near home.

loans.use: To buy more local gin (alcohol)

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La  Sra. Juliana es separada y tiene 2 hijas quienes aún son menores, están cursando la escuela primaria.
Juliana se dedica a la venta en forma ambulante, vende frazadas, sabanas, toallas y un poco de ropas.
Ella se inició hace varios años con muy poca mercadería cuando aún estaba casada  poco a poco fue aumentando con el pasar de los años.
 Hoy día ella tiene muchas mercaderías y bien surtidos, y ademas pudo abrir un negocio en su casa con una  clientela  bien formada.
Ella es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que va a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de un golodinas, panificados, carne para preparar comestibles para la venta.
texts.en:
Juliana is separated and has two minor children in primary school. She is a traveling saleswoman of blankets, sheets, towels, and some clothing. She started several years ago with very little merchandise while she was still married. Little by little she grew her business over the years. Today she is well stocked with lots of merchandise, and she was able to open a business in her house with a well formed clientele. She is a very responsible person with hopes of getting ahead. She has a cheerful, enterprising spirit that will no doubt achieve all her goals. She is soliciting a loan for the purchase of sweets, baked goods, and meat to prepare food to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweets, baked goods, meat, sausages

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
N. Edith has, for the last five years, been running her salon business in Mulago, Kampala. What has been winning for her in terms of attracting customers in the course of these years has been her good line of conduct.

For this married mother of four, having a well-educated family is a top priority. With profits from her business, she has strained every nerve to do this. In a month, she earns 450,000 shillings as profits and, with this loan, she is anticipating a favorable turn in her current circumstances as she carries conviction she will be able to buy new equipment like weavers for her saloon.

loans.use: To purchase newer equipment like weavers and hairdryers for her salon

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: Odile M. est une femme de 51 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois des femmes Catholiques de Tambacounda depuis son inauguration le 27 juin 2008. Elle en a reçu 04 crédits qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés sans difficulté. Elle est teinturière et son nouveau prêt lui permettra de d'acheter des tissus et de intrants pour les teindre. Après les avoir teints, elle confectionne des draps de lit pour ensuite les revendre par pièce. Les bénéfices générés à partir de cette activité lui permettent de participer financièrement à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Odile M. is 51 years old, married, and the mother of one dependent child. She has been a member of the Tambacounda Catholic Women's Banc Villageois since it was created on June 27 2008. She has received four loans from the Banc Villageois, all of which she has managed very well and repaid without any problems. She dyes fabric, and this new loan will allow her to buy fabric and ingredients for the dyes. She makes bed sheets and sells them individually. The profit generated from this activity will allow her to contribute financially to an improvement in the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and ingredients to make dyes

loans.name: Razelou

texts.en: Razelou Y. is a single woman who lives in Sitio Suba, Barangay Looc, Malabuyoc, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a gasoline retailing business. Razelou joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past twelve loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,256, thus, uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, Razelou is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use to expand her gasoline retailing business so that she can continue to save for her family and have additional savings for future use. Razelou is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad lives in Bint Jbeil, Lebanon, where the majority of people work in tourism, tobacco farming, and agriculture. Eight months ago, Mohamad opened a restaurant called “Jabal El Sheikh”, which is located in the Villages Public Arena. He can be found in his restaurant 7 days a week, from 7 in the morning until late in the evening, or until the food runs out. 

In addition to sandwiches, Mohamad attracts people to his restaurant through “Arguileh”, a type of hookah or waterpipe, which is a single or multi-stemmed (often glass-based) instrument for smoking tobacco in which the smoke is cooled and filtered by passing through water. Originally from India, hookah has gained popularity around the world.

This is Mohamad’s second time requesting a loan from Al Majmoua and he has demonstrated responsibility and kindness. A constant flow of customers visit his restaurant and business picks up at breakfast time, lunchtime and dinnertime. With the loan Mohamad hopes to receive, he will buy extra tables and chairs in addition to primary material for “Ramadan” the Holy month, since work becomes very active at this time. At the moment, his restaurant is well equipped with the basic necessities. He would like to use the money from this loan in a positive progressive way.

loans.use: Tol buy extra tables and chairs.

loans.name: Ingrid Cinthya

texts.es:
Ingrid de 22 años, tiene una tienda de víveres, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, cuando murió el papa de Ingrid le heredo la tienda para que ella pueda solventar sus gastos, pero como era pequeño su mama la administraba hasta ahora que ella creído. 

Ella trabaja desde las 06h30 hasta las 23h00pm todos los días, vende arroz, bebidas, aceite, huevos etc. Ella quiere ampliar la tienda, para que los ingresos le ayuden a estudiar. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, bloques y pintura para ampliar la tienda, en el futuro quiere tener un Minimarket y poder estudiar.
texts.en:
Ingrid is 22 years old and has a store where she sells provisions. She lives in the urban area of Suburbio de Guayaquil. When her father passed away, Ingrid inherited the store so that she would be able to cover her expenses. However, she was still young at the time, so her mother managed the business until she was old enough to run it herself.

Ingrid works every day from 6:30am to 11pm. She sells rice, beverages, oil, eggs, and other products. She wants to expand her store so that she can generate income to help pay for school.

With this loan she plans to buy cement, blocks, and paint so that she can expand her store. In the future, she wants to open a mini-market and continue her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement, blocks, and paint so that she can expand her store

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: El Sr. José Luis
texts.en: Mr. José Luis

loans.use: To buy a steer.

loans.name: Tinei

texts.en:
Tinei P., 45, is married and the mother of six children.  She owns a business venture: planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has three years of experience in this business and needs a loan of 1500 Talas to buy farm supplies and equipment.  Tinei plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated $162 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2007, Tinei joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tinei's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Sandra María

texts.es: La señora L. D. es trabajadora de Fundación León 2000, labora como analista de crédito, ella con su ingreso logra sufragar los gastos de su menor hija quien está en edad escolar, ahorita esta señora se acerca a CEPRODEL a solicitar un crédito para realizar unos pagos personales
texts.en: Mrs. L. D. is a hard-working employee of Fundación León 2000, and she works as a loan analyst. With her income, she has been able to pay for the expenses of her younger sister, who is in school. At this time, she is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL for personal expenses.

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma  is from the village of Dullan, Aloran, Mis. Occ. She is 57 years old. Thelma is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Thelma  is a dealer in dried fish and longanisa (sausages). Thelma has been in this business for about  5 years and earns approximately  3,000 PHP a month for this activity. 

In 2008, Thelma  joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC amounting to PHP 12,000. Thelma  is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used for her dried fish and longanisa business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Thelma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional Capital for the business

loans.name: Salvadora De Jesús

texts.es: La señora Salvadora de Jesús Z. es trabajadora de la alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña en el área de limpieza pública tiene de trabajar cinco años y su financiamiento lo solicito para hacerle una mejora a su casa ya que compro unos zinc que le vendían a precio favorable para reparar la parte del baño de su casa en la  entrevista que tuvimos con ella nos manifestó que los financiamientos que le hemos brindado le han servido de mucho porque con estos ha mejorado su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Salvadora de Jesús works in public cleaning at the Chinandega town hall, where she has been for five years.  She is requesting her loan to make housing improvements since she bought zinc sheets that they sold to her at a good price to repair part of the bathroom of her house.  In our interview with her, she told us that the loans that we have provided to her have been of much use because with them, she has improved her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: Consumption - to buy zinc sheets for her house

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María Estela Vallejo tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera tiene un hijo pequeño que aun depende económicamente de ella. Vive en su propia casa que está situada en el Barrio 4 Potrero picada Pyta.

La señora María Estela es propietaria de un salón de belleza en el centro mismo de la ciudad de Encarnación, ella es peluquera y se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela que concurre diariamente a su local para realizarse lavados, peinados, color y otros. Gracias a esta actividad ella puede educar a su hijo, mantener su hogar y solventar cualquier gasto imprevisto que se le pudiera presentar. 

Ella ha solicitado este crédito para la compra de mas insumos para su peluquería.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Stela Vallejo is 30 years old, she is a single mother and has a young child who is her dependant. She lives in her own house located at 4 Potrero Picada Pyta.

Mrs. Vallejo has a beauty salon in the center of the city Encarnacion. She has been a beautician for several years and has a lot of costumers. They go to her shop regularly for shampoo, hairstyling and coloring. She is able to provide for her son, her household and to take care of unforeseen expenses thanks to her shop.

Mrs. Vallejo is requesting this loan to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Renacer 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Rosa is the coordinator of her group Renacer 1 & 2 (Reborn). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and 6 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to work hard for her children. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying reading the Bible. 

Rosa is excited to be taking her 2nd loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for a month, starting with some saving she had. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying chickens for her chicken butcher shop. She will use the profits to finish her house and to invest in her business. She dreams of having a farm. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wants to improve her economic situation and to go forward with her business, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and intermittent electricity.

loans.use: to buy chickens to butcher

loans.name: Manyi Development Group-Lugazi

texts.en: 43 year old Norah N. is affliated with Manyi Development Group-Lugazi. She has been operating a poultry enterprise in Nyamwezi for ten years. She says she began this business with her own savings from an erstwhile clothes selling business. Painstakingly, she has with determination and conviction made good strides in establishing and obtaining a firm footing for her business over these years. Norah is happily married with 8 kids and she says weekly her profits measure up to UGX 90,000. She says with this loan she is going to buy more chicks.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa Argentina L. de 30 años es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de calzado desde hace 5 años. En la actualidad aprovechando la temporada invertirá en juegos pirotécnicos.
Ella tiene la meta de mejorar su negocio y seguir creciendo.
texts.en: Rosa Argentina L. is 30 years old.  She is a hard-working and enterprising woman who has been selling footwear for 5 years.  She would currently like to take advantage of the season and invest in buying fireworks.  Her goal is to improve her business and continue growing.

loans.use: To buy fireworks

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester T. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 37 years old. Ester is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Ester owns and operates a retail store, selling ready-to-wear clothing like blouses and shirts, in the local community. Ester has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Ester joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ester has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and fund working capital. 

Ester is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, such as blouses. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ester from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Martha De Fátima

texts.es:
En las Oficinas de ENACAL del municipio de Masaya, del Departamento de Masaya labora la señora Martha de Fátima T. C. desde hace 4 años como conserje, con este humilde y digno salario la señora sufraga los gastos de sus tres menores hijos de los que provee de educación, sustentos y otros.

En estos momentos la señora T. C. no quiere perder la oportunidad de iniciar un negocio en su casa de habitación por el cual ella está tomando la decisión de visitar las oficinas de CEPRODEL a solicitar un crédito y de esta forma dar inicio a sus sueños.

Cabe mencionar que la señora tiene expectativas que con este negocio nuevo que inicie podrá darles un mejor nivel de vida a sus menores y forjarle un futuro digno y provechoso.
texts.en:
Martha de Fátima T. C. has worked for the past four years as a caretaker at the ENACAL offices in the municipality of Masaya within the department of Masaya. With this humble and decent salary, she defrays the costs for her three young children’s education, food, and other items.

At this time, Ms. T. C. does not want to miss the opportunity to start a business in her house. This is why she is making the decision to visit the CEPRODEL offices to request a loan to begin her dreams.

It is worth mentioning that she expects that with this new business, she will be able to provide her children with a better quality of life and to create a decent and profitable future for herself.

loans.use: Investment in a new business

loans.name: Duo Rosa De Saron Group

texts.es:
Duo Rosa D. Saron: Griselda D. los Angeles S. D. L. C.,es D. treinta y cinco años D. edad(35 años)tiene dos hijos pequeños elL. tiene su negocio desD. hace 10 años elL. venD. productos comestibles D. primera nesecidad, nos cuenta que le a hido bien en su negocio, que dia en dia ba creciendo mas,elL. venD. es su tienda,Arroz,frijol,azucar,sal,pastas,huevos,tomate,seboya,papas,etc, ahora elL. solicita su credito para surtir mas su negocio y tener mas bariedad en productos comestibles D. primera nesecidad,o comprar su mercaderia por mayor y asi lograr aumentar su ganacia.
doña Haydee N. L.,es D. 40 años D. edad tiene 3 hijos pequeños,elL. D. dedica a L. venta D. tortillas los tres tiempos,elL. se dedica a esta actividad desD. hace 3 años elL. solicita este credito para L. compra D. maiz y leña por mayor, elL. nos cuenta que quiere comprar por mayor ya que por este tiempo baja D. precio.
El maiz baja D. precio porque hay cosecha, y L. leña tabien baja D. precio porque es verano, elL. espera que fape le pueda ayudar y asi pueda aumentar su ganacia.
texts.en:
Rose of Sharon Duo: 

Griselda D. los Ángeles S. D. L. C., 35, has two small children.   She’s had her business for 10 years.  She sells basic need foodstuffs.  She tells us that she’s done well in her business and every day she grows more.  She stocks rice, beans, sugar, salt, pastas, eggs, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, etc. in her store.  Now she needs a loan to stock the store more and have a wider variety of groceries or to buy her merchandise at wholesale thus increasing her profits.

Haydee N. López, 40, has three small children.  She sells tortillas in three shifts.  She’s been in this line of work for three years.  She is asking for the loan to buy corn and firewood at wholesale.  She tells us that she wants to buy at wholesale because that’s the time when the price is lower.  Corn prices drop because of the harvest and the firewood’s price drops too because it’s summer.  She hopes that Fape will help her so that her profits will increase.

loans.use: To buy groceries and to buy corn and firewood at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more used clothes

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario C., a CCT* community partner, aims to go against the common notion of mediocrity with regard to her business. AT 48, she is single and focuses her energy on being a micro-entrepreneur. Rosario has reached college and is complementing her knowledge with the encouragement she receives from fellowships in CCT. She presently resides in Dasmarinas, Cavite.

Rosario has operated a sari-sari (variety) store for five years. She adapts well to the trends in her neighborhood, knowing which popular brands of food, shampoo, drinks and other products people want. Because of her expertise in this field, she is able to earn PHP 10,000 monthly.

Rosario knows she can do more to produce more. She is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to help her develop her business. She intends to use this loan to buy more quantities of quality merchandise. She knows that having a lot of stock will attract more customers to her store. Rosario is doing everything possible to see her business grow and stabilize because she wants to become successful in life, be it on a personal or business level.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stock

loans.name: Zamira's Group

texts.en:
Zamira T., the 41-year-old leader of this group, resides in the small village of Kochkor, where the major activity of local residents is farming. Zamira is a high-school teacher, and with the help of her children she has time to run a cattle-breeding business which earns up to three-quarters of her family budget. Since starting the enterprise in the 1990s, the family has improved its financial state tremendously. However, their monthly income of 5000 soms is not enough to cover all costs. The loan from Kiva will be used to purchase additional livestock and broaden the business.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and has three children.

In 2000, Firas opened a nursery. He sells seedlings and all kind of trees (seasonal, perennial). He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He is requesting $2500 loan to buy a large water pump and to increase sales. He aspires for a better future through good financial returns.

loans.use: To buy a large water pump and to increase sales.

loans.name: Daveiva Jacqueline

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz De América.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Daveiva, tiene 36 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 21, 17, 10  años y  un bebé 4 meses, los mayores estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela. El marido es comerciante  de carne.
 
Ella se dedica al comercio en general, tiene una papelería y bazar en su casa, también allí vende helados y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 19h00. Sus productos compra en Guayaquil y también recibe mercadería en su local de otras partes. Nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio por diez años y que le ha ido bastante bien. Hace poco  empezó a vender ropa americana y ha tenido bastante acogida entre sus clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar artículos de bazar, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 13 años y es una de las fundadoras del banco.
 
Su sueño es agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the “Luz De América” meet in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, and known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarinds.

Here we meet Daveiva.  She is 36 years old, is in a live in relationship, and has four children, ages 21, 17, 10, and a 4 year old baby; the oldest study at university, high school, and elementary school.  Her husband is a butcher.

She sells general merchandise and has a paper goods store in her home.  She also sells ice cream and Yanbal brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories), and works daily from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm.  She buys her products in Guayaquil and also receives local merchandise and things from other.  She’s been doing this for ten years and things have gone very well for her.  A short time ago she began selling American clothing and has had lots of demand from her customers 

This loan is so that she can buy more paper products, perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing.  She has been a part of the communal bank for 13 years and is one of the founding members.

She hopes to be able to add onto her business.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her business

loans.name: Kenia

texts.es:
Kenia tiene 19 años de edad, ella es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres quienes la apoyan en todas sus actividades. Ellos residen en un caserío llamado el Pedregal bajo a 15 kilómetros del  en el distrito de Tambogrande  en el departamento de  Piura.

Kenia  se dedica a Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores y aves de corral, y ovinos (ovejas), los cría en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta en su mercado local. Esta actividad  la realiza hace 2 años los que ha  podido adquirir experiencia en el rubro y en los ya cuenta con clientela fija.  

Kenia esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para que pueda comprar alimentos para el engorde de ganado ovino y aves de corral de esta manera  lograr que su negocio siga creciendo. 

Kenia es una clienta nueva  para Edpyme Alternativa. Se cuenta con muy buenas referencias de su persona, pues en su comunidad la conocen como una joven trabajadora y responsable
texts.en:
Kenia is 19, single and lives with her parents, who support her.  She lives in the town of Pedregal, which is 15 km from Tambogrande, Piura.
Kenia raises farm animals such as sheep as well as poultry, which she keeps in back of her family home until they are ready to be sold in local markets.  She has gained experience over the past 2 years in the business, and now has a growing clientele.  Kenia seeks this first time credit from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 soles to grow her business, purchasing additional farm animals and feed stock to raise them.  Kenia is well-regarded in her community, and known to be hard-working and responsible.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed stock

loans.name: G.s. El Triangulo Group

texts.es: Tamara Patricia y Lucia forman el grupo solidario El Triangulo, Tamara se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, hace mas de 7 años que tiene este negocio a pesar de su edad ha tenido una gran experiencia con sus clientes ya que son jóvenes y saben los encargos que le realizan diariamente. Ella sale todos los días a vender a sus productos desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de polvos, cremas, body, perfumes, desodorantes, pintura de labios y pintura de uñas.
texts.en: Tamara Patricia and Lucia have formed the support group known as "El Triangulo".  Tamara sells cosmetics and has been in business for seven years despite her age, and has been lucky with her customers who are young and place orders daily.  She goes out every day at 7:00 a.m. and sells her products until 9:00 p.m.  The loan will be used to buy powders, creams, perfumes, deodorants, lipstick and nail polish.

loans.use: To buy powders, creams, perfumes, deodorantes, lipstick and nail polish.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 33-year-old married lady with two children, aged 12 and 22.  

She runs a cafe to earn a living. She has sustained her business for five years because of her good reputation. So far, she has employed two people in her business.  

She hopes to open more branches of her business so that she can employ more people. She needs 20,000 KES to buy ingredients such as cooking fat, tea leaves and salt.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as cooking fat, tea leaves and salt.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Luz has a retail shop that sells vegetables and food seasonings. She has had this business for 5 years. She is a new member of HSPFI, and has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional vegetables to sell.  In the future, Luz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Cherielyn

texts.en: Cherielyn is 41 years old and lives in Plaridel. She is married with four children. Cherielyn works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. Cherielyn has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, 33 years old, is married and blessed with two children, aged 4 and 3. He is an honest and hardworking businessman. For the last 9 years, Charles has been repairing cars and selling spare parts to provide for his family's needs. In the next 5 years, he wants to go large scale to be able to realize his dream of being a landlord.

Charles is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy spare parts such as alternators, headlights, etc. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he has now become economically empowered.

loans.use: to buy spare parts such as alternators, headlights, etc.

loans.name: Ella

texts.en: Ella is 59 years old, married and has three children.
