Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mugomeh Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Mugomeh” group from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are petty businessmen who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders in order to seek a loan of SLL 1,800,000 for the entire group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Ansumana Y.. Ansumana was born in a village called Shengeh, thirty-four years ago. He is married and has three children who are between the ages of one and seven. Ansumana sells used shoes and has been in this business for fifteen years now. With his share of the loan, he will buy a bale of used shoes to add to his business.

loans.use: Buy a bale of used shoes for resale

loans.name: Zapatitos Group

texts.es:
“Zapatitos”  es un grupo de 7 señoras y 1 varón que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Collpani”,  su presidenta es Carmen A. de 43 años, trabaja con Pro Mujer hace 10 años aproximadamente, ha estado en  diferentes grupos. Carmen se dedica a la costura de prendas de vestir, especializando en chamarras, con el pasar del tiempo pudo hacer crecer su negocio y generar empleo. Carmen adquiere su mercadería de la Ceja de la ciudad de El Alto y vende sus productos en ésta misma ciudad ya que tiene un lugar de venta, además indica que le gusta compartir con sus amigas en las reuniones.
En esta oportunidad esta solicitando Bs.- 1500 para comprar tela. Las demás integrantes de ésta Asociación Comunal  tienen diversos negocios de producción, servicio y comercio.
texts.en:
“Zapatitos” (Little Shoes) is a group composed of seven women and one man who attend their meetings at the Collpani Community Center. The group president is Carmen A.. She is 43 years old and has worked with different groups within Pro Mujer for approximately 10 years.

Carmen is a seamstress who specializes in making jackets. Over time she has been able to grow her business and create jobs. Carmen acquires her supplies from the outskirts of the city of El Alto and then sells her products in the same city. She already has a place where she sells her merchandise. Carmen says she enjoys sharing with her friends during their meetings. At the moment, she is requesting 1500 BOB in order to buy fabric.

The other members of this Communal Association have different businesses in the manufacturing, service, and retail sectors.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric for making jackets

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María C. Sánchez  es una  señora de 35  años de edad quien vive con su esposo en una comunidad llamada El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías.
Desde hace muy poco tiempo doña María  ha querido desarrollarse como microempresaria, con un pequeño proyecto dedicado a la  producción de leche y algunos derivados, tales como natilla y queso. Ella vive  con su esposo, quien ha sido su mayor impulso y ayuda, asegura que entre los 2 van poder mejorar sus condiciones económicas para poder tener su primer hijo.
Dice estar muy agradecida con este proyecto, ya que le ha generado una mayor confianza, ha servido como una fuente de ingresos para mejorar sus condiciones a pesar de las dificultades económicas que hay en la región 
Actualmente María  requiere un préstamo de ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones) destinados a la  compra de una vaca lechera. Esto le permitirá aumentar la producción de leche y por ende la de sus productos los cuales aseguran ser muy demandados en la comunidad ya que son de muy buena calidad.
Doña María  es socia de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su Primer  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. Y
texts.en:
35-year old María C. Sánchez lives with her husband in a community called El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, in the the province of Cartago. It is a small rural community with a population of approximately 2,000. The local people are dairy and coffee farmers. The area is hilly and much of the land is tropical rainforest. It’s very attractive with two lovely lakes, coffee plantations, and dairies mixed in with the rainforest. In the last little while María has wanted to develop her small dairy business with a project involving milk products such as cream and cheese. Her husband has been a big support and help, and María is certain that between them they can improve their financial situation and start a family. Currently María needs a loan of 500,000 colones with which to buy a cow. This will enable her to increase milk production and other dairy products which are sure to be in great demand in the community since they are of high quality. She is a member of the Producers’ Association of El Sauce, one of the hundred member organisations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and she hopes that it will enable her to continue developing both on a personal and on an economic level.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Hum

texts.en: Hum C., 31, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorian Temples. She sells groceries at home for an income of USD 4 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 3 per day. C. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Essie

texts.fr: G. essie est une femme mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'adidogomé. en 2008, elle s'est lancée dans le commerce de charbon de bois, le charbons de bois est très utilisé au togo pour faire la cuisine. la demande actuelle de sa clientèle est élevé elle voudrait les satisfaire convenablement elle sollicite alors un crédit pour acheter 20 sacs de charbons de bois. elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la ville de tsévié.
texts.en:
G. Essie is a married woman and the mother of two children. She lives with her family in the Adidogomé district. In 2008, she started selling charcoal, which is commonly used for cooking in Togo. Her customers' demand is growing, and she would like to satisfy it properly. Therefore she is seeking a loan to purchase 20 bags of charcoal. She stocks up in the interior part of the country, in the town of Tsévie.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing bags of charcoal

loans.name: Vicente Adalberto

texts.en:
Vicente Adalberto S. N. is 22 years old. He is single and lives in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador.

Vicente is a member of the rural loan group called San Jacinto. The group consists of fifteen members, the majority of whom work in the agricultural sector.

Vicente also works in the agriculture sector, earning on average $150 per month. He does the buying and selling of his products in the nearby town of Matilde.

Vicente plans to use the loan to grow cacao (used to make chocolate).  This year, pests have destroyed much of his cacao crops. 

Vicente’s dream is to have his own house and a car. In his free time he likes to watch television and play sports.

loans.use: To grow cacao

loans.name: Development Group

texts.en: Presented to you here are members of the “Development” group. They are small-scale businesspeople in Makeni who are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 for each member of the group in order to expand their businesses. Abdulai T. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. He is 42 years old and was born in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Abdulai is married and has one child who attends primary school. For 10 years now, Abdulai has been selling palm oil, groundnut/peanuts, charcoal, etc. With his share of this loan, he will invest in his business by buying gallons of palm oil, groundnuts and charcoal to add to his current stock.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil, groundnuts and charcoal to add to his current stock

loans.name: Fely's Group

texts.en: Fely T. is from the village of Bogabongan. She is 46 years old. Fely is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are individually responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if someone is delinquent or defaults. Fely is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Fely works in someone else's business venture, selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. Fely has been engaged in this for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for it. In 2008, Fely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Fely is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Fely from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Liloy-Bogabongan, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del N

loans.name: Georgy

texts.en:
Georgy G. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. He is 33 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, he provides motorcycle (or habal-habal) services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Georgy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Justus Charo

texts.en: Justus Charo K. is a 37-year-old carpenter and proprietor of a carpentry shop in Kilifi. He is married to Mary Mwagomba and they have four children. Justus has been in this business for the last five years and has been doing great. He joined KADET a while back and this will be his second loan. He would like to purchase more timber with the loan. He also hopes to use the anticipated profit to build rental houses.

loans.use: Purchasing more timber for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase some sheets of zinc and pay for some household expenses.

loans.name: Milton Jacinto

texts.es:
Milton Jacinto L. S. tiene 44 años. Vive en Unión Libre,  vive con el compañero y con los hijos,  vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El Recreo este grupo se dedica exclusivamente a labores agrícolas especialmente a la siembra de cultivo de ciclo corto como es el maíz, arroz, soya y fréjol. Todos los socios son del mismo sector recinto San Vicente Las lomas Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos a esta ventanillas pertenecen 12 socios.

Milton se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño seguir trabajando en el negocio.
Le gusta hacer deporte
texts.en:
Milton Jacinto L. S. is 44 years old; he is in a common law marriage and lives with his partner and 4 children. They live in the Ventanas area in the Los Ríos Province.

The members of the V.R.C. El Recreo group mainly work in the agricultural field, especially growing short-cycle crops like corn, rice, soy and beans, the communal bank has 12 members. All the members are from the same area of San Vicente in Las Lomas, Cantón Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

Milton is in agriculture and has grown corn for over 3 years. He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in the markets of the same city.

Milton needs the loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his corn crops. The loan will help him to meet his financial needs. Some problems that he faces are plagues and disease and climate change. His dream is to keep working in his business.

Milton enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Angel Esteban

texts.es:
Angel Esteban A. V. tiene 45 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 5 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Angel se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 3 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  comprar casa y terreno.
Le gusta hacer deporte
texts.en:
Angel Esteban A. V. is 45 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and five children in the Ventanas settlement, located in the “de Los Ríos” province.

The members of the “UNIDOS SOMO MAS,” (United we are more) communal bank, located in Marañon, within the Puerto Pechiche parish; part of the Pueblo Viejo settlement.  This area produces short cycle crops, such as corn, beans, and rice.

Angel has specialized in raising corn, rice and beans for the past three years.  He buys his supplies at “Comercial López” in Ventanas and sells his harvest at the Ventanas marketplace.  

He is asking for this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizer.  This loan will help him to meet his financial needs.  He faces challenges, such as crop diseases and the weather.  Some day he would like to buy a house and his own house and some land.  He likes playing sports.

loans.use: Farming supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Peter Kipkosgei

texts.en:
Peter Kipkosgei K. of Eldoret, Kenya has been in motorcycle transport business for one year. He is 24 years old and is married to Stella Kosgei They have no children yet. From his transportion business, Peter earns a profit of KES.10,000 per month.

He is applying for his first loan of KES.20,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to use it to open a retail shop. He plans to invest the anticipated profits from his business in shop for his wife. 
 
In the future, Peter hopes to run a supermarket, which will enable him to provide for his family's basic needs.

loans.use: To open a retail shop.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia y su pareja son convivientes, tienen dos hijos, de 10 y 2 años de edad. Sonia invierte los préstamos que recibe en sus negocios que tiene en el mercado. Cada mes, Sonia viaja a Lima para comprar joyas como aretes y pulseras, que lleva a vender en el mercado central de Ayacucho. Sonia es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace un año, lo que más le gusta son los incentivos para ahorrar y las reuniones de su Bancomunal porque le han capacitado. Su sueño es que sus hijos asistan a la universidad y sean profesionales
texts.en: Sonia lives with a partner and their 2 children aged 10 and 2.  Sonia invests the loans she receives in the businesses that she has in the market.  Every month, Sonia travels to Lima to buy jewelry such as earrings and bracelets, which she sells in the central market of Ayacucho.  Sonia has been a member of FINCA Peru for a year, and what she likes most are the incentives to save and the meetings of her communal bank, because they have provided her with training.  Her dream is to have her children attend the university and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy jewelry in Lima

loans.name: Khankishi

texts.ru:
Khankishi R. 31 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey , starshiy iz detey uchitsya v 5 klasse a mladshiy v 3 klasse. Khankishi yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione
 vmeste so svoyey jenoy i lubimimi detmi. 
Khankishi uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom, on v svoyom obyekte  zanimayetsya pochinkoy isporchennix telefonov i v toje vremya prodayet nujniye zapchasti, shnuri dlya telefonov. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo starsheqo brata, on nauchil yeqo bit xoroshim masterom i lubit svoyu rabotu. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye tovar( telefonniye shnuri zapchasti a takje , chexli dlya telefonov).
texts.en:
Khankishi R. is thirty-one and married with two children.  The eldest is in 5th grade and the youngest in 3rd grade.  Khankishi is an IDP [Internally Displaced Person], from the city of Fuzili and he now lives in the Fuzili region with his wife and beloved children.

Khankishi has been in business now for five years fixing broken telephones in his own shop, and selling phone parts and cables.  He learned the business from his older brother, who taught him how to be proficient and to love his work.  Khankishi needs 2000 AZN to buy merchandise (telephone cables, cell phone cases and parts).

loans.use: He would like to buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Julio Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el departamento de Granada, reside el señor Julio del Carmen C. A. quien labora en ENACAL desde hace tres años y ocho meses como Fontanero, con este ingreso sostiene a su núcleo familiar el cual consta de cinco personas (esposa y sus cuatro hijos).
Este señor se sueña con una casa que les brinde todas las comodidades para que su familia se sienta bien, por tal razón ahora este señor se decidió a visitar las oficinas de CEPRODEL para solicitar un crédito para realizar el mejoramiento de la casa y así poco a poco poder ir modificándola para que cada uno de sus hijos tenga su propia habitación.
El señor está consiente que es lo mejor que puede hacer para que su familia esté bien.
texts.en:
Sr. Julio del Carmen C. A. lives in the Department of Granada. He has worked for ENACAL as a plumber for the past three years and eight months. With his income he is able to support his family that includes five individuals (his wife and four children).

This gentleman dreams of having a house that provides all of the comforts to make his family feel at home. For this reason, he decided to visit the offices of CEPRODEL to request a home improvement loan so that he can gradually remodel his house and provide each one of his children with rooms of their own.

Sr. Julio knows the best thing he can do is to keep his family well.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Quick Affairs Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a KIVA partner in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Quick Action” group. These are small business entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000.00 for each person to invest in their businesses. 

Mariatu K. is the leader of this group. Mariatu is a 45-year-old widow with 1 child in primary school. Mariatu sells fresh fish. With the help of this loan, she is going to expand her business by buying cartons of fresh fish to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish to resell

loans.name: 'harrisco' Group

texts.en:
Robert H., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of two borrowers called 'Harrisco.'  He is 46 years old, married, and has four children who are between the ages of 6 and 25 years. He is a high school graduate and a nurse aid.

For 5 years, Robert has been involved with providing medical services in Virginia Community outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his portion of this 40,000 LRD business loan to buy more drugs and medical supplies. He describes himself as a patient man whose goals are to improve his business and build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Dedeh is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more drugs and medical supplies.

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en:
Altantuya, 43, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own. Her husband is employed; her older daughter attends college while her younger two daughters go to secondary school. They have a below average standard of living. 

Altantuya used to work as a salesperson at someone else's consumer goods stall. She began operating her own stall in 2008. Now her business has become more stable and she wants to expand. She is a hardworking person who says, "Our family members want to finish the house which is currently being built. And we want to have our own store by expanding our business." She is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to purchase more clothing for her business from Erlian, a city on the Chinese border.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Annalie

texts.en: Annalie is 33 years old and is a married woman with three children. The oldest child is 8 years old. Annalie is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for nine years. Annalie works hard to provide her family with better living conditions. She also dreams for her children to go to a university and have bright futures. Annalie's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 27 years old and lives in Paynesville. She finished high school and lives with her boyfriend who is a construction contractor. They have one 7-year-old child who lives with them.
 
For three years now Amelia has been selling used clothes. She buys them in bulk by bag and says sometimes the clothes are not very good. Quality varies and there's a chance of losing money. To start her business, she took out the savings that she had through a savings club and purchased her first bag of clothes to sell.
 
Amelia has requested a loan to buy two bags of used clothes. In the future, she wants to continue studying and also wants her child to finish school.

loans.use: to buy two bags of used clothes

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Vive en casa propia en el caserío Bello Horizonte Tejedores ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuentan con los servicios básicos de agua y luz.

Desde hace más de 4 años, gana la vida vendiendo ropa para niños y damas. Realiza sus ventas recorriendo caseríos cercanos tomando pedidos de sus clientes y repartiendo la mercadería. Ya cuenta con una clientela establecida. El destino del crédito será para la compra de prendas de vestir para entregar a clientes por pedidos realizados. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1200 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Con esta inversión, logrará seguir creciendo en su negocio y mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia. 

Celia es una cliente conocida para Edpyme Alternativa. Este préstamo será su segundo con la institución y canceló su primero de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Celia is 37 years old, married and has two children. They live in their own home in the village of Bello Horizonte Tejedores in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural zone in the Piura region. It is more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She lives in the rural part of the district and they don't have basic services like water and electricity.

For more than four years, she has earned a living selling clothing for women and kids. She goes to nearby neighborhoods taking orders from customers and delivering merchandise. She already has an established customer base. The loan will be used to purchase articles of clothing to deliver to the customers to meet their requests. For this reason, she has asked for a loan of 1200 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. With this investment, she will continue growing her business and improving her family's quality of life. 

Celia is a known client of Edpyme Alternativa. This will be her second loan with the institution and she paid of her first loan on time.

loans.use: to buy more articles of clothing to meet the requests of her customers

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando P. tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y aun no tiene hijos a su cuidado. Él vive en la zona de Cerro Verde de la ciudad de Cochabamba en la casa de sus queridos padres. Fernando es una persona que proviene de una familia humilde. El trabajo desde muy joven para que algún día pudiera comprarse un vehículo propio.

Fernando trabaja como como chofer de taxi todos los días y fue hasta ahora que ha logrado ahorrar un monto de dinero para que pueda comprarse un vehículo propio y así mejore su nivel de vida mejorando sus ingresos.
Por ello Fernando necesita el préstamo para que compre un vehículo ya que el dinero que tiene no le fue suficiente. Él está muy agradecido con la gente que por medio de Kiva le puede dar la oportunidad de contar con una herramienta de trabajo propia.

Fernando entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para que compre un mejor vehículo y así brinde un mejor servicio a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Fernando P. is 27 years old, single and does not have any children yet in his care.  He lives in Cochabamba’s Cerro Verde zone in his beloved parents’ house.  Fernando comes from a humble family.  He’s worked since a very young age so that he could buy his own vehicle.

Fernando works every day as a Taxi Driver and has managed to save up an amount of money to buy a car of his own to improve his standard of living earning higher income.

But Fernando needs a loan to buy the car because what he has saved up isn’t quite enough.  He is very grateful to the people who through Kiva will give him the opportunity to have a work tool of his own.

Among Fernando’s future plans is taking out another loan to buy a better car in order to provide still better service to society.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Fanny Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señora. Fanny es socia del banco comunal Santa Ana, vive en la parroquia de Santa Ana, esta parroquia es de clima frió, tiene una hermosa vista de la ciudad de Cuenca y de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo varias actividades.

Doña Fanny tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 16, 11 y 6 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en la escuela. Su esposo es chofer profesional y tiene su propio bus en el que trabaja, tienen casa propia que es el fruto del trabajo conyugal.

La Señora. Fanny se dedica a la cría y venta de animales como: pollos y cerdos que son para su consumo y también los vende en su comunidad cuando tiene  alguna necesidad económica. Hace un mes está trabajando como empleada domestica medio día y de lunes a viernes.
 
El dinero de su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento.

Su sueño es no tener deudas.
texts.en:
Fanny is a member of the communal bank Santa Ana. She lives in the community of Santa Ana. It is a cold climate district and it has a beautiful view of the city of Cuenca and the natural surroundings. The population is made up of livestock farmers and agriculturists. Many work in the city in various business activities.

Fanny is 38 years old, married, and she has 3 children, aged 16, 11, and 6. Her eldest son is in high school and her two youngest are in primary school. Her husband is a professional driver and he has his own bus with which to work. They have a house of their own, a product of their combined effort.

Fanny raises and sells livestock, such as: poultry and pigs.  They are for their own consumption and she also sells them to the community when they have the financial need. She has been working as a janitor for the past month, working half days from Monday to Friday. 

The funds from her new loan will be invested in the purchase of poultry and their feed.

Her dream is to no longer have debts.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and their feed.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old married man and the father of two school-age children. He is from Lebanon. He opened a juice and cocktail shop in 1986. His freshly prepared goods are enjoyed by members of his town and its surroundings. Lebanon is known for its multiple seasons so there is always a variety of fruit during the year. He is the main income provider of the family.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his business by purchasing additional merchandise and renovating his shop in order to attract more clients. This will be his second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise and renovate his shop

loans.name: Viilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma, 48, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Diomedes, a policeman, and mother to her children. At this time, she is working hard continually to provide income for their everyday expenses

Vilma operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one or two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Aside from the food stall, she has a variety store. She earns a minimum of PHP 1466 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 17,000 loan. She will be using the loan to have her stall renovated and buy a freezer. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Vilma dreams of being able to give all her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to open a branch of her food stall. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to renovate her stall and buy a freezer

loans.name: Sedjro-Kpon Group

texts.fr: SEDJRO-KPON est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la  présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Solange Félicité. Les membres du groupe appartiennent à la même famille et vivent dans le même quartier. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Solange Félicité a 45 ans et vit au Bénin. Solange Félicité est mariée à un magasinier du nom de Magloire. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et ne vivant plus avec eux. Après avoir arrêté l’école au secondaire, Solange Félicité a commencé depuis près de six ans la vente des ustensiles de cuisine. A côté de cette activité, Solange Félicité vend de la friperie. Solange Félicité s'approvisionne dans l'un des marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à ainsi assurer les diverses charges de la famille. Ce troisième prêt permettra certainement à Solange Félicité et aux autres membres du groupe SEDJRO-KPON, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
Sedjro-Kpon is a group composed of three people whose president (who is raising her hand in the picture) is named Solange Félicité. The group members belong to the same family and live in the same neighborhood. To increase their working capital, this group is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the third time.
Solange Félicité is 45 years old and lives in Benin. Solange Félicité is married to a shopkeeper named Magloire. The couple has four children, who all went to school, and no longer live with them. Having left school in middle school, Solange Félicité started selling kitchen utensils six years ago. In addition to this activity, Solange Félicité sells second-hand clothes. She procures her goods from one of Benin's markets. This activity generates revenues which help her contribute to the family's various expenses.
This third loan will definitely allow Solange Félicité and the other members of group Sedjro-Kpon to raise their level of activity and to grow their clientele and sales.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Aïsseta

texts.fr:
Mme Aïsseta est marié et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 03ans.02 vont à l’école et elle a 04 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend des pagnes depuis 20ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé au TOGO. Ses clients sont les agents de la Splendide Hôtel et les personnes ambulantes car elle est vendeuse ambulante.

Avec cet argent, Mme veut s’acheter 01balle de pagnes.

Elle utilise ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Mme ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique de pagnes et veut scolariser ses enfants pour un meilleur avenir.
texts.en:
Mme Aïsseta is married and the mother of 3 children, aged between 20 and 3. 2 of the children go to school, and she is responsible for 4 people. 

For the last 20 years, she has been selling "pagnes" (colorful African cloth). She obtains her supplies in Lomé, Togo. Her customers are guests of the Hotel Splendide and passers-by, as she is a walking salesperson. 

With the money from the loan, she wants to buy 1 bale of "pagnes." The profit will be used to increase her activity. She also has the goal of opening a large store and educating her children, for a better future.

loans.use: to buy one bale of "pagnes" (colorful African cloth).

loans.name: Damira

texts.ru:
Дамира 41 год, замужем и растит троих детей.  Она родилась в селе Бакайата, где сейчас и проживает со своей семьей.  В 2000 году, открыв магазин в собственном доме, Дамира начала свой бизнес в торговле.  На сегодняшний день, ее магазинчик является одним из востребованных мест, поставляющих продовольственные продукты повседневного потребления односельчан. Будучи энергичным человеком, Дамира также обрабатывает поливную землю в 3,20 га, где выращивает фасоль, картофель и многолетние травы.  Благодаря упорному труду и широкой бизнес-деятельности заемщицы, она смогла накопить денежные средства на оплату учебы своего сына в медицинском университете. 
Для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса и увеличения товарооборота, Дамира обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы она планирует вложить в образование своих детей. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Damira is 41 years old, she is married and is raising three children. She was born in the village of Bakai-Ata where she now lives with her family.

In 2000 Damira opened her own store in her own home and started her business in retail. At this time her store is one of the popular places which provides groceries and consumer goods for the fellow villagers.

As energetic as she is Damira also plows the land of 3.20 hectares, where she grows beans, potatoes and perennial grasses. Thanks to her hard work and a wide range of business activity she was able to save money for her son's tuition in the medical university.

For the further growth of her business and increase of sales Damira has come to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS. She plans to invest the profit into her children's education.

ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners provides loans through Kiva for socially vulnerable population regions. ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners is one of the leading micro financing organizations in Kyrgyzstan. Bai Tushum & Partners is a reliable financial partner which makes an impact in development of the economy in the Republic of Kyrgyzstan, provides affordable micro lending services in the rural towns and cities, helps to create jobs and is responsible for the interests of their clients and investors.

loans.use: to expand the variety of products

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan de 18 años,  es un joven emprendedor que tiene muchas aspiraciones para ser un microempresario por eso que tiene una pequeña tienda para mejorar sus ingresos. Poco a poco ha venido incrementando la mercadería con ayuda de sus padres. 

Para reunir el dinero para los víveres tuvo que trabajar a su corta edad como albañil. Poco a poco fue incrementando su capital de trabajo. En la actualidad trabaja en su propia tienda vendiendo víveres de primera necesidad como granos, bebidas, enlatados etc.  Para mejorar su tienda quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, enlatados, bebidas etc.
texts.en:
At 18 years of age, Juan is a young entrepreneur who has great aspirations to become a small business owner. For that reason, he has a small store to augment his income. Little by little he has been offering more merchandise with the help of his family. 

In order to pull together the money for supplies he had to work in his young age as a bricklayer. Little by little he has increased his capital. Currently, he works at his own store selling basic necessities like grains, beverages, canned goods, etc. To improve his store he wants to use this loan to buy rice, caned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.use: to purchase rice, canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Zein

texts.en:
Zein is a 33-year-old married man and father of two children. He works hard to fulfill their needs and make all their desires come true. Zein is a hard working man. He has worked in agriculture since his first day of working, but to increase and improve his family's income and social situation, he bought in 2005 a small van, which he used to start a new business transporting students from the region to/from school.

His business is improving because of the trust the parents have in him. He is a good driver and the safety of the kids is the main thing he cares about.
His car is new and in a good situation. Sometimes he uses it to take tourists all over the Lebanese borders upon tourists' requests, and most of these tours happen in the summer when there are no students to be committed to.

Zein is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner, in order to pay what's left from the bus's price. He hopes to expand his business more and more in the future by increasing the number of buses he owns.

loans.use: To pay off his bus

loans.name: Nazarious

texts.en:
Nazarious has run his retail shop for over eight years in Bushenyi. He generates about 360,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) as profits per month form it.

Nazarious is a married man with four children.

This 31-year-old man says he copied the idea and was influenced by friends to join this particular business, which has now become his lifeline. His shop is strategically located at the side of the road.

He also has a coffee plantation from which he gets an additional income, which gives a significant boost to his shop. This hardworking young man plans to expand his business and lift up the living standard of his family.

With this Kiva loan, he plans to buy more retail shop commodities like soap, beans, rice and maize flour to resell.

loans.use: To buy more goods for the shop like soap, beans, rice and posho (maize flour) to resell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, age 59, works as a manicurist and pedicurist in her local community. She patiently walks a considerable distance every day to get to her workplace. With her scanty daily earnings, she manages to support her family. Through effort and entrepreneurship, she is determined to provide a more comfortable life for her family.

She is asking for a loan amount of PhP 5,000 in order to buy cuticle remover, acetone, nail polish, and other materials needed for providing high-quality manicure services. As a result, she will be able to attract more customers to avail her service. 

She dreams eventually of building her own beauty parlor shop in their community. Despite her age, this is the goal that motivates her to work. She is confident that this dream is within her reach.

loans.use: to buy cuticle remover, acetone, nail polish, and other materials needed for providing high-quality manicure services

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Jocelyn has a food shop or carenderia that sells snacks & viands like fried fish, caldereta & halang-halang. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy the raw ingredients needed for making snacks and viands.

Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients needed for making snacks and viands.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is married with two children. She is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Gina is a farmer and grows pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase breeding pigs to raise.

Gina has been a member of PMPC for one and a half years. In the future, Gina hopes to improve her family's house.

loans.use: to purchase breeding pigs to raise.

loans.name: Maria Berta

texts.es:
La señora Maria, tiene 61 años de edad, esta acompañada y vive con dos nietos de 20 y 12 años de edad.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene cuatro años de dedicarse al comercio de mariscos, esto lo aprendió, por pura necesidad de tener una fuente de ingresos para su familia, ya que solo se dedicaba a realizar los oficios de su casa, pero por ayudar con los gastos y superarse, ella decide emprender esta actividad.

A Maria le llevan el pescado los mayoristas, hasta su casa. Por lo que, no incurre en ningún gasto de transporte.

El préstamo que esta solicitando será invertido, en la compra de 10 quintales (1,000 libras) de pescado, que serán cancelados en su totalidad. Con esto ella reiniciara su negocio de venta de mariscos, ya que por problemas de salud lo dejo de hacer por un tiempo. 

Maria manifiesta, que su negocio era rentable cuando lo tenia, por eso comprara esas 1000 libras de pescado, que se las llevaran a su casa poco a poco, de esta manera mantendrá su negocio y generara ingresos suficientes, para el pago del crédito y para su consumo familiar. Con los ingresos ahorrara una parte, para comprar algunas cosas para su casa, mejorar el techo y ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is 61 years old. She is in a relationship and lives with two grandchildren, aged 20 and 12. 

She is a hardworking woman. For four years, she has been working in the seafood business. She learned it out of the need to have a source of income for her family. Before she only took care of the house, but to help with expenses and get ahead, she decided to start this activity. 

Wholesaler bring Maria the fish to her house, so she has no transportation costs.  

The loan she is asking for will be invested in buying 10 quintales (1,000 pounds) of fish, which will be paid for in full. With this, she will re-start her seafood selling business, since due to health problems she had to leave it for a while. 

Maria says that her business was profitable when she had it, and that is why she will buy 1000 pounds of fish. They will take it to her house little by little and this way she will maintain her business and generate enough income to pay for the loan and for her family's consumption. With the income, she will save a little to buy a few things for her house, improve the roof and make an addition.

loans.use: to buy 1000 pounds of fish.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Pheap is a farmer and she also sells fish at the market for additional income. She is 48 years old and has seV. children. She lives in a rural area of Tbaung Khmum district. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years. This is the second loan she has received from VisionFund after her first loan was completely paid. 

Pheap is requesting a loan to cultivate her rice farm. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase the crop yield and be able to sell at a good price, so that she can feed her family and make her family's living conditions better.

loans.use: to cultivate her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Kholik

texts.ru: Холик 49-летний женатый человек. У него трое детей. По специальности он шафер. Он предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области 10 лет. Кредит берет для ремонта ходовой части машины и обновления салона.
texts.en: Kholik is 49 year-old married person.  He has three children.  His profession is a driver.  Kholik provides a taxi service and has been in this business for ten years.  He is requesting this loan to repair his car drive train and update the interior.

loans.use: to repair his car drive train and update the interior

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio is a responsible and hardworking person. He lives at the village of Villa Marzo, Cordon. He start managing his rice farm in 1986 and continues to manage it now. 

Florencio and his wife work together to earn their living. Their main goal is to lift their lifestyle up, out of poverty. The couple were blessed with four children, three of whom are studying and one is still an infant. Farming is the primary source of income for Florencio's family. Florencio is busy cultivating his farm while his wife is involved in the hog raising business. However, the income is not enough to meet all of the daily needs for this family. So, Florencio has requested a loan of PHP20,000 which will enable him to acquire the necessary farm inputs to continue his business.

Florencio is hopeful that his requested loan will be granted so that he and his wife can attain their goal and be able to support the education of their children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for agricultural business.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen is a 40-year-old married woman with no children. 

For the past year she has had a business selling food from a stall in Bor, South Sudan. Ayen requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase wheat flour and sugar. 

She will use the extra income she generates from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. She is married and has six children. Catherine owns a clothes shop which has been in operation for the last twenty three years. She started the business from her personal savings. Besides this, she owns a hotel and supplies fish.
She is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase more lessos - african cover clothes tied around the waist by women - and hotel furniture. She looks forward to owning a big hotel despite the challenge of seasonal weather, price fluctuations and some clients not paying on time. Catherine will use the extra income from the loan to buy office utensils.

loans.use: To purchase more lessos and hotel furniture.

loans.name: 030816-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Quây works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise. 

Quây is 55 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 030816-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She has no dependents

In 2010, Quây joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Quây has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Quây has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Quây faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Quây hopes for her business to do well, to buy land of her own, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise.

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en: Bayan is a 40 year old marreid woman from Al Karak, Jordan who helps support two family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to make home improvements. She would like to improve her furniture and make general home improvements. Bayan wants to do these upgrades to make her home a better place for her family.

loans.use: to make home improvements

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.en: The Piaza (outdoor market) in the southern Moldovan city of Cahul is a colorful and lively scene. Among the many vendors working in booths and kiosks is Tatiana, greeting customers with a warm smile and enthusiastic showing of her products. A mother of three and a natural salesperson, she began selling clothing and hats about one and a half years ago and now works with one employee to meet customer demand for the goods she imports from the Ukraine. Her business has been going so well that she wants to expand and open a separate small store on the fringe of the market to capture a new segment of the market. Tatiana has been noticing the recent trend in Moldova of increasing popularity of leather bags and purses, both for men and women, and wants to take advantage by stocking these items. She needs a loan to buy goods and to cover initial operating costs of her new venture.

loans.use: working capital.

loans.name: Limah

texts.en:
Limah is a member of MBK who has requested her second loan of $100. Half of the loan received from MBK will be used for her bamboo basket business while the other half used for her husband farm. From a bamboo stick which she bought for IDR 5,000, She could create 6 large baskets that she could sell for IDR 8,000. Twice a week, She could sell 20 large basket and 12 small basket. The small basket could be sold for IDR 3,500

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Frely Pakan, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Bamboo basket business and her husband farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy meat for his butchery business

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.es:
Business Description:

Mr. Hipolito has been dedicated to farming since an early age. He learned this activity from his parents. He sows rice, corn, etc. He works all day without a fixed schedule. Although the sowing season for rice is past, he has his own irrigation system and he can continue sowing.

Use of the Loan:

Mr. Hipolito wants to acquire supplies with this credit such as fertilizers, herbicides, manure, etc. Since for lack of funds he has not been able to maintain an optimal level of production for development.

Personal Information:

Mr. Hipolito is 60 years old and is happily married. He actually has three children but all are already of majority. His house is built of wood, very orderly and welcoming. The aspirations of Hipolito are to buy more land in order to thus get them to yeild crops, generating income that will allow a better quality of life for his family.

Translated from spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Don Hipolito se dedica a la agricultura desde temprana edad, el aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, el siembra arroz, maíz...etc. Su trabajo lo realiza todo el día sin un horario fijo, aunque la temporada de la siembra de arroz ya paso, el tiene sus propia maquina de riego y el puede continuar sembrando.

Uso del Préstamo

Don Hipolito desea adquirir c0n el crédito insumos como; fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos etc. Ya que por falta de capital no podía mantener un nivel de producción optimo para su desarrollo

Información Personal

Don Hipolito tiene 60 anos de edad esta felizmente casado. En la actualidad tienen 3 hijos pero todos ya de mayoría de edad. Su casa es de estructura de madera, muy ordenada y acogedora. Las aspiraciones de Hipolito es comprar más tierras para así llegar a producirlas, generando ingresos que le permitan darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and pesticides for his farm -  Comprar fertilizantes y pesticidas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more assorted fruits.

loans.name: Azianle

texts.fr:
Mr. Azianle S. was born on April 25, 1978 in Lomé, Togo in the neighborhood called Agoè. He is married and father of three children. Because he could not pay school fees, he stopped after primary school and learned bicycle/motorcycle mechanics. The vast experience that he has in his trade plus the reasonable prices he charges his customers make him a mechanic who is esteemed by all. He is looking for funding to improve his inventory of parts so that he will always have on hand what he needs to do a job. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of US$ 300 which will allow him to stock spare parts that he can then also sell to his customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur S. Azianle est né le 25 Août 1978 à Lomé, dans le quartier d’Agoè. Il est marié et père de (03) enfants. Faut de moyens fianciers, il a arrêté ses études au cours primaire pour apprendre la mécanique à 2 roues. La grande expérience qu’il a acquise dans ce métier et la qualité de ses prestations font de lui un bon mécanicien apprécié par tous. Il recherche les moyens pour renforcer son équipement et disposer permanemment du matériel de travail. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit d’un montant de $300 qui servira à acquérir des pièces détachées pour revendre aux clients.

loans.use:
buying spare parts for his repair business

Achat et vente de pièces déttachées

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Diversify and increase her merchandise selection

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is a very hard working and honorable lady. Every morning she leaves her small home to offer her delicious desserts throughout the city. She does this because she lacks the money needed to rent a space in a marketplace and this is the only form of income she currently has for her and her family being that her husband’s job is seasonal. This hard working woman wishes to better the quality of life of her two children through her hard work. That is why she is asking for the help of your giving heart in order to obtain the amount needed to invest in ingredients and products needed to continue selling her delicious desserts. Let's facilitate this petition so Graciela con accomplish her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Wendy Wise

Graciela, es una dama muy trabajadora y honrada. Todas las mañanas abandona su pequeña morada para desplazarse por las calles de su ciudad ofertando sus deliciosos postres; realiza esta actividad de esta forma debido a que no cuenta con un capital suficiente que le permita alquilar un espacio cómodo y seguro ya que muchas veces esta actividad es la única fuente de ingresos económicos de su querida familia; debido a que su esposo se desempeña en trabajos eventuales.Esta trabajadora mujer desea incrementar el nivel de vida de sus dos pequeños con su labor y por esta razón acude en búsqueda de la ayuda de tu bondadoso corazón a fin de obtener la cantidad que solicita para invertirlos en la compra de mayor cantidad de recipientes e ingredientes para seguir produciendo sus deliciosos postres.Posibilitemos su petición para que Graciela consiga su propósito.

loans.use: Incremento de capital para acrecentar su producción. <b>Increase her capital to expand her production.<b>

loans.name: Busamin

texts.id:
Because living in Java is expensive and the job market is difficult, Busamin and his family moved to Bali to look for work. Busamin has only the most basic education, so he decided to start a business collecting second-hand goods and recyclables to resell. Using a wooden bicycle, he searches for items from 5A.M. to 9A.M. In the afternoon from 4P.M. to 9P.M. he he travels around the entire area of Monang-Maning ending up in Simpang Siur. In one evening he sells up to 30,000 Rupiah. He and his wife work together to meet their needs. They must pay 125,000 Rupiah per month in rent, 15,000 Rupiah per day in living expenses and 260,000 Rupiah per month for their children's education. They currently make up to 350,000 Rupiah per week.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Karena di Jawa biaya hidup semakin mahal dan lapangan kerja sulit, ia dan keluarganya pindah ke Bali untuk mencari pekerjaan. Dengan pendidikan yang sangat minim ia mulai usaha mencari barang bekas (pemulung). Dengan menggunakan sepeda kayuh ia berangkat mencari barang bekas sekitar pukul 05.00 - pukul 09.00 siang. Sore hari ia berangkat pukul 16.00 - pukul 21.00 malam. daerah yang dikelilingi mulai Monang – Maning sampai Simpang Siur. Sekali jalan ia sudah bisa menjual barang bekas Rp 30.000,00. Ia dan isterinya bekerja sama untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidup mereka. Biaya kontrak Rp 125.000,00/bulan; Biaya hidup per hari Rp 15.000,00; Biaya pendidikan anak Rp 260.000,00/bulan. Per minggunya mereka mendapatkan keuntungan sebesar Rp 350.000,00/minggu.

loans.use: to increase business capitol

loans.name: Jorge Martín

texts.es:
Twenty years ago, Jorge Martín worked as a driver in public transportation, first as a minibus driver, then he purchased his own vehicle to start working for himself, despite the inconvenience of having to rent his permit. Little by little, he started to work until he was able to buy his own permit with a more recent car model. Thanks to his hard work and dedication, Jorge has been able to move his family forward.

However, he is currently experiencing difficulty because his source of income (his taxi) no longer offers the comfort and features his customers require. For this reason, he his requesting a loan of $300.00 USD, which he is willing to repay in 3 monthly installments, in order to repair his taxi and offer more safety. With your help, Jorge will be able to move his family forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace ya 20 años que Jorge Martín trabaja como chofer de transporte público, primero empezó como chofer de un microbús de ruta fija y posteriormente compró su propio vehículo para empezar a trabajar por su cuenta, aunque con el inconveniente de que tenía que rentar las placas, y poco a poco comenzó a trabajar hasta que pudo comprar su propia concesión y con un carro de modelo mas reciente. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación, es que Jorge ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.

Sin embargo actualmente cuenta con una dificultad puesto que su fuente de ingresos (su taxi) ya no cuenta con las comodidades y con los servicios que sus clientes requieren. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero Jorge podrá reparar su taxi y así poder ofrecerle un servicio con mayor seguridad. Con tu ayuda Jorge podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Repair his taxi

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is 24-year-old, very happy and persistent young lady. Despite her young age, Norma is already the owner of a cap making studio. It has been six years since Norma with the support of her parents, undertook this business. During this time she managed to transform her studio into a big factory. Norma has already entered the markets of the cities of Arequipa, Cuzco and Puno, and her goal is to expand her business activity to other locations and provide people with the opportunity of a job. With this purpose in mind, Norma hopes that you help her to obtain the quantity that she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma es una muchachita muy alegre y perseverante de 24 años, a pesar de su corta edad ya es propietaria de un taller de confección de gorros, ella con el apoyo de sus padres emprendió este negocio hace 6 años, en ese tiempo logró implementar poco a poco su taller hasta convertirla en una gran fábrica de confección de gorras.. Actualmente ya incursionaron en el mercado de las ciudades de Arequipa, Cuzco y Puno, el deseo que tiene es ampliar su taller y darles una oportunidad de trabajo a otros muchachos que se encuentran desocupados, con ese propósito en mente reúne sus esperanzas en vosotros para obtener la cantidad que solicita.

loans.use: To obtain captial in order to expand business activities to other locations

loans.name: Mashaka

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Mashaka M.. She is not married and has 2 blessed children, aged 15 and 18. She has 5 dependents who live with her because they are street children. In 2000, Mashaka established her crops business. Mashaka has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from SELFINA and now requires a new loan in order to buy more stock of crop in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilitation as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more stock of crop in bulk.

loans.name: Sharifjon

texts.en: B. Sharifjon lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 2 children. Mr. B. Sharifjon is engaged in the family business of livestock. He inherited the business from his father. He has a good flock of cows, bulls, sheep  and rams. Now Mr. B. Sharifjon applies to KIVA with the request of a business development loan for 8 months so that he can build a new cowshed building that will permit him to enlarge the livestock area and increase the number of livestock.

loans.use: To build a new cowshed building

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace E. sells foodstuffs. She learned this business for 3 weeks and started her own business in 2008. Grace is 39 years old and married with 3 children, she lives in lagos State, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of US$875 to buy more foodstuffs for sale. She says thanks  to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Ayirwanda

texts.en:
Greetings from Nyamata in Rwanda! G. is 41 years old, married with 2 children and one adopted child from the 1994 genocide. 


In 2004, G. started a small shop worth $100 after acquiring a loan from Vision Finance Company. He acquired a loan from VFC and sells different items in the shop like soap, beans, vouchers, salt and all domestic items. He employs two people in his business and makes about $100 per month. He is requesting a loan of 300,000 Frws to buy more stock for his shop.


AYIRWANDA G. is the man in blue & white t-shirt; the others are his clients.

loans.use: Increase his working capital

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence O. lives in Ilaje, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells local gin, popularly known in Nigeria as "ogogoro". Local gin comes from palm trees. When sap has been tapped from the palm tree, it is now boiled for few hours, after which it is mixed with local herbs and put into bottles. This is served as local gin.

Most of Florence's customers are men. Florence is a LAPO client. She is 33 years old and married with 6 children. She has been selling local gin for the past 2 years. She needs the loan amount of US$ 275 to buy more local gin (ogogoro) for sale.

loans.use: To buy more hot drinks (ogogoro)

loans.name: Nafija

texts.en: Nafija O. was born in 1961 and she comes from Gračanica. Nafija is divorced and lives with her mother, who is retired. She works as saleswoman in a local shop and she earns 500 KM. She works in a shop so she has enough time for working in her orchard. Her mother owns this orchard and charges Nafija no rent, since she is happy that somebody takes care of the orchard. Nafija produces plums and she sells them in the local market. She has a plan to extend her business and she will need someplace to store her products and a place where she will keep the things that she needs for her orchard. That is the reason that she want a loan from WWI which amounts to 1500 KM. Her wish is to keep her orchard in a good state and extend it little by little.

loans.use: To build a store place for products

loans.name: Maria Del Refugio

texts.es:
María inicio hace 3 años con el negocio en los mercados rodantes porque tenia L. necesidad D. apoyar a su marido con los gastos D. L. casa así que empezó vendiendo ropa D. elL. y D. su familia que le pasaban, ahora ya compra media paca cada mes y esto es lo que venD..

ElL. necesita un préstamo por US $ 400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una paca D. ropa completa para que el precio sea mas barato y así tener mejor venta, y también planea comprar una estructura para los tiempos en que hace lluvia o frio ya que L. que tiene es D. teL. y necesita una mas resistente.
texts.en:
María started her business 3 years ago in open-air markets because she needed to support her family with the household expenses. So, she began selling her own and her family's clothing that they gave her, and now purchases a and sells a half pack of clothing each month. María needs a $400 loan which she will repay in 6 months to purchase an entire pack of clothing so that the price will be lower and will therefore have greater sales. María also plans to purchase a structure so that she can continue selling in rain and cold, as her current shelter is maD. of cloth and is not resistant enough.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a pack of clothing and a rain shelter

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 32-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife. Ahmad has been working in transportation for the last three years. He used to work as a taxi driver until a friend recommended that he buy a pick-up and start his transportation business. Now Ahmad works in public transportation and he also moves furniture and lumber. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a bigger truck. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

loans.use: Ahmad needs the loan to purchase a pick-up truck

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
Sar K., 53, lives in a rural area of Pursat Province, where she farms for a living. Mrs. K. is married and has six children, all of whom live away from home. Her husband, Em Kon, 67, helps work the farm. (They are both shown in the picture.)

She grows rice or vegetable crops, which are the main source of income for the family. She sells her crops 3 or 4 months after planting.

Mrs. K. is applying for a loan to purchase two oxen to help her plow the farm. The loan will help alleviate the hard labor of farming and provide the family with additional fixed assets.

loans.use: Purchase two oxen for farming

loans.name: Pavlo

texts.en:
Pavlo is married and has a one-year-old daughter. Their family lives in Drogobych. Pavlo runs a small business offering vehicle refurbishment services and further sales of used cars. His business is located in one of the local car markets. Pavlo works with his brother who drives used cars from England and then leaves them at Pavlo’s shop for refurbishment. After Pavlo is done fixing and adding polishing touches to a car, it’s ready to be re-sold in Ukraine. Pavlo has been in this business for 2 years. His income was about 15,000 Grivnas before the financial crisis hit Ukraine very hard.

Pavlo is seeking a 5,000 Grivna loan to fix a car for further re-sale. He is happy to have followed his brother’s advice to start this business. Pavlo believes he can apply his technical skills and work in the sphere of vehicles which has always been his passion. Pavlo is really good with all his clients. They all recommend him as a competent and skillful technician and are satisfied with the refurbished cars he had sold them.

loans.use: fix a car for re-sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria T., now 64 years old, is a pig grower and a store owner. She sells her farm produce in her store. She earns her living from farming as well from selling various goods at her farm. Four of her 8 children are married while the remaining four live with them. They are a typical Filipino family. Sons and daughters live with their parents until they get married.

In 2006, Maria started selling her rice in her store. People come to her to buy rice and other goods. She is happy about how her business is growing because it helps her a lot to cover the needs of her children.

She wants to expand into other businesses. She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 to grow her business more for her family. She believes that with her loan, she could earn more profit from her businesses.

CEVI helps Maria sustain her business. Now, she can take advantage of credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries and feed for pigs

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées, les femmes du groupe YEREDEME ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et  6 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies dans le village de ZANFINA, sous préfecture de KONOBOUGOU, dans la préfecture de BAROUELI, région de SEGOU république du Mali. 
Les membres du groupe YEREDEME se sont connus par des relations professionnelles et font généralement le commerce de condiments alimentaires.
Pour développer leur activité, elles ont intégré l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe. Tous les précédents prêts ont été bien remboursés.
 Elles veulent acheter, 400 kg de sel de cuisine, 150 kg d’oignon, 15 paquets de 100 morceaux de cube maggi et une grande quantité de légumes vertes. Une partie de ces articles est achetée sur le marché de Fana et l’autre avec les jardiniers du village. Les articles sont vendus dans le village à ZANFINA en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes. 
Elles comptent obtenir avec ce prêt un bénéfice de 17 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour aider les époux à subvenir aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
All married, the women of the group YEREDEME average 36 years of age and 6 children. They live in traditional extended conjugal families in the village of ZANFINA (in KONOBOUGOU sub-prefecture, in BAROUELI prefecture), the SEGOU region, Republic of Mali. They know one another through professional ties, and they generally do commerce in condiments.

In order to develop their business, they joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fifth group loan. All the preceding ones have been repaid

The group members want to buy 400 kg of salt, 150 kg of onions, 15 packets (100-count each) of Maggi cubes, and a large quantity of green vegetables. A portion of these goods are purchased at the Fana marketplace; and the other portion, from gardeners in the village. The goods are sold retail in the village of ZANFINA, cash or credit accepted, to women customers.

With this loan, the group members intend to make a profit of 17,000 francs CFA that will be used to help their spouses to provide for the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Las Bondadosas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "Las  Bondadosas" están representadas por la señora María Elva y conformado por 13 miembros los cuales son del barrio Toborochi y se conocen desde hace tiempo. Todas los miembros tiene sus pequeños negocios propios de venta de productos como  cosméticos por catalogo, comida, pan, ropa y a actividades de servicio como limpieza domiciliaria, niñeras y a la construcción de viviendas. Las socias aceptan que existe gran competencia dentro del mercado de venta de productos pero llevan años vendiendo en el mismo lugar y saben como salir adelante por el bien de sus familias ya que representan el pilar de los ingresos de sus hogares. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de mercadería y productos de mejor calida para brindar a sus clientes un mejor producto mas competitivo y la compra de herramientas para brindar un mejor servicio para incrementar sus ingresos y mejor la calida de vida de sus familias. Todos los socios poseen experiencia en créditos solidarios por lo que conocen como administrar los fondos otorgados y como cumplir con responsabilidad a su plan de pagos.
texts.en:
The "Las Bondadosas" communal bank is represented by María Elva and consists of 13 members from the Toborochi neighborhood who have known each other for some time. All of the members have their own small businesses selling products like catalog cosmetics, food, bread and clothing, and providing services like housekeeping, babysitting and home building. The partners accept that there is competition in their respective markets, but they have been selling in the same area for years and know how to succeed for the benefit of their families, as they represent the mainstay of income in their homes. The loan will be used to purchase better quality merchandise to bring their customers a more competitive product, and to purchase tools to improve service which will bring in a better income and better their families' quality of life. All of the partners have experience in credit groups, so they know how to administer the funds and how to fulfill the responsibility of their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.
Carmen es conviviente, tiene 46 años y 3 hijos, Carmen tiene una peluquería llamada Gaby, su local esta ubicado en una avenida céntrica además cuenta con un personal. También Carmen se dedica a L. venta D. cosméticos por catálogos.
Carmen necesita un préstamo D. 750 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. champú, colonias y joyas.
Los sueños D. carmen son que sus hijos sean profesionales y equipar su salón D. belleza.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Manantial Communal Bank. Carmen lives with her partner, is 46 years old, and has three children. She owns a hairdressing salon called Gaby which is located on a centrally situated avenue and has one employee. Carmen also works selling cosmetics by catalog. She needs a $250 dollar loan to buy shampoo, cologne and jewelry. Her dreams are to fully equip her beauty salon and have her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Nicoll, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shampoo, cologne and jewelry.

loans.name: Ada Ysabel

texts.en:
Ada is a member of the Virgen Asunta Village Bank in the town of Urco, located just outside the larger town of Calca and about an hour from the city of Cusco. She is 31 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their 7-month old baby boy. Ada runs a tire-changing shop in Calca, where she employs one person. Right now she just sells and changes tires, but she hopes to expand and start doing oil changes as well. Ada also works as an administrator for a local NGO that works in water sanitation; she does the organization’s accounting each month, and turns in her report on or before the 4th of every month. 

Ada is requesting a loan of 1000 soles (PEN-nuevo sol) for a new business that she is planning to launch. She wants to open a very small factory to make her own sodas and bottled water. She saw one such business about four years ago and has been planning to open her own drink business since then. She plans to sell her drinks in the valley area outside of Cusco. She says that market studies have shown that people in that area would be the most receptive to her products. She plans to start with sodas, then move on to water, carbonated water and lemon-flavored water. Ada will use her 1000 PEN (USD 325) to buy water tanks and installation tubes. 

Ada became an Arariwa client when she was 18 and worked with the institution for three years.
