She returned about two years ago because she likes its mandatory savings program (in which clients are obliged to save 5% of their loan amount in a collective savings account). She has pledged to repay her Kiva loan in full and on time.

loans.use: Buy water tanks and installation tubing for a new business manufacturing drinks and carbonated water.

loans.name: Abduaziz

texts.ru: Абдуазиз Тошматов 1962 года рождения, женат имеет 4 детей. Высшего образования не имеет. Дома содержит скот. Разводит скот более 18 лет. Бизнесом занялся когда женился. Жена домохозяйка помогает муже в бизнесе. Утром доит коров убирает коровник. Кредит получил  на покупки коров. Каждую конец недели  есть рынок купли продажи скота. Абдуазиз через три- четыре месяца   выводит скот на продажу и приобретает в замен молодняк.
texts.en:
Abduaziz T. was born in 1962, he is married and has four children. He does not have higher education. He keeps cattle at his home and has been breeding it for more than eighteen years. He has started his business when he got married. His wife is a housewife and helps him with the business. She cleans the cowhouse and milks the cows in the mornings. He received the loan to buy more cows. He goes to the cattle markets at the end of every week. Abduaziz takes the cattle out for sale after every three to four months and buys a younger stock instead.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For feeding of cattle

loans.name: Kathy Elizabeth

texts.es: Kathy Elizabeth G. su edad es de 41 años, es una mujer casada. Kathy tiene 1 hijo y estudia. La actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Esta mujer luchadora inicio por influencias familiares, el mayor desafío que tuvo con el negocio es que tenia que atender a su hijo, además tenia problemas de salud y eso le preocupaba cada ves que ella salía a ganarse la vida. Pero sin embargo ha demostrado que puede salir adelante. El dinero que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo en la compra de calzado, ropa interior y cosméticos. El sueño de Kathy es que su hijo termine su carrera y además sea un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Kathy Elizabeth G., 41, is married and has one son who goes to school. She sells general merchandise. She has been doing this for more than four years. This determined woman started her business by way of family influence. The greatest challenge she had with the business was taking care of her son. She also had health problems that worried her every time she left to earn a living. Nevertheless, she has shown that she can get ahead. The loan she is asking for is for working capital to buy footwear, underwear, and cosmetics. Kathy’s dream is for her son to finish his degree and become a good professional.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace B. is married and has five dependants. She has a junior high school education. Peace sells food stuffs such as yams, pepper groundnut in Abotoase, near Hohoe. Her husband is a trader who makes a small income.

Peace uses her income to help her husband keep the house. Peace will use her loan to purchase more of the food stuff to sell. With the new profits she plans to save.

loans.use: Purchase more of the food stuff to sell.

loans.name: Haidee

texts.en: Haidee G. is from the village of San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 29 years old and is single. Haidee owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling both clothes and daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Haidee joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Haidee is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Bright

texts.en: Bright A. is a single parent and has three children. He has received schooling through junior high school. Bright has been selling fish in Ayisa since 2002. Bright uses his income to pay school fees. Bright will use the loan to buy materials for fishing. Bright plans to reinvest his new profits in his business.

loans.use: Bright will use the loan to buy materials for fishing.

loans.name: Rosita Da Conceicao De

texts.pt:
Rosita da conceição de M. nasceu na cidade da Matola (a 22 km de Boane em direção a cidade de maputo) tem 36 anos de idade e é mãe de 2 filhos estando o mais velho a frequntar 7 classe na Escola Primaria completa de Boane.
Rosita parou de estudar na 9 classe devido a problemas de saúde. (tem dificuldades de vista). É solteira vivendo com os filhos e sua mãe que também esta sob sua responsabilidade.

Há sete anos que vem fazendo negocio num pequeno estabelecimento comercial formal a beira da estrada principal que liga maputo-Boane e Namaacha. Tem uma empregada que lhe ajuda nos trabalhos de venda de bebidas, refrigerante e outros produtos que os adquire a 8 km do local de venda. O produto com mais saída é cerveja e rende por dia cerca de 900,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e poupa no Banco comercial 3.000,00MT mensalmente.
 
Nunca teve empréstimo com outros bancos e este é o seu segundo  com a hluvuku-adsema e que obteve informações sobre a existência da instituição através de amigos. O primeiro empréstimo foi de 10.000,00MT que se destinava para reforço do stock de venda. Com o presente credito de 20.000,00MT pretende aumentar o volume do negocio comprando mais cerveja, refrigerantes e outros produtos.

Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com objectivo de expandir o negocio e melhorar a situação sócia econômica familiar.
texts.en:
Rosita da Conceição de M. was born in the city of Matola (22km from Boane heading towards the city of Maputo). She is 36 years old and has 2 children. Her older child is in the 7th grade in the Primary School of Boane. Rosita dropped out of school in the 9th grade due to health problems (she has vision problems). She is a single mother living with her children and her mother, whom she also supports. For the past seven years she has had a small shop on the side of the main road that links Maputo-Boane and Namaacha. She has an employee who helps her sell beverages, soft drinks and other products that she buys 8 km from the sales location. The most popular product is beer and she earns about 900,00 MT per day that she uses to support her family. She saves 3.000,00 MT monthly in a commercial bank. She has never had a loan through other banks and this is her second loan with Hluvuku-Adsema, which she learned about through friends. Her first loan was for 10.000,00 MT which she used to purchase more stock for her business. With the current loan of 20.000,00 MT she plans to increase the volume of her business by purchasing more beer, soft drinks, and other products. She plans to pay off the loan without any problems in order to have access to future loans with the goal of expanding her busienss and improving her family's socio-economic situation.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and sale of various products (drinks, soft drinks, etc.)

loans.name: Oluyemissi

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier de Cassablanca à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle a appris le métier de couture et c’est depuis 2005 qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle a beaucoup de clientes et dispose actuellement d’une apprentie couturière qui l’aide dans son travail. Elle ne dispose que d’une seule machine à coudre. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter une nouvelle machine à coudre. Cette machine sera destinée à son apprenti qui l’aidera dans l’exécution de ses tâches.

loans.use: Achat de machine à coudre

loans.name: Macaria

texts.es:
Macaria tiene 41 años, vive en su casa (propia) con su pareja y sus hijos; Jhon de 16, Ricardo de 11, Gisel de 7 y Emerson de 4 añitos de edad, quienes son su razón de salir adelante. Desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a la venta de cerveza en su domicilio, también tiene una tienda de abarrotes para captar la atención de mayor clientela, pues Macaria se encarga de surtir y abastecer muy bien su negocio para que sus vecinos puedan encontrar todo lo que necesiten. Adicionalmente, se dedica a la decoración de locales para diversos eventos y celebraciones. Ella tiene mucha fe a su trabajo, ya que sabe que todo es cuestión de creatividad y esfuerzo para echar a andar un nuevo negocio y lograr los ingresos necesarios para el bienestar de su familia. Para el futuro, Macaria quiere tener una peluquería y no descansará hasta ver este sueño hecho realidad.
Este es su cuarto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, ella acostumbra a solicitar préstamos individuales, pero también es parte de un grupo. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará mayor cantidad de cajas de cerveza y seguirá abasteciendo su tienda.
texts.en:
Macaria is 41 years old. She lives in the house she owns with her partner and children; Jhon who is 16, Ricardo who is 11, Gisel who is 7 and Emerson who is 4 years old. They are her reason to succeed. As of more than 10 years ago she has worked selling beer from her home. She also has a grocery store in order to reach a larger clientele. Macaria is in charge of properly stocking and supplying her business so that her neighbors can find everything they need there. In addition, she works decorating venues for various events and celebrations. She has a great deal of confidence in her work since she knows that in starting a business and attaining the necessary level of income for her family’s well being, it’s all a matter of creativity and effort. In the future Macaria wants to have a hair salon and she won’t rest until she has made this dream a reality.

This is her fourth loan with PRISMA Microfinance. She has experience in applying for individual loans and also group loans. With the money she is applying for she will buy greater quantities of cases of beer and will continue to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandice increase

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal N. is 28 years old,single.she lives in Nyarugenge district,kigali province ,capital of Rwanda.
she owns a small shop where she sells the spareparts since2008 and employs one person.
she opens his shop everyday from 6h00 AM to 5h00PM.

before doing this business he was not able to get all needs.
with this loan requested in vision finance company, he plans to expand his business in order to get more profits so that he will be able to change his life forever.

loans.use: purchasing more spare parts for sales

loans.name: Kasmiro

texts.en:
Kasmiro M. sells bread, toothpaste, sugar, small bags of salt, etc., at her shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of sugar and salt to sell.  Kasmiro is 32 years old and is married to a peasant. She has six children who attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy spare parts for motor bikes to sell. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase bags of sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. is from the village of Del Carmen, Iligan City. She is 39 years old. Elizabeth is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns amd operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first taken out by Elizabeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase new items for her retail store

location.town: Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.en:
M. Munavvar is a bread maker. She has her own bakery in her house. With experience has come success in this business. She’s been able to succeed by diversifying her products. Munavvar makes white bread, sweet bread, buns and pastries. Munavvar’s immediate need is to acquire basic ingredients to continue baking bread. This is why she’s looking for support from IMON International, to obtain credit that will allow her to buy the ingredients she needs and continue her bakery business at home. With your support, you can improve the quality of life for Munavvar and her family and help her business grow and prosper. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase flour at wholesale for baking the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Dolly Elena

texts.es:
La señora Dolly Elena, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 40 años, 03 hijos y 02 de ellos aun dependen de ella.

Dolly Elena, mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, por iniciativa propia, decidió vender sus Juanes y anticuchos, se inicio desde muy joven por iniciativa propia y hoy lleva varios años, ejerciendo este tipo de actividad. Dolly Elena, todas las noches se dirige a su ambiente, donde atiende a sus clientes, ubicada a las afueras de su casa. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados. 

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, vende en las mañanas y tardes. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como: arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papa, pollos en javas, verduras. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios para remplazar a sus utensilios antiguos, así brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Dolly Elena, se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar más su restaurante al mismo tiempo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Dolly D. is a member of the Las Nazarenas Communal Bank in the Bellavista district and province, department of San Martin. She is a 40-year-old woman with a live-in partner and 3 children, 2 of whom are her dependents.

Dolly Elena, an enterprising and hard-working woman, took the initiative and decided to sell Juanes (rice, chicken, olives and an egg wrapped in a plantain leaf and parboiled) and anticuchos (grilled meat on skewers). She got her start in this business at a very young age and has now been in business for several years. Every night, Dolly Elena goes to her stand located outside her home where she attends to her patrons. She states that her daily sales are great because of the delicious flavor she adds to her dishes.

She currently runs this same business and is very satisfied with the works that she does day by day. She opens mornings and evenings. She personally attends to her customers with the charm that she is noted for.

With this 1,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase the ingredients that she needs to prepare her meals, such as: kilos of rice and sugar, cooking oil by the gallon, sacks of potatoes, crates of chickens, and vegetables. She will also invest some of the money in purchasing utensils in order to replace her old ones, thus providing better customer service.

Dolly Elena feels full of vitality and the desire to keep getting ahead. She has many goals and dreams in life, such as establishing her own restaurant. At the same time, she is also grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her launch her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for meal preparation

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
La señorita Celestina es socia del Banco Comunal “Lupakas” desde hace 3 años atrás, del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Es estudiante y se dedica a la venta de sogas e instrumentos.
Celestina nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar hilos, lana, nylon, guitarra, charango.
Su sueño para el futuro es seguir cantando y terminar de estudiar.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
. Celestina, 20, has been a member of the "Lupakas" communal bank in Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, Puno department for 3 years. She is single and has no children. She is a student and she sells ropes (cords) and musical instruments. Celestina tells us that her first, 300 new sol, loan from Manuela Ramos Movement was used to increase her working capital. She now is requesting 1000 new soles to buy threads, wool, nylon, guitar and charango (small South American guitar, often made from armadillo shell). Her dream for the future is to continue singing and to finish her schooling. What she likes best about her communal bank is the get-togethers with her fellow members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool, nylon, guitar and charango (small South American guitar, often made from armadillo shell)

loans.name: Dios De Salvación Group

texts.es:
El grupo Dios de Salvación está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras que se dedican a la venta de frutas y verduras las cuales varían según la temporada ellas son Katy María S. de 23 años, Fidelina del Carmen C.  de 37 años y Meyling del Carmen García de 27.

Ellas desde hace tiempo se dedican a está actividad y su mayor sueño es seguir progresando.
texts.en:
The Dios de Salvación ("God of Salvation") group is made up of three hard-working women who sell fruits and vegetables of various kinds according to the season. They are Katy María S., age 23; Fidelina del Carmen C., age 37; and Meyling del Carmen García, age 27. They have pursued this activity for some time now, and their greatest dream is to continue making progress.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fresh fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji H. is 45 years old and a widow. She has seven school-aged children. Keji is currently in the business of selling drugs in a pharmacy and is requesting a loan to stock more drugs to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a dispensary.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more drugs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy body lotions, perfume, beauty products

loans.name: Marcial

texts.en:
Marcial is 28 years old and married to Yohana. They have two children who live with them in Itá.
In the downtown area of Itá, Marcial rents a retail space where he buys, repairs and sells cell phones and cell phone accessories. He has been in this line of work for six years and has an established client base. Marcial opened his business with the help of his mother, a retired teacher. He has been working with Kiva partner, Fundación Paraguaya, since 2005. Marcial also teaches classes on cell phone repair in schools. Currently, he is seeking a loan to purchase cell phones and cell phone accessories to sell.

loans.use: To purchase cell phones and cell phone accessories

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina D. is from the village of Panay Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, is widowed, and has three school-aged children. Celerina owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Celerina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Celerina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to repair her motorcycle in order to provide better service. This loan will be her seventh from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Yoeum

texts.en:
Mrs. P. established a small family home four years ago in the middle of the best territory of the capital city of Phnom Penh, and she has given birth to seven children, two of whom are married. Three of her children are employed with different occupations: one is a vegetable vendor, one sells clams, and one is a building worker. 

Mrs. P. currently sells different kinds of vegetables in the market to earn a living, and her husband assists her in selling her produce. P. has a son who wants to get married and he needs to have a wedding party, but he doesn't have money. P. has requested a loan to allow her son to make a wedding party possible. (Mrs. P. was not available on this day, so her husband is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To make a wedding party possible

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks and items for baking snacks to sell

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn B. is from the village of Thailand, Banisilan Cotabato. She is 57 years old. Merlyn is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Pedro Vicente

texts.es:
Pedro Vicente C. C.   tiene 23 años, es soltero,   Vive en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una  a una distancia de hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Pedro Vicente trabaja en la agricultura como fuente principal  económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son: maíz, papas, trigo.   Vende los productos cada cosecha en diferentes lugares del país. 
Pedro Vicente  solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas,  abonos y fertilizantes  para sus sembrios.  Su meta es de mejorar la calidad del producto y su calidad de vida.  Los desafíos que enfrentan son que desearían que sus productos sean vendidos al productor no a los intermediarios. Pedro Vicente no ha realizado préstamos,  manifiesta que en sus tiempos sale a pasear a san Miguel.
texts.en:
Pedro Vicente C. C. is 23 and single. He lives in the town of San Francisco de Rumí, which is 1½ hours from San Miguel Canton in the Province of Bolivar. He is a member of the San Francisco de Rumí Pamba Communal Bank. It is comprised of 25 members in all. Most of them work in agriculture. Pedro Vicente works in agriculture as his primary source of income for his family. The crops that excel in the area are corn, potatoes, and wheat. He sells those products from every harvest at different places in the country. Pedro Vicente is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies and natural and chemical fertilizers for his plants. His goal is to improve the quality of the product and his quality of life. The challenge he faces is that he would like his products to be sold to the producer not to the intermediaries. Pedro Vicente has not had loans before. In his free time he goes walking to San Miguel.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Agricultural supplies like natural and chemical fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Mario Bolívar

texts.es:
Mario Bolívar B. V. tiene 59 años de edad y vive con su esposa y 6 hijos, Rodrigo (34), Narciza (30), Mirian (28), Blanca (26), Marlit (24) y Simon (22), en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.
Mario es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Lotan Bajo, que se encuentra a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. Son 13 socios en total, y en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Se dedica a la agricultura como principal fuente de ingresos de su familia. Lo que produce es el maíz, fréjol, papas y legumbres, para consumo de su familia y venta. Ella vende sus productos en el mercado mayorista de Quito y realiza sus compras en San Miguel.
Mario solicita el préstamo para la agricultura, específicamente para la compra de insumos y pago de jornales. Piensa que el crédito la ayudará a mejorar su condición económica y a mejorar la calidad del producto. Su meta es comprar un terreno para aumentar sus cultivos y también mejorar su casa.  
Los desafíos que ella enfrente son condiciones climáticas que causan enfermedades en los cultivos.
A Mario le gusta pasear con su familia. La costumbre del cantón es el carnaval que se celebra con familiares  y amigos todos los años en el mes de febrero.
texts.en:
Mario Bolívar B. V. is 59 years old. He lives with his wife and their six children; Rodrigo (34), Narciza (30), Mirian (28), Blanca (26), Marlit (24), and Simon (22). They live in the town of San Miguel in the Bolívar province. Mario is a member of the Lotan Bajo Communal Bank. It is a half an hour from the town of San Miguel. There are 13 members in all. Most of them work in agriculture. Agriculture is the primary source of income for his family. He produces corn, kidney beans, and vegetables for family consumption and to sell. He sells his products at the wholesale market in Quito. He makes his purchases in San Miguel. Mario is requesting a loan for farming. Specifically, he will buy supplies and pay wages. He believes that the loan will help him improve his economic situation and improve the quality of his products. His goal is to buy a piece of land to increase his crops. He also wants to improve his house. The challenges he faces are the climate conditions that cause damage to his crops. Mario likes to take walks with his family. The Carnaval is a custom in the town. People celebrate with their families and friends every year in February.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and wages

loans.name: Lomeli

texts.es: Lomeli tiene 29 años, tiene un hijo y juntos viven en casa de sus padres. Hace mas de 2 años se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir como chalinas, guantes  y gorros, confeccionadas de lana y polar, prendas indispensables para soportar la temporada de invierno, vendiéndolos de manera ambulante en las ferias comerciales de su ciudad. Por otro lado trabaja de manera dependiente en una librería. Pero considera que el vender prendas de vestir le permite  tener más ingresos que benefician su economía. Su mayor anhelo es tener un local para su negocio. Esta es la quinta oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP y sabe que éste aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de mercadería para confeccionar más prendas.
texts.en:
Lomeli is 29 years old and lives with her son at her parents’ house. For more than two years, she has been selling garments made of wool and fleece such as scarves, gloves, and caps that are needed to withstand the winter season. She sells these products as a traveling vendor at the trade fairs throughout the city. In addition to this business, Lomeli also works as a bookstore clerk. She started selling clothes so that she could have more income to help with her finances. Her greatest wish is to have a store from which to operate her business.

This is the fifth time she has received a loan from MFP. Lomeli knows the loan will be useful in advancing her business. The money she requested will be invested in the purchase of merchandise to increase her inventory of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of clothing

loans.name: Magda Ivania

texts.es:
La señora Magda Ivania S., es una adulta mayor de 65 años soltera con un hijo mayor de edad con capacidades especiales, ella se dedica a elaborar Manualidades, desde hace 8 años se ha convertido en su fuente de ingresos.

Fue con el dinero de su jubilación que comenzó su pequeño negocio, ha tenido problemas de cancelación de las ordenes de trabajo que ha realizado, este ha sido un problema para ella debido a que no ha podido recuperar lo invertido en su negocio razón por la cual le a obstaculizado el crecimiento de su negocio, a futuro comprara una vitrina donde las elaboraciones se aprecien mas, con este préstamo adquirirá  una mayor variedad de materiales que le permitan aumentar sus elaboraciones y le aumente sus ventas para el mejor beneficio de su economía y la de su hijo que le demanda muchos gastos y atenciones debido a su condición especial.
texts.en:
Magda Ivania S., 65, is an older adult. She has an adult, special needs son. She makes handicrafts and this has been her source of income for the past 8 years. She used her retirement funds to start her small business but she has had problems with the cancelation of orders for work she has completed; this has been a problem for her because she has been unable to recuperate the investment she put into her business. This has been an obstacle to growth. In the future she’d like to buy a display case where her creations will show more favorably. She will use this loan to buy a greater assortment of materials to increase her production thereby increasing sales so that she and her son’s economy will improve because his special circumstances create many expenses and needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena M. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Nena is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Nena runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Nena has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Nena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Nena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay farm laborers and to buy firewood for burning bricks

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco Antonio tiene 36 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su familia en la ciudad de Chiclayo, una ciudad con bastante movimiento comercial y de transporte es conocida como “La Ciudad de la Amistad”, es la capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace cinco años a brindar servicio de diseño gráfico en un local ubicado en la zona comercial de la ciudad, el ofrece servicio de diseño de volantes, afiches y todo tipo de material publicitario a diversas empresas e instituciones de la ciudad. Debido al tiempo que lleva en el negocio tiene un grupo de clientes fieles que siempre recurren a su establecimiento y le recomiendan con sus conocidos. El utiliza los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia en su sostenimiento económico.

Marco Antonio desea brindar mantenimiento a la computadora que utiliza en su trabajo, asimismo desea adquirir material para realizar sus impresiones, por este motivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su obejtivo.

El es muy responsable y bastante trabajador. En la zona donde vive es bastante estimado y sus clientes le tienen mucho aprecio. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio is 36, single, and lives with his family in the city of Chiclayo. Chiclayo is a city bustling with commerce and transportation and is known as the "city of friendship;" it is also the capital of Lambayeque. Marco Antonio has been working as a graphic designer for the past five years in a business district of the city. He designs fliers, tags and all kinds of advertising materials to various businesses around town. Due to his business history he has a faithful group of clients who come to him regularly and recommend him to others. He uses the income from his business to pay his personal expenses and to help support his family. Marco hopes to do some maintenance work on his work computer as well as to buy some printing materials. That is why he has requested a loan of 500 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help him achieve his goals. He is very responsible and hardworking. He is well respected in the neighborhood around his business and beloved by his clients. He has had a previous loan with our institution and has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Computer maintenance and the purchase of materials for a graphic design and print shop.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor JUAN CARLOS L. es trabajador de MATECSA casado tiene un hijo y su esposa a su cargo, el señor López labora como obrero en la empresa realiza trabajos de elaboración de adoquines.
Durante ha obtenido prestamos en CEPRODEL  los ha invertido en la obra de mejorar su vivienda, pero como los desembolsos se han realizado de acuerdo a su capacidad de pago, no ha logrado lo del plan de inversión, solamente ha avanzado de manera progresiva. Por tanto no ha logrado terminar la obra pero si priorizar lo más urgente.
texts.en:
Mr. JUAN CARLOS L. is employed by MATECSA (a construction company) as a laborer; he makes paving stones. He’s married and has his wife and a son under his care. He has had loans from CEPRODEL that he’s used for home improvements. However, because the disbursements have been made according to his ability to pay he hasn’t managed the investment plan but has only advanced step-by-step. Therefore he hasn’t managed to complete the construction project although he has been able to prioritize the most urgent parts.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc metal sheeting to repair the roof and for concrete blocks and cement.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha L. is from the town of Talibon. She is 55 years old. Editha is single. To make a living, Editha owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making "puto" (rice cakes) and other delicacies for sale. Editha is also a buyer of seafoods. She sells those to the market.

Editha joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Editha is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en:
Jacinto G., from the town of Trinidad, is 35 years old and married. To make a living, Jacinto has been planting and harvesting rice for sale for more than five years now. He hopes to increase his next yield.

Jacinto joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs, he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his agricultural venture.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Martin Karanja

texts.en:
Martin is married, and he and his wife are blessed with two children.  

Martin was introduced to KADET by a credit officer. He has never borrowed from any other MFI, so this will be his first loan. He has been in the transport business for two years. With the loan, Martin will purchase another motorbike to assist in enlarging his business. 

Martin's business is located within the town center, and he operates from Kiserian, just few kilometers from the capital city, where he gets a lot of customers, as many people prefer the motorbike because it's faster.  

With the profits, Martin will expand his business to other areas and buy a piece of land on which to build rental homes, thus becoming a landlord, as he believes he is hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Mercedes Donaldo

texts.es: El Sr. Mercedes Donaldo C. P. es trabajador Activo de la  Alcaldía Municipal San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como Guarda de Seguridad tiene un año de trabajar para esta institución, es casado actualmente tiene dos hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de  materiales para siembra  y preparase para dicha siembra porque él se dedica a parte de su trabajo a la siembra de frijol, maíz, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Mr Mercedes Donaldo C. P. works for the City of San Rafael del Sur.  He is a security guard.  He has been working there for one year.  He is married and has two school-age children.  He has had two loans from CEPRODEL and each one has been used to buy equipment for sowing and preparing for sowing time because in addition to his job, he sows beans and corn.  His loans with CEPRODEL have greatly benefited him since they have helped him improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: Supplies for sowing corn

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 40-year-old rice farmer and a masonry businessman. He is married to Jane, a farmer, and they have three children. John has been doing rice farming and operating a masonry business for the past 10 years. His monthly income is KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He has applied for his second loan from KADET in order to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizer, sprays and pay for the welding labor. With the anticipated profits from the business, John intends to improve his family's living standard and educate his children. His hopes are to educate his children to the highest level possible and buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizer and sprays

loans.name: Adonay

texts.es:
Adonay B. Salmerón, tiene la edad de 41 años, está casado y tiene 1 hijo que es su mayor prioridad al igual que su esposa. El quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para la asistencia de su café y tenerlo  en buenas condiciones de producción. El tiene varios años que se ha dedico a este cultivo, cuenta con mucha experiencia y el terreno para su explotación, actualmente le va bien  en su negocio por lo cual quiere aumentar la producción del próximo año y tal vez generar más ingresos  de su café para tener una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar familiar,  También piensa en el futuro de su hijo que es su mayor prioridad y quiere  poderle dar  el estudio para que en un futuro sea un buen profesional en alguna área especifica.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja que los otros lugares de financiamiento.
texts.en:
Adonay B. Salmerón is 41 years old.  He is married and has one child.  His child and his wife are his top priorities.  Adonay would like to buy the supplies he needs to tend to his coffee crops and keep them in good condition.  He has been growing this crop for several years.  He has a lot of experience and a land on which he grows his crops.  His business is currently doing very well and so he would like to increase next year's production and perhaps make more income from his coffee so that his family can have a better quality of life and well-being.  Adonay is also thinking about his son's future which his top priority.  He would like him to be able to have an education so that in the future he can be a good professional in a specific field.

This is Adonay's first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't had any previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan which has easier terms and much lower interest rates than other loan companies.

loans.use: To improve his coffee crops

loans.name: Kotognontala  (Ayons La Même Voie) Group

texts.fr:
Kotognontala  est un regroupement des femmes du quartier Darsalam  de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien. Elles  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les produits alimentaires, les habillements,  les céréales etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles viennent  d’avoir leur premier prêt de groupe. 
Aramata C. est  la seule du groupe  qui vend  exclusivement du pain.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, au fur et à mesure du pain. Elle se procure  du pain chaque matin de bonne heure à la boulangerie Badegna de Koutiala sur la route de San. 
Elle vend  du pain à la gare routière de Koutiala en détail et au comptant au grand marché de Koutiala à une clientèle diverse et variée. Sa vente journalière varie entre 100 et 120 miches de pain. 
Tandis que Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Aramata C. compte réaliser 70 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elles souhaitent renforcer leur partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour pouvoir diversifier leurs marchandises.
texts.en:
Kotognontala is a group of women from the neighborhood of Darsalam, in Koutiala, who know each other well. They live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. On average, they are 38 years of age and married with at least four children.

These women sell various items such as food, clothing, grain, etc. In order to expand their activities, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. They recently obtained their first group loan.

Aramata C. is the only group member who exclusively sells bread. She plans to use her loan to sustain her stock of bread. She gets bread early every morning at the Badegna bakery, in Koutiala, on the road to San.

She sells bread at retail, for cash, at the bus station and the big market of Koutiala to a diverse clientele. She sells 100 to 120 loaves of bread per day.

While the group members expect to earn an average profit of 60,000 FCFA each during this cycle, Aramata hopes to make 70,000 FCFA.

In addition to repaying the loans, the members use a portion of their income to cover ongoing family expenses.

They wish to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to diversify their merchandise.

loans.use: Buying bread

loans.name: Melania

texts.es:
Melania  es socia del Banco Comunal “12 de Agosto”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 18 años, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 01 hijo, estudio educación secundaria

La señora es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora al Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, su préstamo solicitado es S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de choclos cocidos y verduras, para la cual comprará choclos, quesos, y verduras etc., su esposo trabaja en construcción.

Desea que su negocio de buenos frutos.

Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Melania is a member of the community bank “12 de Agosto” ("August 12th") in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 18 years old, has a common-law spouse, has one child, and attends secondary school.

She is a new member who recently joined the Manuela Ramos Movement. She seeks a loan of 500 Peruvian Soles, which she decided to invest in her business of selling cooked corn on the cob, for which she will buy ears of corn, cheeses, and other vegetables. Her spouse works in construction. She wishes for good products for her business. What she likes most about her community bank is the ease of the loan process.

loans.use: To buy ears of corn, cheeses, and other vegetables for her business

loans.name: Delina

texts.en:
Delina is 42 years old, married, and has three children. Two of her children go to school. Delina owns a carpentry business and has been working as a carpenter with her husband for twenty years.

Her loan will be used to purchase lumber and construction equipment which will be used in the business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more lumber and equipment.

loans.name: Juan Humberto

texts.es:
el sr. Juan Humberto M. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con un negocio de venta de verduras y frutas, gracias a su negocio obtiene ganancias que le permiten cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Su negocio esta ubicado en un lugar de bastante transito de personas, las verduras las compra a los diversos pobladores que cultivan dichas verduras y tiene que contar con suficiente efectivo para poder comprar lo suficiente, ya que ellos solo van una vez a la semana.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de verduras y frutas para tener mucho inventario y no quedarse corto a media semana.
texts.en:
Juan Humberto M. is a merchant, he has a business selling vegetables and fruits. Thanks to his business he obtains profits that allow him to cover his home's expenses. 

His business is located in a place with considerable foot traffic. He buys the vegetables from different people that grow the vegetables. He has to have enough cash to buy enough vegetables since the vendors only go once a week. 

He will use this loan to buy vegetables and fruit so that he can have a lot of inventory and so that he will not run out mid-week.

loans.use: Purchase potatoes, onions, bananas, apples, tomatoes, chiles, garlic, melons, cabbage, lettuce and cucumbers.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
They say that team work is dream work. That could not be truer when a happily married couple sets out to run their own business.

Luis and his wife Alexandra have been in the construction supply industry for over 20 years. Beginning in Colombia, they gained valuable experience and are working to apply their skills to the American market. They provide construction implements to contractors by either shipping from their own warehouse or acting as a mediator with supply companies. In recent years they have been able to supply more specialized equipment, giving them a noticeable edge in the market. 

With this loan they will be purchasing more inventory and expanding in the specialized equipment that they provide to customers. This loan is the beginning of what Luis and Alexandra see as a constantly expanding business. With the opportunities available to them in the US, South America and the Caribbean, they hope to grow into a formidable regional supplier.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy bread, soap, toothpaste, toothbrushes, foot-brushes, etc. wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Jackeline Baltazara

texts.es:
Jackeline tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive en el caserío Punto Cuatro, una zona rural que pertenece al distrito agrícola de Mochumí, el lugar pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar desde hace dos años en la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella ofrece estos productos a los vecinos de su localidad, actualmente cuenta con un grupo de clientes ya fidelizados que siempre acuden a ella para solicitar los productos que necesitan. Jackeline no se conforma y siempre se encuentra buscando nuevos clientes, ya que mientras más clientes capte, la empresa que le provee de productos suele darle más puntos por los cuales percibe más ganancias.

Adicionalmente ella se dedica a la preparación de comida las cual ofrece en venta en su domicilio a sus vecinos, este negocio ha sido iniciado hace poco y actualmente cuenta con un grupo de clientes fidelizados que siempre recurren a adquirir los alimentos que ofrece.  Con estos ingresos que obtiene,  ella apoya a su esposo en el sostenimiento de la economía familiar, el trabaja en un taller mecánico.

Jackeline desea adquirir  mesas y sillas para implementar su negocio de venta de comida y bebida, de modo que pueda atender a sus clientes con mayor comodidad. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles. 

Ella ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla, en aquella oportunidad pudo implementar su negocio  de cosméticos y con las ganancias que obtuvo pudo sacar adelante su nuevo negocio. Por ello se encuentra bastante agradecida con las personas que le ayudaron a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jackeline, 30, lives with her husband and their two children in the town of Punto Cuatro, a town in the rural district of Mochumi, some forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  

Jackeline operates a business selling beauty products.  She buys her merchandise from catalogs and sells them to local customers.  She has a loyal group of customers who always come to for whatever products they need.  Jackeline doesn't rest on her laurels, though.  She's always looking for new customers because the company that supplies her merchandise rewards her with more points which, in turn, increases her income.  

Jackeline also earns money making and selling prepared foods which she sells in the neighborhood.  She has a loyal set of customers for this business, too, neighbors who come back to buy the meals she makes.  With her income from the two businesses, she can help her husband support the family.  (Her husband is a mechanic.)

Jackeline wants to buy tables and chairs so that she can expand her food business.  She is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 1,500 new soles loan.  

Jackeline has borrowed from Kiva before, using Edpyme Alternativa and its subidiary, Capital Semilla, to set up her beauty products business.  Her earnings from that business allowed her to start this new business.  For that, she is very grateful to everyone who has supported her.

loans.use: buy tables and chairs for restaurant business

loans.name: Malila Group

texts.en:
Sabina D., who is in her mid-forties, is married with 6 children.  She has been running a fruit and vegetable business for two years. She works from 7.00am to 9.00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Sabina's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase stock and has repaid her loan successfully. She hopes for a loan to further increase stock. Her dream is to have a big place and to sell more different types of fruits.

Sabina will share this loan with her loan group, "Malila", which has a total of 18 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans,

In the picture, Sabina is wearing an orange dress, 1st on the right.

loans.use: to increase stock.

loans.name: C6406 Turwanyubukene Group

texts.en:
Mediatrice is 37 years old. She is married and has five children between the ages of 5 and 15. Her business is well-organized and sells various sorts of fruit such as pineapples, bananas, passion fruit and so on. She employs one person to help her. She got into this business because it is profitable in her region and she has been successfully running it for four years. Mediatrice is the leader of a group called "Turwanyubukene" in the local language. The group includes seven members (three men and four women).
 
Mediatrice and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more products for their shops so that they can provide better service to their customers. The loan will impact the group members by helping them to purchase larger quantities of stock, which will allow them to earn more profits. With the extra income they earn, Mediatrice and her group hope to save some money and to reinvest in their businesses. Mediatrice hopes to open a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits such as pineapples, bananas, passion fruit and so on.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan V., 50, resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples. 

V. sells sugarcane juice, earning an income of US $3 per day. Her husband is a motorbike repairman, earning an income of US $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend US $60 on food and US $10 on the other necessary expenses. 

V. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase a new sugarcane squeezer to operate her business more efficiently. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new sugarcane squeezer.

loans.name: Rosa Irene

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Al Desarrollo. Ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su gran artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 69 años de edad, está casada y de esa relación tienen seis hijos,  todos son  mayores de edad e independientes y solo uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo ya no trabaja está muy anciano.

Tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa,  en ella vende arroz, azúcar, granos, detergentes, carne, pollo, pescado, legumbres y el delicioso queso chonero que es delicioso y muy solicitado por su sabor. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00, nos cuenta que le encanta su tienda ya que allí además de ganarse la vida también se entretiene y está al tanto de todo lo que sucede en su  comunidad. Nos cuenta que lleva más de 30 años con su tienda y que es su vida, su hijo y su esposo le ayudan en su negocio.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en comprar arroz, azúcar aceites y  otros productos de primera necesidad.
 
Sus aspiraciones son gozar de buena salud, ayudar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y continuar muchos años más en la Fundación Espoir que según ella le ha brindado mucho apoyo.
texts.en:
The members of the “Amor y Fe al Desarrollo” (Love and Faith in Development) communal bank meet every two weeks in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its cultural riches and its great crafts like straw hats that are renown both inside and outside the country.

We met Rosa, 69, here.  She’s married and has six children, all adult and independent; only one still lives with her.  Her husband no longer works, he’s quite aged.

She has a grocery store at home.  She sells rice, sugar, grains, detergent, meat, chicken, fish, legumes and the delicious “chonero” cheese which is very tasty and much sought after because of its flavor.  She works daily from 6am until 8pm.  She tells us that she loves her store because besides earning her living there she entertains herself and is aware of everything that’s going on in her community.  She tells us that she’s been in business for over 30 years and the store is her life.  Her son and husband help her with the business.

She will use this new loan to buy rice, sugar, oil and other basic need items.

Her wish is to enjoy good health, help her children become professionals and remain in Fundación Espoir for many more years which, according to her, has provided her with much support.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Luz Divina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Luz Divina esta integrado por 5 mujeres las cuales tienen negocios propios, se conocen muy bien entre ellas mismas y viven en la misma aldea, sus casas están cercanas la una con la otra. La apariencia de sus negocios es buena, lo que nos indica que han tenido un crecimiento del mismo y han mejorado sus condiciones de vida.

A continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

CELSA DE JESUS se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular y tambien presta los servicios de moler maiz.
la mayoria de las ventas son al credito ya que son personas obreras las que viven en dicha zona y que trabajan en fincas de ganado, fincas de Tomates y Chiles Dulce, los trabajadores es al negocio de ella que llegan a sacar los productos al credito.
La Sra. Celsa esta casada y actualmente de su matrimonio dependen 3 hijos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria como ser Azúcar, arroz, manteca, jabón, maseca, papel higiénico, café, espaguetis, salsa, margarina, sardinas, pollo, sopas instantáneas, huevos, refrescos, y otros.

la sra. MARIA MARLENY se dedica a la venta de granos basicos Maíz y Frijoles, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitación.

la sra. YAHAIRA CAROLINA  se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
Su negocio opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería la “Bendición” con más de un año de experiencia y administración del mismo.
Ella se ha sabido ganar la clientela por los precios que ofrece y por la atención y amabilidad con que atiende los mismos.

la sra. GLADYZ CECILIA tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion en donde vende todo lo relacionado con los productos de la canasta basica familiar.
Su negocio opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “FATIMA” con Dos años de experiencia y administración del mismo.
Ella se ha sabido ganar la clientela por los precios que ofrece y por la atención y amabilidad con que atiende los mismos.

la sra. GLADIS MIGUELINA se dedica a la venta de ropa americana, su negocio lo lleva a cabo en su casa de habitación, pero la mayoría de sus ventas las realiza de manera ambulante, sale a vender su mercadería en las comunidades de El Barro, Suyatillo, la Maquina y la Chorrera.

todas necesitan el credito para salir adelante con sus negocios y sus familias.
texts.en:
The group Luz Divina is made up of 5 women who own their own businesses.  They all know each other very well as they live in the same neighborhood and their houses are close to one another.  Their businesses appear to be doing well which tells us that they have grown and thus, improved their living conditions.  The following are the details of their different activities:

Celsa de Jesus sells popular consumer products and also has a corn milling service.  The majority of her sales are on credit as her customers are workers  who live in the area and work on the livestock farms and the farms that grow tomatoes and sweet peppers.  Señora Celsa is married and has 3 children.  She will use the loan to buy grocery products such as sugar, rice, lard, soap, corn flour, toilet paper, coffee, pastas, sauce, margarine, sardines, chicken, instant soups, soft drinks and other things.

Señora Maria Marleny sells basic grains like corn as well as beans from home. 

Señora Yahaira Carolina sells popular consumer products and has a small store in her house.  She has been running her business under the name "Bendición" [Blessing] for more than a year now.  She brings in customers by offering good prices and friendly service. 

Señora Gladyz Cecelia has a store in her house where she sells basic family items.  She has been running her business under the name "Fatima" for two years.  She brings in customers by offering good prices and friendly service.

Señora Gladis Miguelina sells Ameican clothing.  She runs her business out of her house, but she makes the majority of he sales as a street vendor.  She sells her merchandise in the communities of El Barro, Suyatillo, La Maquina and La Chorrera.   

All of these women need a loan to succeed in their businesses and get their families ahead.

loans.use: purchase sugar, rice, lard, soap, corn flour, toilet paper, coffee, pastas, sauce, margarine, sardines, chicken, instant soups, eggs, soft drinks, corn beans, sausage and American clothing.

loans.name: Clemantine

texts.en: Clemantine is 41 years old with four children who are 5-15 years old. She is happily married to a businessman. Clemantine owns a general store in which she sells different items such as soap, juice, rice etc. She has done this business for three years. This business, together with her husband’s help, has enabled her to begin building a family house and pay for her children school fees. She is requesting a loan to buy more items and fill her store in order to make more profits. With the profits, she plans to continue building her family house.

loans.use: To buy items such as soap, juice etc

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity 38 years old.  She is currently in the business of selling vegetables.  She is divorced and has six children, only two of whom go to school.  Her future goal is to increase her business.

loans.use: stock more vegetables

loans.name: Tiessiri 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Tiessiri 3 sont des femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne 37 ans, 2 enfants et qui vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kenikela, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KARIDIATOU, qui est debout au milieu, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour (sarclage) pour entretenir environs 0,8 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000FCFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of group Tiessiri 3 are married women who are on average 37 years old with two children; most of them live in polygamous families in Kenikela, one of the villages of Massigui Township in Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (Mali's second administrative region).
They are partnering with micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. They cultivate rice and groundnuts among other crops. They are on their fifth collaboration with the organization.
With this new loan, Karidiatou - who is standing in the middle - plans on buying agricultural inputs and small equipment, and to pay for weeding costs to maintain about 2 acres of rice and groundnuts.
After the harvest, the crops are sold in the town of Massigui to a clientele comprising men and women. They expect an average benefit of about 50,000 CFA at the end of the agricultural cycle.

loans.use: to pay for plowing costs, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and small equipment.

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
La señora Elida está casada con el Sr. Miguel, juntos tienen dos hijos, los cuales ya son mayores y están ya en la Universidad. Su marido trabaja en una empresa privada hace ya unos años.
La Sra. Elida tiene una pequeña despensa hace ya unos años, por medio de la cual puede solventar los gastos de la casa. Ella sostiene que su marido también la ayuda en el mantenimiento del negocio. Comenta que todo lo que hace es por generar un poco más de ingresos, con lo cual podrá tener una mejor condición económica. La cliente manifiesta que uno de sus sueños es poder, algún día, abrir un supermercado donde pueda tener ya todo tipo de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, lácteos, embutidos y demás, para poder abastecer su local y por medio de esto no quedar sin mercaderías cuando los clientes lo demanden.
texts.en:
Elida is married to Miguel and together they have two grown children who are in college. Her husband has worked for some years in a private business.

For several years, Elida has run a small store that allows her to cover the costs of their home. She says that her husband also helps out with the business. She says that everything that they do is to make a little more money so that they will be able to have better living conditions. One of her dreams is to one day be able to open a supermarket where she can have every kind of product to offer her customers.

This loan is to purchase food, dairy products, sausages and other things to stock her store so that she won't lack the merchandise that her customers want.

loans.use: to buy groceries, dairy products, sausages and other things.

loans.name: Nhean

texts.en: Mrs. Nhean, age 35, is a humble villager who lives in Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Nhean is a coal seller in her community and she lives with four single children. She is a widow woman. Her husband passed away for a long time ago. From her business, she earns an income about $3.50 USD per day. Presently, Mrs. Nhean would like to apply for a loan in amount of $600 to decorate some parts of her old house.

loans.use: to decorate some parts of her old house.

loans.name: Rosa Magdalena

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Empresarias Con Futuro  se reúne cada 15 días en el Palmar en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual y con muchos atractivos turísticos.

Aquí vive la señora Rosa, tiene 61 años de edad, ella es madre soltera de 6 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores  de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y además porque los créditos le han brindado una gran ayuda en su negocio y en su vida personal.

Ella es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora que para ganarse el sustento diari se dedica al comercio, vende diversos productos y le encanta realizar sus ventas, ella vende productos Yanbal, Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), también ropa y productos para el hogar. Trabaja de lunes a viernes unas tres a cuatro horas al día, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y gracias a esto pudo sacar sola a sus hijos adelante.
	
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa y ciertos productos para el hogar.
 
Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The Empresarias Con Futuro [Entrepreneurs with a Future] community bank meets every two weeks in el Palmar in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches visited year round and for its unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.  

Rosa lives there. She is 61 year old and a single mother of 6 children. They are all grown and two of them still llive with her. Since the community bank started she has liked it because the group is very close and also the loans it has given her have been a big help for her business and personal life. 

She is a hardworking fighter who works  as a merchant to make her living. She sells various products and she loves making sales. She sells Yanbal products, Esika (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She also sells clothing and products for the home. She works Monday through Friday three or four hours a day. She sells on credit and collects every week or every two weeks according to what her customers want. She has been doing this for more than 10 years and thanks to that she has been able to get her children ahead.
	
The loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, clothing and certain products for the home.
 
Her dreams are to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, clothing and products for the home.

loans.name: Lila

texts.es: Lila, D. 61 años esta casada y goza D. la compañía D. su esposo y sus cinco hijos, con quienes vive en su casa propia.El trabajo D. Lila consiste en hacer pedidos al por mayor D. bebidas gaseosas, para después venderlos entre sus vecinos y algunos ocasionales clientes que pasan por su casa. Lila lleva ya dos años en este negocio, realiza esta actividad junto a sus hijos quienes por el momento trabajan D. manera temporal.Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es que pueD. disponer D. su tiempo, además, lo que no le gusta es que a veces tiene que estar agachándose mucho para buscar las gaseosas dentro D. su refrigeradora para vender. Lila espera más adelante poder hacer crecer su negocio ya que considera que le genera muy buenas ganancias.Este es el préstamo numero 16 entre Lila y la institución MFP, le gusta mucho el grupo que forma parte ya que son muy responsables, esta muy agradecida D. la institución por que gracias a los prestamos obtenidos pudo realizar muchas mejor en su hogar.Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, ella comprara mas bebidas para poder seguir en el negocio, y espera poder hacer alcanzar para comprar una refrigeradora también.
texts.en: Lila, age 61, is married and enjoys the company of her husband and their five children, with whom she lives in their own house.  Lila's work consists of ordering wholesale soft drinks, and then reselling them to her neighbors and some occasional customers who pass by her house.  Lila has worked two years in this business, together with her children who for the moment work at seasonal jobs.  What she enjoys most about her work is that she can manage her time; however, what she doesn't like is that sometimes she has to bend down often to look for the soft drinks insiD. the refrigerator in order to sell them.  In the future, Lila hopes to be able to make her business grow, since she considers that it generates very good profits.  This is the 16th loan between Lila and the MFP organization.  She really likes the group that she is a part of since they are very responsable and she is grateful to the organization because thanks to the loans she has received, she was able to make many improvements to her home.  With the amount of 3,000 soles requested, she will purchase more beverages so that she can continue her business, and hopefully, have enough to buy a refrigerator as well.

loans.use: to purchase more beverages so that she can continue her business, and hopefully, have enough to buy a refrigerator as well.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine has been offering printing and secretarial services for the last 13 years and the business  is situated in Nairobi, Kenya . She is a 38 years old single lady.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET client. She paid the other loans well and in good time. She intends to use the loan to buy printing materials and pay her college fees.

In the future, Catherine hopes to diversify into other businesses, which will increase her income.

loans.use: to buy printing materials and pay her college fees.

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: Akif is 59 years old and has been in the business of cattle breeding for the last 15 years. The breeding business takes a lot of dedication and effort since it requires the strict control of every one of the animals, including the feed and care for the dairy cows.  He usually buys a small calf, fattens it, and resells it for a profitable price. Through this business, Akif is able to support his spouse and his four children. He applied for 1000 AZN loan to expand his business, and purchase more sheep to add to his herd.

loans.use: to purchase eight sheep and four lambs.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary, 55 years old, is a grocery seller who earns $5 per day. She is a single mother and lives at home alone because all of her children are working far from home.
