Every month, she has to spend $40 on food and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy more grocery goods to sell in her small store. Before, she was a tailor, but she quit to sell grocery items at home instead so that she could make more income.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.en:
Leonidas is a widow with four children. Leonidas is 64 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Leonidas is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 35 years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for her corn. 

Leonidas has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Leonidas hopes to save money for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her corn.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba is a single parent taking care of 3 children. She sells gari, charcoal and sugar (her hand is placed on the gari she sells) at Elmina, which she has done for 10 years. She single-handedly feeds, clothes, educates and provides shelter for her family. She wants to increase her business so that she can continue taking care of the family. 

A loan from Kiva through CRAN will be used to get additional gari (a basic food staple made from cassava tubers), charcoal, sugar and other things to sell. She plans to reinvest the new profits.

loans.use: to get additional gari, charcoal, sugar and other things to sell.

loans.name: Arly

texts.en:
Arly is 44 years old and lives in Canlambo, Larena, Siquijor. She is married and has four children. Arly has been selling fish daily for six years, earning PHP 2,500 monthly. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fish to sell to the market.

Arly has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 10 months. In the future, she hopes to improve her family's living conditions and grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase  fish to sell to the market

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
Rica is 28 years old and lives in Tinago, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She is married and has three children.

Rica has a general store and earns approximately PHP 8,000 a month doing this type of work.  She requested a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Rica has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 11 months. In the future, Rica hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Mouhamadou Lamarana

texts.fr:
MOUHAMADOU LAMARANA HABITE DANS LA RÉGION SUD DU PAYS AGE DE 22 ANS CÉLIBATAIRE IL EST DANS LE COMMERCE DEPUIS 2 ANS IL ÉTAIT ÉTUDIANT A L'UNIVERSITÉ DE ZIGUINCHOR MAIS DÉCIDE DE QUITTER L'ÉCOLE POUR LE COMMERCE CAR C'EST UN MÉTIER DU PÈRE .
MOUHAMADOU LAMARANA DANS L'AVENIR SOUHAITERAIT OUVRIR D'AUTRES BOUTIQUES POUR PRÉPARER SON AVENIR ET CEUX DES SES ENFANTS .
texts.en:
Mouhamadou Lamarana lives in the Southern part of the country. He is 22 years old and single.

He has been a retail merchant for two years. He was a student at the University of Ziguinchor but decided to leave school and go into retail trading as this is his father's profession.

Eventually Mouhamadou Lamarana wants to open other shops to prepare for his future and that of his children.

loans.use: strengthen his stock supply

loans.name: Servea

texts.en:
Servea is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. For the past twenty years Servea has had a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Servea has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. She has requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell. In the future, Servea hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua operates a small shop selling groceries and provisions in Abura.  Efua is married to a carpenter.  She supports her husband and together they educate, feed and clothe her children.  She will use this loan to buy provisions to sell in her shop.  In time, she hopes to use the profits generated by her business to build a bigger shop.

loans.use: to buy provisions to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Sabali A Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Sabali A sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à KAZANGASSO, un des villages du cercle de Bla  , 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 2eme  prêt avec l’institution, le prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec Djenebou, présidente du groupe  1ere debout de la droite vers gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,50 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de Bla et Dougouwolo, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60.000 FCFA en fin de campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.

loans.use: Frais de labour,  achat d’intrants et de semence

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is home to the main campus of Moi University. He has three children and has been doing this work for three years.  His primary income source is eggs and crops.

He stated that the most enjoyable thing about farming is earning from selling agricultural products. His biggest challenge is limited access to finance.

Wilson was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan. He replied that he joined Juhudi after a friend in Juhudi Kilimo advised of the benefit to the farmers. Wilson was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. He said that he learned how Juhudi works to boost farmers' income generation.

When asked how this loan would benefit his family, Wilson said he would purchase a dairy cow.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Wilson owns poultry but does not own cows, pigs, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Angélica

texts.en:
Angélica, 33 years old, divorced and mother of 4 children, native of Namaacha (Maputo), grew up with rural parents. She studied through the sixth level and due to her family's circumstances, had to interrupt her studies when she was 17 years old. The following year she got married because she was pregnant. Since her husband went to the Republic of South Africa (South Africa), in search of employment but never came back, and now has another wife, she was compelled to find a way to support herself and her children.

She began to sell goods at a little stand in front of her home, and through conversations with other women, found out that HLUVUKU would grant credit to small business who approached them to benefit from their services. Currently, her business is going at a good pace, and she was able to open another stand to sell used clothes, also employing a young single mother.

And, with the profits from the sales of the used clothes, she has been able to pay the family's living expenses. She says that when there is an illness, she is able to bear the medical expenses for herself and her children.

Her work has a greater impact in the community because, in addition to providing a job for herself, she also employs a single mother and makes quality clothing at good prices available in the community.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localização: Bairro 1, Boane, Maputo - Moçambique Cliente: Angélica T. Sector de actividade: Comércio Montante: 25.000,00mtn (965.00US$) Aplicação: Compra e de fardos de roupa usada Início: 20/11/2006 Período de pagamento: 14 meses

Angélica, de 33 anos de idade, divorciada e mãe de 4 filhos, natural de Namaacha (Maputo) cresceu sob responsabilidade dos pais camponeses. Estudou até a sexta classe e por falta de condições teve que interromper os estudos quando tinha 17 anos e logo no ano seguinte casou se porque já estava grávida. Desde que o seu marido foi a República da Africa do Sul (R.S.A) a procura de emprego nunca mais voltou, tem outra mulher, viu-se obrigada a fazer algo para o seu auto-sustento e dos seus filhos.

Começou, então, por vender numa pequena banca em frete a sua casa e através de conversas com outras senhoras soube que a HLUVUKU concedia créditos para pequenos negócios tendo se aproximado para se beneficiar dos serviços. Actualmente o seu negócio está num bom ritmo e conseguiu abrir mais uma banca para venda de roupa usada empregando também uma jovem mãe solteira.

E, com os lucros da venda de roupa usada que obtém permiti-lhe pagar as despesas domesticas da família. Afirma que em casos de doença, consegue suportar as despesas médicas para ela e seus filhos.

A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar o emprego para ela, também emprega uma mãe solteira e coloca roupa de qualidade e a bons preços à disposição da comunidade.

loans.use: To buy clothes for selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Kipeen Maradu would like to buy more varieties of food and 15 more chairs for her hotel.

loans.name: Chay

texts.en: Chay L. is a mother of four children living with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She runs a tailoring business and typically makes about $3/day in revenue. Her husband is a photographer and a motor-taxi driver. He usually earns around $12/day, which he contributes to the household. One of Chay’s daughters currently works at the nearby local garment factory. Their wages assist in meeting the family's financial needs, especially the needs of the two youngest children. Chay hopes the loan will allow her to purchase a sewing machine and a motorcycle for her husband to operate a motor-taxi.  In the future, the couple hopes to save enough money to own a photography shop and supplement their children's education.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and a sewing machine for a business

loans.name: Edouard

texts.fr: Monsieur Edouard B. est âgé de 56 ans, il est marié et père de 6 enfants. Il a travaillé plusieurs années comme menuisier à la mairie. Il vient d'être retraité et a ouvert un atelier de menuiserie dans sa propre concession. Il travaille avec 2 de ses fils. Ils ont l'habitude de fabriquer des chaises, des tables et des lits qu'ils revendent facilement. Il sollicite un prêt de 525 dollars pour acheter un rabot neuf, une scie et un lot de bois pour augmenter leur production. Ils ont une clientèle assurée. ce prêt  lui permettra de continuer à assurer la nourriture pour ses enfants, payer leurs écoles, mais surtout de former ses fils et les autres jeunes du quartier dans la menuiserie

loans.use: Achat des outils et d'un lot de bois pour fabrication des meubles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more maize and fruits for her business

loans.name: Saffiatu

texts.en: Saffiatu is 32 years old and married with 5 children.   She started her business 3 years ago by selling lengths of coton cloth (African prints) for clothing.  With two loans so far, she has diversified her business and has seen good profits that have enabled her to meet some family expenses as well as her repayments.  Married to a goldsmith, she says that her husband’s business is irregular so Saffiatu’s business is the primary source of income.  To expand her business further, she is requesting a loan of $350.

loans.use: Continue to expand and diversify her business by adding addtional items for sale

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Mrs. Channa H. has been married since 2000 and has one son and one daughter. She has been weaving silk at home since 1998. She learned to weave silk from her sister and started her silk production within the same year. Her husband, Mr. Sal Puth, is a farmer who grows rice and vegetables.

Channa has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice already. Now she is requesting another loan, in the amount of $200. She will use this money to purchase a water pumping machine for her husband so that he can expand his farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine for her husband

loans.name: Y. Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Y. Jacqueline K. is a wholesale specialist in yams purchased from growers in her village. Her store is located inside the Dantokpa market, where she sells her goods, and where she also builds up her inventory during periods of abundance. But this requires a lot of funds that she cannot generate herself. In Cotonou, selling yams is a very worthwhile business because yams are a staple food. Her husband is a health department representative who does not earn enough, and family expenses demand much of her. So she has to have more resources to meet customer demand and to help with family expenses. She was born on June 3, 1977, is married, and has a child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Dame KOKTOKO est spécialisée dans la vente en gros d'igname acheté auprès des cultivateurs de son village. Elle a son magasin de vente à l'intérieur du marché international de Dantokpa où elle vend et fait aussi le stockage pendant la période d’abondance; ceci nécessite beaucoup de fonds que sa seule capacité financière n’arrive pas à contenir .A Cotonou la vente de l’igname est une activité très rentable parce que faisant partie des aliments de base .Son mari est un agent de santé qui n’a pas suffisamment de ressources .Très sollicitée dans les dépenses de son ménage, dame K. doit multipler ses revenus afin de faire face à la demande de sa clientèle et participer aux dépenses familiales. Née le 03/06/1977, elle est mariée et mère d’ un enfant.

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of yams

loans.name: Patricia Blanca

texts.es:
Patricia does not have her own house, and she as a nanny in a friend's house. She has an 8 year old daughter and is a single mother.

She works selling 'anticuchos' (a dish made with lamb's heart), and she does this on the Papa Paulo avenue. She goes out to sell it from 7pm-1am. She has been doing this for quite a while and she has many clients; her anticucho is considered to be the best in all of Cochabamba.

She would like a loan to pay off personal debts and also to invest a little in raw ingredients for the anticuchos, mainly to buy the hearts, some potatoe and some carbon every two days. This is Patricia's third loan with our institution and if she has ever been behind in payments it has been for good reason, as she was quite ill and could not go out to sell regularly for a while.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Patricia no tiene una casa propia y vive como cuidadora en la casa de una de sus amistades, tiene sólo una hija de 8 años de edad y es madre soltera. Su negocio de venta de anticuchos (corazon de res) se encuentra ubicado en la esquina de la avenida Papa Paulo y sólo sale a vender por las noches a partir de las 7:00 de la noche hasta la 1:00 de la madrugada, tiene bastante experiencia en el negocio y bastante clientela ya que sus anticuchos son considerados los mejores de todo Cochabamba. La presente solicitud es para pagar unas deudas que tiene con terceras personas y también invertirá un poco en la adquisición de materia prima para los anticuchos, generalmente compra corazón, papa y carbón cada dos días. Esta es la tercera solicitud de Patricia en nuestra Institución y si bien algunas veces presentó algunos retrasos fueron justificados ya que la pasada gestión ella se encontraba delicada de salud y no podía salir a vender regularmente.

loans.use: Tp pay off personal debts/Pago deudas personales

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is forty one years old and she has six children. She has been preparing and selling of local dishes like banku (meal prepared from milled maize), fufu (pounded cassava and plantain or cocoyam), rice ball, and konkonte (meal prepared from cassava flour) for the past fourteen years.

Yaa prepares and sells her dishes in the evening to her customers. She now wants to prepare and sell dishes in the morning because her customers want food to eat in the morning. She therefore wants to use this loan to buy more cassava, plantain, cocoyam, and soup ingredients and also to fix a shed as an eating place.

She is a member of the group called Exodus. Members of the group guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

Yaa is shown in the photo above.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cassava, cocoyam, spices, etc

loans.name: Nisile

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 39 year-old Nisile G.. She is married and has 3 children aged 8,12 and 16. In 1995, Nisile established her crops business.She now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilitation as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is married, but her husband's income from taxi driving is not sufficient for Mary and her four children. Mary sells ice water and food. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Elodia

texts.es:
Elodia works as a domestic employee and her husband is an electrician. The loan would purchase work tools for her husband in order to improve their income since they have two school-age children.

Her home is located in the Irpavi II district of La Paz. They do not have their own residence since she lives as a caregiver.

This is the fifth time she has requested a loan, and the third time she has needed the support of Kiva. Her record qualifies her as a #1 client in the payment of her installments.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Elodia trabaja como empleada domestica y su esposo es electricista y el crédito será destinado para la compra de herramientas de trabajo para su esposo y asi mejorar sus ingresos ya que tienen dos hijos en edad escolar.

Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz, no cuenta con una vivienda propia por lo cual vive como cuidadora.

Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito, y la tercera vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas.

loans.use: Purchase of tools for her husband's electrician business.

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.en:
Abdurasul U.  is 26 years old, and he is married and has 2 children. He works in a diagnostic center for mobile telephone repair. He has 5 years work experience and now he plans to modernize his existing business to use up-to-date technologies. 

Mr. U.  is applying to KIVA for financial support through a business development loan of 2100 STJ for 5 months for purchasing a new computer.

loans.use: purchasing a new computer

loans.name: L'entente Est Bonne Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre (4) membres du groupe Benkadi (deux mariés et deux célibataires) ont une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et 1 enfant. Elles vivent généralement dans des familles monogames dans le quartier Médine de la ville de  Sikasso.(troisième région économique de la république du Mali)
Elles font généralement le commerce de condiments alimentaires de charbon de bois et d’habits pour enfant. Les femmes du groupe Benkadi ont une relation de voisinage d’alliances et d’amitié. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire de groupe avec le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Les sources d’approvisionnement sont diverses et variées suivant les articles : pour le charbon de bois c’est essentiellement sur place et dans les villages environnants avec les paysans officiellement mandatés pour l’exercice de cette activité. Quant aux condiments alimentaires et les habits pour enfant ils sont achetés auprès des grossistes du grand marché de la ville de Sikasso.
Elles effectuent leurs ventes sur place à Sikasso en gros au comptant en détail et au marché surtout les jours de foire. Leur clientèle est composée de forains grossistes venant des villes, de femmes et de quelques hommes.
Avec ce prêt les membres du groupe Benkadi comptent réaliser des bénéfices moyens mensuels de 30.000FCFA qu’elles utiliseront à payer les intérêts du prêt et investir le reste dans leurs activités respectives.
texts.en:
The four (4) members of the Benkadi group ( two married and two single women) are on average, 31 years of age and have one (1) child. In general, they live in monogamous families in the neighborhood of Medine in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region in the republic of Mali). Their businesses are in the sale of basic food condiments, charcoal, and children's clothing. The women of the Benkadi group have a relationship that is friendly and mutually beneficial. This is their fifth group loan taken together through the loan program at the Siri Yiriwaso microbank. All their previous loans have been properly repaid.

The sources where they purchase their provisions are diverse and varied but follow the group's articles: Charcoal is usually made in place in the surrounding villages from specified individuals, mandated to produce this product. As for the basic condiments and children's clothing, they are purchased in bulk from wholesalers at the central market in the city of Sikasso.

They sell their items in the Sikasso marketplace, mostly for cash and especially when there are fair days at the market. Their clients are made up of stall owners, wholesalers from other towns, women and some men.

With the loan the members of the Benkadi group expect to earn profits averaging 30,000 francs CFA which will be used to meet the loan payments and invest the remainder in their respective business activities.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal, basic food condiments and children's clothing.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna, de 49 años, es madre de 6 hijos, a los mismos que gracias  a su esfuerzo y trabajo sacó adelante, siendo ahora ya profesionales e independientes, hijos, que en su momento fueron su esperanza de seguir adelante. Ahora la señora Reyna solo tiene a su lado a su esposo Feliciano, quien la ayuda mucho, y es quien madruga para comprar en el puerto, el pescado que ella vende. Trabaja para sentirse bien y útil, y desde luego mejorar su economía.Reyna quiere comprar un puesto en el mercado, es por eso que necesita de un capital que le permita cumplir su objetivo.  Apoyemos a esta madre que con ahínco y esfuerzo sigue trabajando arduamente  para prosperar.
texts.en:
Reyna is 49 years old and mother of six children, who have a good life thanks to her effort and work; her children are already professionals and independent. They were her hope for making a better life. Now Señora Reyna only has her husband Feliciano at her side, who helps her a lot by waking up in the very early morning to buy fish from the harbor that Reyna sells. She works to feel good and useful and lately to improve her economy. Reyna wants to buy a stand at the market, and it is for this reason that she needs capital to fulfill her objective. Let's support this mother, who with much determination and effort continues working arduously to be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a stand at the market for selling fish.

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
María de Jesús inició el negocio ya que inicialmente le ayudaba a vender zapatos por catalogo a una vecina pero después decidió venderlos por su cuenta, después empezó a vender ropa ya que sus hijas se la daban en buenas condiciones y ahora se dedica a este ramo ya que al no contar con dinero suficiente para invertir mas zapatos prefirió cambiar de giro, ahora quiere dedicarse a vender exclusivamente ropa pero necesita de una inversión fuerte para surtir una buena cantidad así que con la ayuda de kiva espera lograrlo.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para invertir en mercancía para la próxima temporada decembrina ya que es cuando las ventas se incrementan.
texts.en:
María de Jesús started her business because initially she helped her neighbor to sell shoes by catalog but then decided to sell them on her own. Later she started to sell clothing because her daughters' used clothes were in good condition. She is now dedicated to clothing sales since she doesn't have the money necessary to invest in shoes so she prefers this instead. Now she has decided to sell clothing exclusively but she needs to make a large investment to be able to offer a good quantity and so with Kiva's help she hopes to achieve this. She needs a loan for $400, which she will repay in six months, to invest in merchandise for the upcoming holiday season because that's when the sales increase.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia es socia del Banco comunal “Espíritu Santo” del Centro poblado D. Chimbo del distrito y Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 40 años D. edad  y es madre D. 6 hijos, 2 mayores con familias y 4 que aun dependen D. ella,  no hizo estudios secundarios porque era huérfana, es casada, su esposo trabaja ayudándola en el negocio D. compra y venta D. ganado vacuno para engorD., antes D. iniciar con este negocio tenia una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes, hace 2 años que incursiona en la crianza D. animales y al que actualmente se dedica. Con el primer préstamo D. S/: 300.00 nuevos soles compro 01 vaca para engorD..

Con el préstamo D. S/: 3000.00 nuevos soles que solicitara y que pagara en 5 cuotas comprara  forraje, gallinazo,  afrecho, etc. 

Ella desea continuar con su negocio para tener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the Community bank "Espiritu Santo" (meaning Holy Spirit) of the Centro Poblado D. Chimbo located in the district and province of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 40 years old and she is mother of 6 children. Two are grown and have families of their own and the other four still deped on her. She did not have any secondary education because she was an orphan. She is married and her husband helps her with the business of buying and selling cattle. Before she started this business she had a small convenience store. For the past 2 years she has been raising cattle, a business she still carries out. With ther first loan of S/.300 neuvos soles she purchased one cow.

With this loan, amounting to S/.3000 and which will be repaid in 5 months, she will purchase hay, grain, bran cereal, etc.

She wishes to keep up her business to have better earnings.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase feed for cattle (hay, grain, bran cereal).

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Vân năm nay 40 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu cho gia đình chị là chăn nuôi và sản xuất bún. Với sự hỗ trợ của chồng và hai con đã trưởng thành  công việc chăn nuôi, sản xuất của gia đình chị đang phát triển rất thuận lợi và cho thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.
 Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua gạo dự trữ phục vụ cho việc sản xuất bún tăng thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi V. is 40 years old. She has participated in TYM Fund since 2004. Currently, raising livestock and making vermicelli bring the main part of her family's income. With the support of her husband and two children who are grown up, her business is growing well and brings an income of VND3,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND15,000,000 to buy rice to stock up for the vermicelli making business to increase income for her family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice to make vermicelli

loans.name: Zaria

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Zaria A. Majid from Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children ages seven and ten. Zaria has run a grocery business since 2007. She works at the business for 9-12 hours a day, six days a week. Maria currently earns about $350 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase additional stocks of foods such as rice, potatoes, maize and wheat flour. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her goods. Maria thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of foods such as rice, potatoes, maize and wheat flour

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba has been a firewood and juice seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 5 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $250. Every day she works at her business for 14 hours. She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more firewood and juice materials for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to pay the school fees of her children and save money.

Habiba is 40 years old, is married, and has 6 children. .

loans.use: To buy more firewood and juice materials for her business

loans.name: Holberdi

texts.ru: Нодиров Холберди  житель города Вахдат . Женат и имеет  шестерых детей . Занимается  животноводством. Имеет хозяйство , где разводит крупно рогатый скот. Занимается этим видом деятельности уже пять лет.Планирует получить кредит  сроком на шесть месяцев. Использует деньги для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Holberdi N. lives in Vakhdat. He is married with six children. Holberdi has a farm and for the past five years has worked in animal hudbandry. Holberdi would like to receive a six-month loan in order to purchase more livestock.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more livestock

loans.name: Nanding Diarra

texts.fr: Nanding Diarra Sané est mariée avec 01 personne à sa charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Niaguis Néma depuis 7 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre de la pâte d’arachide, du jus de citron et de l’huile de palme. Elle veut  renforcer son commerce et améliorer la scolarité et l’habillement de ses enfants. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Nanding Diarra Sané is married and has one dependent. She has been a member of the Niaguis Néma village bank for seven years. She buys and sells peanut paste, lemon juice and palm oil. She wants to bolster her business and pay for her children's tuition and their clothing. The loan she is asking for will be repaid in one lump sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell peanut paste, lemon juice and palm oil

loans.name: Luci Yeni

texts.es:
269, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 49 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Se inicio con S/. 200.00 por iniciativa propia y con el apoyo de su hija mayor comenzó vendiendo frutas y quesos en el mercado.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, ubicada en su misma casa, donde sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/2,000.00 que pagara en un  plazo de 06  meses, lo invertirá, comprando más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, papel higiénico en paquete, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela, también comprara un andamio, para exhibir e incrementar sus productos.

Es ella quien  toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que es más Independiente, segura y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Luci Yeni, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Luci Yeni lives in the Juanjui district in the San Martin state. She is married, 49 years old, and a mother of 3 children, 2 of whom she still supports. With start up capital of S/ 200 and the support of her oldest daughter, she started selling fruits and cheeses in the market. Currently, she sells groceries out of her home where her primary clients are friends and neighbors. With this loan of S/ 2,000, to be paid in 6 monthly payments, she will invest in the purchase of more products to grow her business such as rice, sugar, toilet paper, milk, fish preservatives, personal hygeine and cleaning products, and other products to maintain customer satisfaction. She will also buy shelving to display and increase her products. Luci makes all of her own business decisions Personally, she would like to be more independent, secure, and responsible with her loan payments. Luci Yeni would like to express her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as an entrepreneur and woman.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of products such as rice, sugar, toilet paper, milk, and more

loans.name: Dony

texts.es:
La señora Dony, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Vencedoras de Villa Universitaria”, vive en el Jr. Cajamarca Nº 170 – AA.HH. 10 de Agosto, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 28 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 por iniciativa propia emprendió su  negocio de Venta de Abarrotes, que desde sus principios le dio buenos resultados, por la calidad de sus productos, sus precios cómodos y al gusto D. cliente.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donde sus principales clientes son moradores de la comunidad, vecinos y amigos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 300.00 que cancelará a un  plazo de 04 meses, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza D. hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela, 
Hoy se siente muy feliz de la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece a Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dony is a member of the communal bank “Las Vencedoras de Villa Universitaria (The Victorious of Villa University)”, and lives at 170 Cajamarca St., settlement of 10 de Agosto, District of Tarapoto, Region of San Martin. She has a partner, is 28 years old, and the mother of two children who depend on her.

With her first loan of 300 PEN she launched, of her own initiative, a business selling groceries which has given her good results since the outset due to the quality of her products, her convenient prices, and because her customers are pleased. Today she continues with the same business located in her home. Her main customers are the residents of the community, neighbors and friends.

With this loan of 300 PEN, which will be paid on a four month plan, she will buy more products to stock her business such as rice and sugar in bulk, cartons of eggs, personal hygiene products, household cleaning products, cartons of sodas, candy, and other products to keep her clientele happy.

Today she feels very happy with the work and service she provides, and she appreciates Manuela Ramos for supporting people like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes that they continue doing the same for a long time and that they help many families and enterprising women.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase groceries such as eggs, sugar, rice, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Jamila Khanum M. Roshan Group

texts.en:
Jamila khanum baji is married to M. R., and they have been living in Borewala, Pakistan, since past 10 years. Her husband is a painter by profession, who goes to people’s houses to paint when they place an order with him. Jamila baji helps him by sewing clothes. She takes orders from her neighbors and relatives. She does this work to share the financial burden of her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy material (paint brushes, big paint drums) for her husband’s painting business.

She is the group leader of two other women from her locality. Bushran baji wants a loan to buy CDs for her CD shop. Nasira baji wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan and the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Mr. Carlos A. is 40 years old and married to Mrs. Ramona Cabañas, who is 30 years old and with whom he has five school-aged children.

He has been working selling milk and making cheese since 1998. In order to start this activity he received some help from his father, who gave him a cow and calf. From there he began to sell his products from a bicycle, which he used as a way to deliver his products every morning.

It’s due to the purity and quality of the product that the demand is so high. Currently he has four milk-producing cows with calves and a well-formed clientele to provide for every morning.

The credit applied for is to buy a motorcycle because his clientele has increased and he needs to be able to deliver milk faster and in time for families’ breakfast. One of his goals is to be able to buy his own land with some space, as he is currently living in his parents’ house.

loans.use: The purchase a motorcycle for milk delivery

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina A. is 28 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, one girl and one boy who are both in primary school at the moment. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Angelina’s husband runs a drinking spot. She is a trader. She trades in utensils. She buys her goods, sets of utensils, from Kumasi at affordable prices and sells at the market square in her community. She hawks and treks to other markets to sell as well. Angelina has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She wants to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy utensils in bulk

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita C. is a strong and determined 57-year-old woman from the island village of Binangonan, Rizal province, in the Philippines. She is widowed with a son, Harold, who is 31 years old and a priest.

In 1995, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She was then full of hope to alleviate the status of the family from poverty. Of her almost 15 years of membership in ASHI, she is noted for her exemplary performance. Now on her 11th loan, she is seeking the amount of 45,000 pesos to purchase three sets of fish nets and one engine for their boat.

She dreams of having a sustainable business and of being able to build her dream house that is more durable and spacious.

loans.use: To purchase three fishing nets and one motor for her fishing boat

loans.name: Laura Josefina

texts.es:
Laura es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza. 
Laura es casada, tiene 52 años y 3 hijos, Laura tiene un taller de confecciones llamado DIORS, para lo cual cuenta con 5 personas que trabajan con ella en la confección de prendas a medida.
Laura necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de botones, cierres.
Laura sueña con tener una tienda, boutique y comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
Laura is a member of the communal bank group “Nobleza”. She is 52 years old, married and has 3 children. Laura has a workshop called DIORS, which employs 5 people who make clothing according to specified measurements.

Laura needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase buttons and zippers. She dreams of owning a boutique and purchasing a plot of land.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase buttons & zippers

loans.name: Vicente De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Vicente es un hombre  que se ha dedicado a trabajar para salir adelante con su familia, pues ha trabajado en obras de construcción  y hoy que se desempeña en cobranza de una casa comercial. Tiene 43 años, su esposa le tiene un hijo de 15 años estudiante, ella trabaja en como conserje para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino, sus planes para su familia es poder terminar de mejorar su casa. Con este préstamo en Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción para agrandar un cuarto y poder estar cómodo, este es  su cuarto ciclo en la institución el cual da las gracias ya que se ha beneficiado para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Vicente is a man who has dedicated himself to working so that his family can succeed; he has worked as a construction worker and now he works in collections for a home business. He is 43 years old, and he and his wife have a 15-year-old son who is a student. His wife works as a housekeeper to help her husband with household expenses. They live in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood.

His plans for his family are to finish improving their house. With this loan from Afodenic he will be able to buy construction materials to enlarge a room and be able to be comfortable. This is his fourth loan cycle with the institution, and he is thankful that he has been able to improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials to enlarge a room

loans.name: Momagul

texts.ru: Нурхонова Момагул проживает в районе Яван. Возраст 56 лет. Женат, имеет 4  детей. Муж вместе с сыном работают на земле. Сама Момагул более 15 лет занимается продажей скота. Она откармливает и продает скот не рынке. Кредит просит для закупа скота.

loans.use: Закуп скота

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the Sun and Moon village bank. She is 50 years old, married, and has three children who are 24, 20, and 14 years old. The youngest is still in school. Silvia has a sewing business, and sells clothes for children and jump suits for schools. She began her business 5 years ago, receiving orders for her family’s workshop, where she had learned how to sew.

Recently, she bought a machine with her savings and with the help of her husband, and started her own sewing business. Silvia works alone in her house.
 
Silvia has been with FINCA for four years and since she joined things have changed for the better. With her loans, she has invested in her business and FINCA has also given her the opportunity to save. With her savings, Silvia was able to cover her children's needs.

Silvia needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she is going to invest in materials, cloth and accessories, thread, and lint materials. Her dream is to create her own business, have machines and staff, and to have many locations.

loans.use: To buy materials, cloth and accessories, thread, and lint materials.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Mrs. Feliciana is married to Mr. Antonio C., and they live with their two young children in the neighborhood of Inmaculada Concepión, around the city of Roque Gonzalez.
She is the owner of a grocery store that sells alternative kinds of merchandise. She also has many clients. With her credit, she will buy sugar, rice, and mate (an herbal tea) to sell in her shop.

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, and mate to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Caritas

texts.en:
Cartas M. is 30 years old and is married with two children aged 1 and 4 as well as one dependent of unknown age that the family cares for. Cartas lives in Gasabo district, in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Cartas owns a small shop selling foodstuffs. She has owned this business since 2007 and employs one person. The hours of the business are from 6 a.m. to 12 a.m. most days… or thereabouts.

Cartas is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company which will help her to buy some necessary items like a fridge as well as additional inventory items such as groundnuts (peanuts), beans etc. Through buying these products she believes she will better serve her customers and earn more profits to improve her living situation.

loans.use: To buy a fridge and additional inventory items

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
With her one year of experience in her business fattening pigs, Corazon wants to continue until she reaches her dreams in life. She is from the village of Santiago, Reina Mercedes, Isabela. She is 44 years of age and married to Jose, who is 43 years old. They are blessed with two children named Marlon and Editha. Marlon is a high-school graduate and has his own family, while Editha is presently taking her first year of college education.

Corazon dreams of seeing her child finish her education and have her own job for her future. She doesn’t have any wealth for her child to inherit, and she knows that education is the only wealth that she can give. Her business serves her in providing for her child's tuition fees during times of examination. She planned to sell her pigs because she does not have enough resources to cover her pigs' feed. When she heard about the program, she was interested, and finally she joined the program. She wanted to borrow the amount of 5,000 PHP for the purchase of pig feed, so they will become healthy and have a heavy weight when they are sold to buyers.

loans.use: Maintenance of her pigs

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy D. est âgée de 44 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait de l’embauche bovine et du petit commerce de produits alimentaires. Son objectif est de rentabiliser son activité afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Amy D. is 44 years of age, married and the mother of 6 children. She does cattle fattening and petty trading of foodstuffs. Her aim is to make her business profitable in order to provide for the family needs.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To engage in cattle fattening and petty trading

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia P. is from the village of Marabulig, Cauayan City.  She is 50 years old, has three adult-aged children and is separated from her spouse. To make a living, Ofelia raises crops, mainly planting and harvesting rice.  Ofelia has been in business for over seven years and earns approximately Php100,000 every cropping season.

In 2008, Ofelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business.  Ofelia is requesting a new loan of Php50,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  This loan will be her fifth from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 
------------------------------------
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase aseeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La señora Josefa es socia del Banco Comunal “Lupakas” desde hace 3 meses atrás, del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Estudió primaria incompleta y se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.
Josefa nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar chanchitos y ovejas.
Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar su negocio y poder brindarle estudios a sus hijos.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Sra. Josefa has been a member of the Communal Bank “Lupakas” for 3 months. She lives in the District of Pilcuyo, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 25 years old, married, and has 4 children. Josefa was not able to complete her elementary school education, but she now engages in buying and selling livestock.

She tells us that the first loan she requested from Manuela Ramos was for 500 soles and was used to increase her capital. Josefa is now requesting another loan of 500 soles so that she can buy piglets and sheep.

Her dream for the future is to increase her business and be able to provide for her children’s education. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the savings account and the meetings with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase piglets & sheep

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La señora María  Elena D. forma parte del banco comunal Esperanza para Superar, estas socias se reúnen en el balneario San Jacinto en la zona norte de Manabí.

María está  casada tiene una hija de 13 años, a más de ser ama de casa tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de helados caseros  que ella prepara,  también tiene un kiosco donde vende cosas de picar  como pan de yuca, empanadas y tortillas solo los fines de semana, sus labores empiezan  muy temprano porque debe tener listos los helados para las once de la mañana para lo cual se compró un congelador grande donde caben 300 helados aproximadamente.

La hija de María es de gran ayuda en el negocio  de venta de  helados mientras que ella sale a comprar los productos necesarios para prepararlos,  los préstamos recibidos  de la Fundación son destinados  para sus negocios y con  el nuevo  crédito solicitado va a comprar  leche, azúcar, esencias, canela y frutas para elaborar sus deliciosos helados.
texts.en:
María Elena D. is a member of the communal bank "Esperanza para Superar." The members meet in the San Jacinto resort in the area north of Manabí. Maria is married and has a 13 year-old daughter. In addition to being a housewife she has a small business selling homemade ice cream that she prepares; she also has a kiosk where she sells things to eat like cassava bread, empanadas and tortillas on the weekends. She begins her work very early in the morning because she has to have the ice cream ready by 11 in the morning. She purchased a large freezer where she can fit approximately 300 ice creams. Maria's daughter helps in the business selling the ice creams while she leaves to buy the products necessary to prepare them. The funds borrowed from the foundation are intended for her business. The new loan sought will be used to buy milk, sugar, extracts, cinnamon and fruit to make delicious ice cream.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, extracts, cinnamon and fruit

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn P. is from the village of Victoria in Alicia, Isabela. She is 34 years old. Marilyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn sells "sawali" and "cogon" (long grasses that, when dried, are used for the roofs and walls of houses) in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2009, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Marilyn's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: 
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Las Palomas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama: Las Palomas porque el punto de reunión es donde abundan palomas, el grupo lo integran 12 personas Marcelina G. V. y Macedonia H. venden antojitos, Gudelia G. O., Evelia Enedina M. G. y Efigenia P. V. venden dulces y frituras, Emperatriz López S., Luciana Teresa López M. Susana López M. y Maria Eugenia López H. venden productos de belleza por catalogos como son perfumes cremas etc., Antonia M. S. se dedica a bordar huipiles (ropa tipica), Erica Nora R. M. vende calzado por catalogo y Lucia Matilde O. N. tiene un establecimiento fijo donde vende articulos para regalos.
Gudelia es la representante del grupo es casada tiene tres hijos y ella decidio vender dulces ya  desde que inicio con esta actividad hace ya tres años ha obtenido utilidades muy satisfactorias de las que ha podido apoyar a sus hijos junto con su esposo en el sustento apoyarlo para que acudan a la escuela y logren tener su profesión,tambien va a iniciar a vender alimentos a estudiantes y al publico en general ya que pretende obtener mas ingresos.
Con el credito que obtenga de Fundación Realidad va a surtir su negocio en mayor volumen y tambien comprará ingredientes para preparar alimentos comos son: verduras, carnes, mariscos, refrescos, cafe, azucar, huevos, tortillas, aceite, y gas.
Doña Gude como mejor la conocen se siente agradecida por el apoyo que le ha brindado la Fundación y las personas que intervienen en el financiamiento como son los prestatarios de KIVA ya que ella sueña con tener un lugar fijo para vender mas cosas como ella comenta ella recomienda a su gente ya que dice son gente responsables y pagadoras.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Palomas" ("The Pigeons"), because pigeons are abundant near the place where they hold their meetings. The group includes 12 people: Marcelina G. V. and Macedonia H. sell snacks; Gudelia G. O., Evelia Enedina M. G. and Efigenia P. V. sell sweets and fried foods; Emperatriz López S., Luciana Teresa López M., Susana López M. and Maria Eugenia López H. sell beauty products such as perfumes, creams, etc. from catalogs; Antonia M. S. weaves huipiles (a traditional article of clothing); Erica Nora R. M. sells shoes from a catalog; and Lucia Matilde O. N. has a permanent store where she sells gift items. Gudelia is the group's representative. She is married and has three children. Three years ago, she started a business selling sweets, and since then it has provided her with very satisfactory profits. This income has allowed her to support her children in conjunction with her husband, so that they can go to school and learn a profession. Gudelia also plans to start selling food to students and to the public in general, in hope of further increasing her income. With the loan provided by the Realidad Foundation, she will stock her business with a greater volume of goods, and she will also purchase ingredients to prepare food to sell, such as vegetables, meat, seafood, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, eggs, tortillas, cooking oil and gas for cooking. Doña Gude, as she is called by those who know her well, is grateful for the support provided to her by the Foundation and by the other people involved in the financing, such as KIVA lenders. Her dream is to have a permanent shop where she can sell more products. She reports that she recommends her people, because she says they are responsible and dependable with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing products to sell and ingredients for prepared food

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Cliente es minero artesanal se dedica mas de 10 años de experiencia en este negocio actividad que la permitió solventar su gastos familiares cuenta con buenas referencias de amigos y vecinos  por lo que se propone el financiamiento 
Solicita crédito para el mejoramiento de su domicilio  . La Sr. López Fernández Gregorio  tiene 46 años de edad vive en casa propia juntamente con su cónyuge tiene cinco hijos en edad escolar
texts.en:
Customer is a small-scale miner. He has more than 10 years experience in this business and has been able to support his family by mining. He has good references from friends and neighbors, which he used to help him apply for this loan. He requests this loan to improve his residence. Mr. López Fernández Gregorio is 46 years old. He lives in his own house with his spouse and their five school age children.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home Improvement

loans.name: Mene

texts.es:
Mene es un hombre laborioso de 28 años, vive con su esposa (27), sus 4 menores hijos y su hijastra de 12 años. Está familia tiene su casa propia construida con madera y hojas, muy característico de la selva central del Perú.

Con la esperanza de disfrutar aún más de sus hijos y de tener una vejez tranquila, Mene trabaja incansablemente. “Ahora, estando en mi juventud quiero trabajar todo lo que puedo, hasta donde mis fuerzas lo permitan, porque si malgasto el dinero de qué voy a vivir, por eso invierto bien los montos que llegan a mis manos”, menciona. 
Con la ayuda de su esposa y desde hace 10 años, cultiva café, plátanos, palta, yuca y maíz en sus terrenos propios, productos que le resultan bastante rentables, ya que los cuida con dedicación para obtener buenas cosechas.
Para el futuro piensa sembrar en mayor cantidad, además desea instalar una tienda de comestibles en un espacio de su vivienda, con el generaría otros ingresos económicas aparte de la agricultura.

Este es el cuarto préstamo tiene con MFP, él está muy orgulloso y seguro de que el trabajo en su banco comunal le ayudó a ser más responsable en sus pagos, actitud que también puso en práctica en cada decisión de su vida cotidiana. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de cientos de plantas de frutas cítricas y varios sacos de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Mene is a hard working, 28-year-old man who lives with his 27-year-old wife, their 4 young children, and his 12-year-old stepdaughter. The family has their own house, built with wood and leaves, which is very characteristic of the central forest of Peru. With the hope of enjoying his time with his children even more and living calmly when he gets older, Mene works tirelessly. "Now, being young, I want to work as much as I can, to the point my energy allows me. If I waste my money, how will I live? For this reason, I invest wisely the money that reaches my hands", he mentions. With the help of his wife, for the last 10 years he has cultivated coffee, plantains, avocados, yucca, and corn on his own land. These products are quite profitable for him, since he cares for them with dedication in order to obtain good harvests. In the future, he plans to plant in greater quantity, and furthermore, he desires to set up a grocery store in a space in his home. With this, he would be able to generate other income aside from agriculture. This is the fourth loan he has requested through MFP. He is very proud and certain that the work in his communal bank helped him to become more responsible in his payments; an attitude that he also puts in practice in every decision of his everyday life. The money that he is currently requesting, he plans to invest in the purchase of hundreds of citric fruit plants and several sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruit plants and fertilizer

loans.name: Chidinma

texts.en:
Chidinma sells cooking oil to make a living in Benin City, Edo state. Cooking oil is essential in the preparation of soup in Nigeria. She has been in this business for seven years. 

This business has helped her financial position and she is able to contribute to her family's upkeep. She is asking for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more cooking oil to sell.

She is 49 years old and married with eight children. Her children are doing well in school. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La señora Maria Francisca tiene 56 años es madre de familia, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado a orillas de la carretera León-Managua en un poblado. la actividad económica de Francisca es la elaboración de artesanías en su casa de habitación, realiza la actividad de manera manual. Hace 16 años tiene este negocio porque tenía que proporcionarle a su familia una estabilidad económica y a sus hijos una educación, su esposo le ayuda para la elaboración de las piezas y luego salen a venderlas o bien llegan algunos  clientes a su vivienda. El financiamiento es para compra de materia prima y elaborar artículos de barro para su venta. Pues sus deseos son de tener dinero suficiente para trabajar con capital propio y dar una estabilidad  económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Francisca, 56, is a mother; her address is in a settlement along the León-Managua highway. She makes handmade handicrafts at home. She has been in this line of work for 16 years because she needed to provide her family with economic stability and provide her children with an education. Her husband helps her make the items and then they go out to sell them; sometimes customers come by their house to buy. She will use the funds to buy raw materials to make clay items to sell. Her wish is to have enough funds to work with her own capital and provide economic stability for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her crafts.

loans.name: Kaï

texts.fr: Née en 1984 à Allada dans le département de l'Atlantique, V. Kaï est mariée à ALLOGOU Hervé, un chauffeur. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé. La famille vit depuis une dizaine d'année au quartier Ahito à Allada. Kaï  vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges de la famille. Kaï n'a pas été à l'école. Il y a environs cinq ans que Kaï mène comme activité, la vente de produits cosmétiques à Allada, ce qui lui permet de faire face à ses besoins et d'assurer les besoins de son enfant. Kaï achète ses produits à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Kaï a déjà obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, et a bien effectué le remboursement. Dans le but d'augmenter son fonds de roulement, d'accoître sa clientèle et de mieux la satisfaire, Kaï sollicite un deuxième appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1984 in Allada in the Department of the Atlantic, Kaï V. is married to Hervé ALLOGOU, a driver. The couple have a child who is attending school. The family has lived for the past ten years in the Ahito borough of Allada. Kaï helps her husband and shares with him the various household expenses. Kaï has never attended school. Some five years ago she began selling beauty products in Allada, which enables her to meet her needs and those of her child. She gets her supplies from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Kaï has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which was repaid in full. She is now requesting a second financial loan, to increase her working capital, expand her customer base and improve customer satisfaction.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora tiene 53 años, comparte su vida con su esposo y con el menor D. sus 5 hijos, juntos viven en su casa propia. Hace más D. 30 años se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando papa, maíz y alfalfa. Es así que desD. que siembra espera un periodo largo, dándoles los cuidados necesarios D. sus tierras, para que la cosecha sea muy productiva y pueda rápidamente ser comercializada en el mercado. Toda la familia participa D. manera activa en esta labor, ya que las ganancias que reciben son en beneficio D. todos sus hijos. Paralelamente a esta actividad, tiene una fábrica D. ladrillos, en donD. su esposo se encarga D. este trabajo. Dora manifiesta que ha tenido momentos duros en la agricultura, pero no desanima, es mas continuara sembrando en sus terrenos y mejorar con el tiempo. Es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que promete será muy responsable con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. sacos D. abono, asimismo desea comprar  ramas D. leña para su elaborar ladrillos.
texts.en:
Dora is 53 and shares her life with her husband and the youngest of their 5 children; they live together in their own home. For over 30 years she has worked in agriculture, sowing potatoes, corn and alfalfa. Thus, after she sows she waits for a long period of time, giving the necessary care to her land, so that the harvest will be very productive and will sell quickly in the market. The whole family actively participates in this work, as the income is beneficial to all of the children. She also has a brick factory, where her husband is in charge of the work. Dora says that there have been difficult moments in farming, but she is not discouraged, and she will continue to sow in her land and improve with time. This is her third loan with MFP, and so she promises to be very responsible with her payments. With the requested loan, she will invest in the purchase of bags of fertilizer. She also wants to buy bushels of firewood for brick-making.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Mrs. Nov H., age 32, lives in Tuol Svay village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Youn Yos, are farmers who own two hectares of land to grow rice and vegetables, which allows them to earn a small income to support their family. 

In order to support this farm, Mrs. Nov H. has decided to ask for a loan in order to dig a well and to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline in order to support her farming crops. 

This couple has two children: one is attending the local school and the other is five years old. Her husband appears  in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Kazinga Bakyara Twetungure, Mubende Group

texts.en:
In business, first impressions mean everything. That is one adage that never slips K. Harriet’s mind, who at first operated a retail shop and later gained interest in owning a bar business. In her three years doing a bar business, her commitment, friendly nature and hard work have brought her dividends in Kazinga, Mubende. 

This is the fascinating story of a young divorced mother of three children who is a go-getter in business. Her business since its inception has been steadily bringing her profits to the tune of about $143 on a monthly basis. 

With this loan she is gleefully upbeat that her business will gain further ground, as she intends to buy more stock of drinks like beer, soda and wine. She also sees herself acquiring a motorcycle. This will earn her more revenue and enable her to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: restocking drinks in her pub

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of materials for his shoemaking workshop such as leather, insoles, nails, etc.

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed lives in a small city called Borewala, which is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. She is a housewife and spends all of her time in her home to do her household responsibilities. She lives in a two-room brick house and has no child yet.

Her husband runs a small hotel (restaurant) in the nearby market where he sells Punjabi food such as Nan kabab and Biryani and serves tea as well. His hotel is the busiest one in the market because he has been running it for the last 16 years. He has not only earned good income but also a good reputation among his customers. He serves his customers quality food and takes care of them with good a seating arrangement and excellent service, serving food without any delay.  

Fatima has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, he will buy required items such as spices, cooking oil, rice and potatoes in larger quantity for his hotel. 

Fatima is hopeful that her husband will be able to successfully upgrade his business and increase his income. She is sure that with this investment, his business conditions will become better and more customers will come to his hotel and enjoy quality food. 

She is in her second loan cycle and is a very responsible loan user of Asasah. In the previous year of loan experience, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: Purchase required items for hotel (restaurant) business

loans.name: Flor Alejandrina

texts.es:
Flor tiene 38 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de San Jorge, departamento de San Miguel, es soltera, vive con la madre y posee una tienda con venta de productos básicos.
El negocio es herencia y fundado por la madre hace diez años, el horario que atiende el negocio es de 5:00am-8:00pm todos los días de la semana, una de las ventajas es que no tiene competencia, actualmente ella necesita dinero para invertir en compra de nuevos productos, por cual está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de aceite, azúcar, frijoles, maíz, entre otros, este le ayudara a incrementar mas su negocio, generar ingresos para cubrir gastos económicos y financieros. 
Las aspiraciones son mantener el negocio y hacer crecer para apoyar a su familia, mejor las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Flor is 38 years old and she lives in the municipality of San Jorge in the San Miguel region. She is single and she lives with her mother. She has a grocery store. Her business was inherited from her mother who established it ten years ago. She opens the store from 5am to 8 pm every day of the week. One of the great advantages is that she has no competition. She needs a loan to invest in the purchase of new products such as cooking oil, sugar, beans, corn etc. This will help her supplement her business and generate an income to fill her financial needs. Her aspirations are to keep up and develop her business and to support her family, to provide them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, sugar, beans, corn, etc.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva N. is a widow  who lives in Purok 1, Brgy. Cabacungan, La Castellana, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:   Dressmaking / Sewing, Ready-to-Wear Clothes and Food Vending businesses.  

Eva joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Eva has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,700, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 7th loan, she is borrowing PHP 16,000 which she intends to use to buy stock for her Ready-to-Wear Clothes inventory and materials for sewing so that she can continue to save up for the  future.  

Eva N. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia G. is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Lydia is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a business providing pedicure and manicure services for the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lydia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Lydia is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the first loan taken by Lydia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase manicure and pedicure supplies

loans.name: C1166 Intambwe Group

texts.en:
Theresphore was born in 1981. He is married with two children. One of the children is 5 years and other one is 7 years old. Theresphore is a farmer as is his wife. They both work hard to develop their family. Theresphore is the group leader of 11 people, all farmers. Theresphore is known for his agriculture business. He has four years of experience and he works every day except on Saturday. The hours of his daily activities are from 7 in the morning to 12 AM.

Theresphore and his group are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their daily activities through buying fertilizer and seeds. With this loan, these farmers will be able to earn more profits from their agriculture. With the profits expected, they will be able to sort out their family problems.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es: La señora Amalia es cliente antigua la actividad a la que se dedica es la venta D. comida la cual es realizada en la puerta D. su domicilio los días viernes, sábado y domingo, pero su actividad principal es la confección D. polleras la que realiza en su domicilio. La señora vive en anticrético en la calle entre ríos, vive con su esposo el que se dedica al trabajo en imprenta y con su hijo quien estudia en un instituto. El crédito será destinado en la compra D. tela por esta temporada tiene contratos para confeccionar polleras para lo cual debe D. comprar cortes D. tela y también en la compra D. abarrotes (arroz, fideo, papa y chuño) por mayor. Es una persona muy amable y muy trabajadora.
texts.en: Amalia is an old customer and she sells food from her home on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays, but her main activity is making skirts in her home. She lives in anticrético (a special tenant-friendly renting arrangement in Bolivia) on the street between rivers. She lives with her husband, who works at a printing press and with her son, who's in high school. The loan will be for the purchase of cloth for this season. She has contracts to make skirts for which she should buy swaths of fabric. She also needs to buy groceries (rice, noodles, potatoes, and potato flour) wholesale. She's a very nice and hardworking person.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric to make skirts and purchase of groceries

loans.name: Ines Milagros

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Ines Milagros; tiene 33 años de edad, y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant llamado el club de nutrición, donde brindan servicio de desayunos, almuerzos y cenas saludables, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,la socia quiere mejorar el negocio. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar.


La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ines Milagros belongs to the “Sumac Puririsun” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Ines Milagros is 33 years old, married and has 3 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her restaurant which is called “El Club de Nutrición” (The Nutrition Club).  She provides healthy breakfasts, afternoon meals and suppers.  She works from 7.00am until 9.00pm and would like to improve her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy cooking products.

She is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy cooking products

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est mariée  et a  en charge 3 enfants. Elle  a 35 ans. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus, la vente de produits génériques.  Elle cumule 5 ans d’activité  déjà. Elle achète au grand marché de Lomé et revend au marché local d’akodessewa. Le crédit demandé servira à l’achat de nouveaux lots de produits pour mieux répondre à la demande.
texts.en:
Abla is married and is in charge of three children. She is 35 years old.
