Her income generating business is the sale of generic items. She has already accumulated five years of experience.
The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase new batches of goods in order to better meet the demand.

loans.use: Purchase of generic goods

loans.name: Jesus Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Cortina es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable ya tiene mas de 20 años atendiendo un despacho contable que ubico en su propio domicilio sus hijos ya están grandes y ya no dependen de su padre económicamente, su esposa su compañera de vida, siempre lo ha apoyado antes ella también trabajaba como empleada pero ya hace unos años dejo de laborar y se dedica a su casa y atender a su marido ella le ayuda en todo lo que puede en la oficina, el crédito lo requiere para mejorar el aspecto de su oficina para tener una buena presentación de la misma.
texts.en: Mr Cortina is a very hard-working and responsible person.  He has been working in his accountancy office, which is located in his own home, for 20 years.  His children are already grown up and no longer depend on their father financially.  His wife, his life companion, has always supported him.  She used to work in his business as an employee but some years ago she stopped working and devoted herself to her home and looking after her husband.  She helps him with everything she can in his office.  He requires this loan to improve the appearance of his office so that it makes a good impression.

loans.use: To buy furniture for his office

loans.name: Sandra Nora

texts.es:
Sandra es socia del Banco Comunal “12 de Agosto”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años, de estado civil soltera, tiene estudios de educación superior incompleta.

Trabaja desde hace tres años con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en lanas para la fabricación de tejidos, ahora trabaja con artefactos y juguetes.

Solicitará un  nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 1300.00 nuevos soles, invertirá en juguetes para navidad, la señora no tiene un puesto seguro la cual será repartida a otros, le ayuda su padre.

Su sueño es tener su propio puesto de venta.

Le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the "12 de Agosto" community bank which is located in Puno district, in the province and department of the same name.  She is 32 years old, single and did not complete her higher education.

Sandra has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles.  She invested that money in buying wool for weaving.  She now works with crafts and toys.

Sandra is requesting a new loan for 1,300 Peruvian soles which she will invest in buying Christmas toys.  She does not have a stable sales location.  Her father helps her in her business.  Her dream is to have her own sales location.  What Sandra likes about her community bank is the convenience of the loans.

loans.use: To buy Christmas toys

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
Monsieur  DRISSA D. a  43 ans, monogame et père de trois enfants dont  2 garçons et 1 fille. Il réside avec sa femme et ses enfants à Médine, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Après avoir échoué à l’école, il s’est vite initié aux activités de stockage et commercialisation des céréales et de la vente du miel il y a 15 ans. Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et reçoit beaucoup de commandes , mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins font défaut. Ainsi, il intégra Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant  1 an  et a bénéficié d’un  prêt qui a été correctement remboursé. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il sollicite ainsi ce deuxième prêt au niveau de l’institution qui lui permettra d’acheter, 40 bidons de 20 litres de miel, 5 tonnes de maïs et  20 sacs de mil. 
Il s’approvisionne dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso et les stocke dans son magasin situé au nouveau du marché de  Médine Sikasso, ensuite  les revend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes à la fois en gros et en détail.    
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Drissa D. is 43 years old, he is monogamous and the father of three children, two boys and a girl. He lives with his wife and their children in Medine, a popular quarter in the village of Sikasso (third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 

After dropping out of school he quickly took up the business of storage and sale of cereal grains and honey. He has 15 years in the business. With this level of experience in the field, he enjoys a solid reputation and receives many orders, but he lacks the necessary resources to satisfy the demand. Therefore he joined Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) last year and he received a first loan, which has already been repaid. 

With the goal of satisfying his growing clientele, he requests a second loan from institution. He will be able to purchase 40 twenty-liter containers of honey, 5 tons of corn, and 20 sacks of millet. 

He makes his purchases in the surrounding regions of Sikasso and he stores the products in his store located in the market of Medine Sikasso. He resells to a clientele made up of both men and women, in retail and wholesale.

With the help of this loan he expects to make a monthly income of 150000FCFA. These earnings will be used to provide for his basic needs and those of his family, to pay the interest of his loan and to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase cereal grains and honey.

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es:
La señora Yamileth C. es una señora de 40 años de edad honrada responsable y emprendedora, actualmente casada con la compañía de 3 hijos de 3, 13 y 17 años. Ella es modista y posee su negocio propio que es un taller de costura.
Su deseo como microempresaria es obtener un crédito que le permita la oportunidad de ampliar su taller para ofrecer mejor el servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Yamileth C. is a 40 year old woman who is honest, responsible, and enterprising. She is currently married and has three children (ages 3, 13, and 17). Yamileth is a dressmaker and has her own business, a sewing workshop.

Her wish as a small business owner is to obtain a loan that will provide her with the opportunity to expand her workshop so that she can provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: Expansion of her workshop

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP MAME DIARRA est créé le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 23 femmes qui sont toutes du même quartier. Elles se sont regroupées par voisinage et par affinité et fonds pratiquement toutes le petit commerce comme activité principale

Madame MAME FATY D. tout à fait à droite de la photo et mise en médaillon est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. 

Elle du petit commerce de vêtements. Elle est aussi couturière de profession. 

Son crédit lui servira à acheter des vêtements à revendre et a acheter des fournitures de couture pour confectionner des vêtements qu'elle revend dans le quartier.

Son objectif est de soutenir financièrement son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille, et prendre aussi en charge sa progéniture.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Mame Diarra has been created on December 30, 2009. It is composed of 23 women all living in the same neighborhood. They are friends and neighbors who decided to form a group together. Almost all of them work primarily as vendors.

Mrs. Mame Faty D. to the far right in the photo (she also appears in the medallion) is the group leader’s leader. She is married and the mother of three dependent children.

She retails clothing. She is also a seamstress by profession. Her loan will allow her to purchase closing for resale as well as sewing accessories needed to sew clothes to be sold in her neighborhood.

Her goal is to help her husband financially with family expenses and to support her children.

loans.use: Purchasing clothing for resale, as well as sewing accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business premises

loans.name: Leidy Soledad

texts.es:
Leidy tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos dependiente.  Vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Tambogrande, ubicado en el departamento de Piura, a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de cerveza en 2 modalidades, una la venta como minorista a un precio mayor y el otro como un distribuidor a un precio menor hace mas de 3 años.  Esta actividad la realiza dentro de su domicilio.

Leidy quiere ampliar más su negocio, comprando más mercadería para después venderla y así obtener mayores ingresos y poder apoyar a su familia.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1200 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Leidy is 21 years old, single, and she doesn't have children or dependents.  She lives with her parents in the district of Tambogrande, located in the department of Piura. It is 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital city of the department of Lambayeque. 

She has been selling beer in two capacities: as a retailer at a higher price, and as a wholesaler at a lower price.  She carries out her business from her house. 

Leidy wants to further expand her business with the purchase of more products to resell. She will obtain a greater income and she will be able to support her family. For this reason she has requested a loan of 1200 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase beer for resale.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 44 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Bekobougou, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce. de beurre de karité, de galettes et du bétail.                                            .                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire.                                                                        ALIMA D. compte acheter des paniers de noix de karité qu’elle transforme en beurre de karité, ces noix sont achetées avec les vieilles du village. Après transformation, elle effectue ses travaux au village, et après le produit fini est vendu au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the group Tiessiri are all married; on average, they are 44 years old, with six children each and live in traditional extended families in the village of Bekobougou, in the sub-prefecture of Fana, in the region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of the republic of Mali). They know each other through family ties, their neighborhoods and friendship. They sell shea butter, cakes and livestock. 

This will be the second group loan for the women of Tiessiri. ALIMA D. intends to buy baskets of shea nuts, which she will turn into shea butter;  she purchases these nuts from the elderly women of the village. After processing the nuts, Alima sell her product in town; the finished product will be sold for cash or credit to a customer base of men and women. She expects to earn a monthly profit of 20,000 CFA; she will use these earnings to pay for her loan, contribute to social ceremonies and she will invest the remainder of her earnings in her business.

loans.use: to purchase shea nuts

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es: El señor Fermín es chofer y socio propietario en el sindicato de autotransporte Eduardo Avaroa; su esposa trabaja en una tienda donde vende exclusivamente ropa de bebe. El crédito lo requiere para el arreglo de la caja de velocidades de su auto  para mayor seguridad suya y de los pasajeros, pues últimamente ha estado fallando. Vive en casa en alquiler ubicada en la zona Pasankeri  en la ciudad de La Paz,  es casado y tiene un hijo.
texts.en:
Fermín is a driver and an owner member of the Eduardo Avaroa transportation syndicate; his wife works in a store that sells infant wear exclusively.

He needs the loan to repair his car’s gearbox to have better security both for himself and for his passengers because it’s been failing recently.

He lives in a rented house located in La Paz’s Pasankeri zone.  He’s married and has a son.

loans.use: to repair his car's gearbox.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 56 years old.  She is married and has 7 children. Her younger children still go school.

Jocelyn is engaged in farming. She has been growing rice for 10 years. Jocelyn works hard to improve her business. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds. She hopes this loan will help grow her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 44 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a frozen foods vending and food production business in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy meat, spices, etc. for her food processing business.

Gina has been in this business for five years. In the future, Gina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy meat, spices etc. for meat processing business.

loans.name: Juana Pastora

texts.es:
La  señora Juana , tiene 46 años de edad, es originaria de Sutiava un barrio localizado en León , es madre de tres hijos, esta casada , ella se dedica a elaborar cajetas(dulces).Ella inicio con las ventas de una gallinas que tenia las vendía y con las ganancias obtenidas fue que comenzó elaborar cajetas, además que su mama se dedicaba a elaborar dulces fue de ella quien aprendió esta actividad así ha venido manteniendo a sus hijos, les ha pagado sus estudios, paga los gastos de la casa su esposos la ha apoyado desde el principio ella lleva 26 años en el negocio, ella misma los elabora y vende en las pulperías y mercados de la ciudad de León. 
Ella solicito el préstamo para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y ampliar su lugar de trabajo dándoles mejores condiciones. Con esta inversión podrá mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y mejorar sus ingresos. A ella le gustaría poder contratar a 2 vendedores, vender sus productos en ferias .Su próxima meta es terminar hacerle mejoras  a su cocina que es donde elabora su productos y terminar de preparar a sus hijos profesionalmente
texts.en:
Juana is 46 years old and she is originally form Sutiava, a community located in Leon. She is the mother of thee children and she is married. She makes fudge (sweets). She started out selling poultry and with the profits she obtained she started making fudge candy. Her mother used to make fudge candy and it was from her that she learned the business. And this is how she has been supporting her children and he has paid for their schooling. Her husband pays for the household expenses and he has supported her from the start. She has been in business for 26 years. She makes the product herself and she sells it to the grocery stores and markets in the city of Leon. 

She requests a loan to improve the infrastructure of her house and to expand her working space to provide them with improved conditions. With this investment she will be able to improve her working conditions and she will improve her earnings. She would like to hire 2 merchants to sell her products at the fairs. Her next goal is to finish making improvements to her kitchen, which is where she makes her products, and to help her children until they have earned their careers.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of her house and to expand the space were she works.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en: Therese is 48 years old, and she has 5 children who are ages 7 to 21 years old. Her husband is a driver. Therese owns a bar in which she sells different kinds of beer. She has been selling this beer for 8 years and it has enabled her meet her family needs and educate her children. She needs a loan to buy more beer and reinvest in her business. Therese plans to reinvest the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: buy beer to sell at her bar and reinvest in her business.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married, and has four children.

Hussein has had a food market since 2000, selling cheese, candies, juices, soft drinks, daily use items and diary products. He has experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is committed to his work and loyal to his clients. 

He is requesting a $3000 loan to buy a large generator and to add more inventory to his market. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a large generator and to add more inventory to his market.

loans.name: Janylbubu's Group

texts.en:
Janylbubu, 64, is a treasurer of this group. 

She has been a shepherd for the past 20 years. However, the burden of raising, milking and reselling cattle was laid on her own shoulders when she was widowed several years ago. 

Fortunately, her two grown sons do their best to help her with this hard labor. The initial capital for the business start-up was 8,000 KGS, which was borrowed from a bank by her brother. A monthly income of 4,600 KGS allows Janylbubu to invest some funds back into the business, as well as save some for personal use. 

At the present time she doesn’t have many head of cattle. She says three head are just enough for yielding milk and getting enough profits. 

The purpose of the loan is to purchase a dairy cow for selling milk products. The entrepreneur and her group are grateful to lenders for financial assistance. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca, 51 years old and married to Fidelis, is the mother of two independent children over the age of 18. The owner and operator of a posho mill business for the past six years, Francisca earns a monthly income of about KES 7,000 which she uses to help support both her business and her family.

Having requested her first loan for KES 20,000 by KADET Ltd., she intends to purchase stocks of maize wheat and millet for sale in the posho mill and plans to use the additional profits to improve her family’s living standard and become financially stable. In the future, Francisca hopes to open another posho mill to serve more people and earn more income

loans.use: to purchase stocks of maize, wheat and  millet  for sale.

loans.name: Kizota Group

texts.en:
Janeth, who is in her early 30's, is married. She has two children who go to school. She has been running a business of selling fabrics, shoes and hand bags, from door to door for 5 years now. She works from 8 a.m to 12 a.m (works for four hrs. only) daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Janeth's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her inventory from just the fabrics to start selling shoes and hand bags. She also paid school fees and household expenses. Janeth has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy more fabrics, bags and shoes to sell.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Kizota", which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics, bags and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Monica Maribel

texts.es:
La Sra. Mónica Maribel pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 38  años y tiene  01 niña de 05 años.
Mónica es de profesión Técnica en Enfermería y Computación, triunfadora y muy activa, laboró en Lima 7 años ejerciendo su carrera y por motivos de salud tuvo que renunciar y regresó a la ciudad de Tarapoto, desde entonces se dedica a la venta de cosméticos.  Obtuvo un préstamo inicial de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, actualmente viene ofreciendo productos de belleza de otras líneas así como prendas intimas de damas y caballeros, colonias cítricas, perfumes y accesorios de belleza, cuenta con una importante cartera de clientes que le permite obtener buenas ganancias.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles comprará productos de belleza para su stock como: perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, talcos para adultos y bebes, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas, prendas de vestir y otros productos a pedido de sus clientes.
Mónica es una  mujer muy alegre y emprendedora le pone muchas ganas a su negocio es por esta razón que su sueño es tener su propia boutique, está trabajando para ello.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por permitirle hacer posible su sueño.
texts.en:
Sra. Mónica Maribel is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Eucaliptos” (The Eucalypti) which is located in the District of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martín. She is 38 years old, single, and has a five-year-old daughter.

Mónica has a professional degree in nursing and computer science and was a successful and active woman. She worked in jobs related to her field for seven years in the city of Lima, but she had to quit for health reasons and returned to the city of Tarapoto. At that point, she decided to sell cosmetics. Mónica obtained her first loan from Manuela Ramos in the amount of 300 PEN. She currently offers beauty products from different brands as well as undergarments for women and men, citrus-scented colognes, perfumes, and beauty accessories. Mónica maintains a clientele of important customers, which helps her earn a good income.

With this new loan of 3000 PEN, she will buy beauty products to restock her inventory such as men’s and women’s perfumes, crèmes, press powders, talcum powders for adults and babies, lip pencils, nail polishes, clothing, and other products that her customers have ordered.

Mónica is a cheerful and enterprising woman who has plenty to gain from her business. For this reason, she dreams of opening a boutique and is working toward that goal. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for making her dream possible.

loans.use: to buy men’s and women’s perfumes, crèmes, press powders, talcum powders for adults and babies, lip pencils, nail polishes, clothing, and other products.

loans.name: Makhsudjon

texts.ru:
Махсуджон женат и любящий отец 6 детей. Он умный, добрый и целеустремленный человек. Более 12 лет он занимается скотоводством, а также занимается кормлением курицы и индюка, когда они вырастут, он продает их в хороших ценах. Так как у Махсуджона большая семья ему нужен хороший доход, чтобы обеспечить своих детей. С этой целью он хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать прибыль. Он хотел бы получить займ в размере 2000$ США для покупки скота и пополнение оборотного капитала. Махсуджон хочет заранее благодарит всех за помощь и поддержку.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Makhsudjon is married and is a loving father of six children.  He is a smart, kind and goal-oriented person.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for over twelve years and is also involved in raising chickens and turkeys, which he will sell at good prices once they are grown.  Because Makhsudjon has a large family, he needs a good income in order to provide for his children.  To achieve this goal, he wants to expand his business and maximize his profits.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2000 for the purchase of livestock and increase of turnover.  Makhsudjon wants to thank everyone in advance for the help and support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is 38 years old and blessed with one child who goes to school. She practices dairy farming to earn a living.  Apart from dairy farming, she supplies sand for more income generation. She has four years of experience in the business. Her desire is to grow her business and employ people. Miriam hopes to find a wider market where she can supply milk and sand. She needs a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to build rental houses.

loans.use: To build rental houses

loans.name: Seyyub

texts.en:
Seyyub, age 37, sells and trades in home products in the small settlement of Bilasuvar city. His monthly income from the business is $250 USD. He also keeps cows and sells dairy products to the local market. He and his wife have two children.

He has applied for a loan in the amount of 600 AZN in order to purchase one calf as well as items to stock in his shop.

loans.use: to purchase one calf as well as items to stock in his shop

loans.name: Foday

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Foday. He is married and has four children, aged 19, 16, 15 and 13 years. In 1986, Foday established his used-clothing business. He began his business after moving from Kono (where mining is the main economic activity) to Makeni (where petty trading is the main business activity). 

Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Foday has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy used clothing: T-shirts (two bales @ Le550,000), ladies blouses (two bales @ Le700,000), skirts (two bales @ Le650,000) and jeans jackets (one bale @ Le1,200,000). 

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Foday plans to open a big shop and an account for his old age. He is excited and hopes to finish his building and educate his children. Competition is keen but he usually buys good products that meet his customers' demands.   

He is assisted by his family members, and he serves 50 customers per day because of his quality stock.  He travels to Freetown to buy his business stock by public transport. He is hardworking and honest. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy used clothing: T-shirts (two bales @ Le550,000), ladies blouses (two bales @ Le700,000), skirts  (two bales @ Le650,000) and jeans jackets (one bale @ Le1,200,000).

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung is 50 years old and married. She has three children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh city. Her husband is a worker in a local factory.

Nhung works hard to provide for her family. She runs a food stall at her house to sell many kinds of food such as beef noodles and fried savoury rice flour cake for the people in her community.

Nhung would like to take a loan to buy new furniture and repair her stall. She is hoping that through the loan she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy furniture and repair her food stall

loans.name: Sylvester Khayeka

texts.en:
Sylvester is a 29 year old married man. He has 2 children, ages 1 and 5. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a motorcycle transport service business where he provides transport services to the local people. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor road networks. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to grow it and buy a fleet of motorcycles within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy a Nissan matatu (minibus) that will be operating along the Kakamega-Kisumu route.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is from the village of Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as  manure.

In 2010, Vilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as  manure

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 43 years old, married, and has five children.  She lives in GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is a company driver. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the piggery business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mary Ann sells live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP in sales every week.

Mary Ann is requesting a loan for 29,000 PHP to help her continue operations of her business She will use the loan to buy feeds and additional hogs. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Mary Ann hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and study the word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and additional hogs.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 32-year-old single man who owns a house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for himself and transport. 

Stephen has operated a vegetable stall for the past four years; his potential clients are the local area's residents. He faces the major challenge of the rising cost of commodities in the market. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages and onions for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access financial facilities to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages and onions for resale.

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik lives with her husband and two children.  She makes a living by raising cattle, but the money is barely enough to cover their expenses. 

Arevik would like to buy more cattle to raise.  This loan will help Arevik make additional income. 

From her profits, Arevik will be able to sustain her household, improve their standard of living and insure a better future for her children.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and barn renovation.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей женат. Вместе с женой они живут в селе Малая Александровка. Сергей занимается огородничеством. На арендованном участке земли в 2 га он выращивает ранние овощи: 70 000 кустов помидор, 70 000 кустов капусты,100 000 лука, 40 000 баклажанов, 100 000 свеклы, от 2 тонн картофеля. В сельском хозяйстве не первый год, занимается в этой сфере бизнеса уже 4 год. В хозяйство вложено около 50 000 гривен.  

Сергей планирует использовать кредит КИВА в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести семена, пленку, удобрения для нового сельскохозяйственного сезона и отремонтировать теплицы, обеспечив необходимые условия для выращивания качественного раннего урожая овощейы . 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Sergei is married.  He lives with his wife in the Malaya Alexandrovka village.  Sergei is involved in farming.  He leases a two-hectare plot of land and grows early vegetables, such as 70,000 tomato plants, 70,000 cabbage plants, 100,000 onions, 40,000 eggplants, 100,000 beats, and from two tons of potatoes.  This is not his first year in agriculture, as he has been in this field for the fourth year already.  He has about 50,000 hryvnia invested in his business.  Sergei plans to use the 15,000 hryvnia Kiva loan to purchase seeds, plastic, fertilizers for the new agricultural season, and to repair greenhouses; thus, providing the necessary conditions for growing a quality early vegetable harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, plastic, fertilizers for the new agricultural season, and to repair greenhouses

loans.name: Sahil

texts.en:
Sahil has two businesses to support his family. He owns six cattle and runs a taxi-driving service. He has been doing this for about nine years. The members of his family help with the agriculture business. He sells the milk, cheese, yogurt and butter in his village and at the bazaar. His plans for the future are to help each member of his family start their own business. 

Sahil is applying for a loan of 1000 Azerbaijani manats (AZN) to help his son to buy musical instruments, to help his eldest son to build a business, and to keep his own business in progress.

loans.use: to support his dairy business and buy musical instruments for his son.

loans.name: Amera

texts.en: Amera is a 48 year old single woman from Al Zarqa Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 to pay for her home improvements, she wants to buy a new furniture such as a guest room. She would like to create comfortable space for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Hoi

texts.en: Mrs. Hoi is a hardworking woman, 37 years old. There are six  people in her family. The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family living standard. Her family’s income is mainly from small business . With more than 10 years experience and has support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
SEYDOU N’TJI est le monsieur  qui tient  le mouton sur la photo. Il est  un  cultivateur Malien, non scolarisé, âgé de 42 ans, marié et père de 10 enfants.
SEYDOU N’TJI a une expérience de  20 ans dans  l’activité d’élevage de moutons et caprins. Il a l’amour de son  activité. Sa Femme fait le petit commerce et le maraichage. 
 SEDOU N’TJI est un bon  client qui respecte toujours engagements de remboursement. IL  s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants et revend ses animaux dans les mêmes marchés Le profit qu’il réalise lui permet de  subvenir aux  besoins de sa famille entre autre les frais de santé et les frais d’habillements. SEYDOU N’ TJI fait recourt  au  RMCR pour pouvoir accroitre son activité d’élevage de moutons.
SEYDOU N’TJI  rencontre souvent le problème de mévente. Dans l’avenir, Il  rêve d’avoir un prêt plus élevé  afin de devenir un grand éleveur exportateur.Avec le prêt précédent il as bien travaillé le bénéfice lui as permit d'économiser un peu d'argent qui pourra être utilisé pour de futur besoin de la famille.
texts.en:
Seydou N'tji is the man holding the sheep in the photo. A 42-year-old Malian farmer, he never attended school. He is married and the father of 12 children ranging in age from 2 to 19 years old. 

Seydou N'tji has 15 years of experience raising sheep and goats. He loves his work. His wife gardens and engages in small scale commerce. 

As a borrower, Seydou N'tji always meets his loan payback obligations. He procures and resells his livestock in the surrounding markets. His earnings allow him to provide for his family, which includes cover the cost of healthcare and clothing. Seydou N'Tji borrows with RMCR [a Kiva field partner] in order to grow his sheep husbandry business. 

Seydou N'tji has often encountered the problem of poor sales. His dream for the future is to receive a larger loan so that he can become a big livestock farmer and exporter. His previous loan was a success and he was able to save some of his earnings to use for his family's future needs.

loans.use: to raise sheep in order to sell them.

loans.name: Amivi

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Amivi was born in Tsévié in 1969; she is an illiterate woman that staggers under the weight of household needs. She is in charge of eight (08) children including a grandson. Her husband who has almost become a constant drunkard, never remains home and does not care about her anymore. This situation of acute poverty has very serious consequences on the education and future of the children. Despite her dynamism and her sense of business, Mrs. A. who is filled with initiatives, has no financial resource to increase her activities that she started with $50. Having shown her efficacy through two credits of $150 and $350 reimbursed without incident, Mrs. A. is a woman of trust respecting the belongings of others and deserves financial support to well develop her activities. She applied for a credit of $800 that will help purchase charcoal in the production zones.

Née à Tsévié en 1969, Madame A. Amivi est une femme analphabète qui croupit sous le poids des charges familiales. Elle a à sa charge huit (08) enfants dont un petit fils. Le mari, aujourd’hui devenu presque ivrogne, ne reste pratiquement plus à la maison et ne se soucie pas d’elle. Cette situation de pauvreté aiguë a des répercussions très graves sur l’éducation et l’avenir des enfants. Malgré son dynamisme et son sens d’affaires, Madame A., pleine d’initiatives, manque de fonds de crédit pour augmenter ses activités qu’elle avait débuté avec $50. Ayant fait ses preuves à travers deux crédits successifs de $150 et $350 obtenus et remboursés sans incident, Madame A. est une femme de confiance ayant le respect du bien d’autrui et mérite d’être soutenue financièrement pour bien développer ses activités. Elle sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $800 qui servira à aller acheter du charbon dans les zones de production.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and taxi motor

loans.name: Mursinah

texts.en:
Mursinah is a member of MBK who has requested a second loan of $100. She had been a farmer for sometime. The loan from MBK will partially be used to purchase fertilizer and seeds for her plantation and rice fields and the balance for weaving bamboo basket. She grows corn, cassava, and peanuts in her plantation. Her produce is contracted to wholesalers.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Farming - Petani

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo makes decorations and ornaments for popular social functions called "prestes" in Bolivia. He makes his items with fine cardboard, silky ribbons and bright paper. He doesn't have any employees, but his university-age sons help him with the decorating. He is a widower and all the responsibility to cover family expenses falls on his shoulders. He lives in the Alto San Pedro area of La Paz, which is also where he keeps his workshop. His work depends exclusively on orders from businesses in La Paz, and he has contracts by the dozen.

His file describes him as a client who fulfills his payment obligations on time. The loan he is currently requesting will be used to buy materials like cardboard, ribbon, bright-color paper and glue. His work and his credit history make him an excellent candidate for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Arturo elabora trabajos artesanales de cotillones, adornos y otros para acontecimientos sociales populares llamados prestes en Bolivia. Su trabajo lo realiza con cartulina, adornado con papel seda, y papel brilloso, no cuenta con empleados ya que sus hijos le ayudan en la elaboración, es viudo y el único que se encarga de los gastos familiares de sus dos hijos que están en edad universitaria Vive en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, y allí mismo se halla ubicado su taller. Su producción total la entrega para su comercialización a negocios exclusivos para este rubro en la ciudad de La Paz, ya que solo trabaja a pedido y tiene contratos por docena. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente con cumplimiento regular en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de materia prima (cartulina, papel brilloso, papel seda, y pegamentos). Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito.

loans.use: Buy cardboard, ribbon, bright paper, glue, etc.

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.es:
Yuliana is 18 years old and single. She is a craftswoman. During the mornings she studies and during the afternoons she makes blouses and cloth napkins. She adds handcrafted needlework and then sells them to the tourists who visit the area. Yuliana is a member of the loan group Dulce 1, along with Carolina M. Hernandez, who works in her house making candles to sell in the city. Both hope to use the loan to buy raw materials for their businesss and increase their production.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

YULIANA TIENE 18 AÑOS SOLTERA , ELLA ES ARTESANA EN LAS MAÑANA ESTUDIA Y EN LAS TARDES CONFECCIONA BLUSAS , SERVILLETAS DE MANTA Y LUEGO LAS BORDA Y LAS VENDE ENTRE LOS TURISTAS QUE VISITAN LA ZONA . PERTENECE AL GRUPO DULCE 1 JUNTO CON DOÑA CAROLINA M. HERNANDEZ QUIEN TRABAJA EN SU CASA ELABORANDO VELAS QUE POSTERIORMENTE VENDE EN LA CIUDAD . AMBAS ESPERAN CON EL PRESTAMO COMPRAR MATERIALES PARA SUS NEGOCIOS Y AUMENTAR SU PRODUCCION .

loans.use: Buy materials, so she can increase her production of handcrafted products

loans.name: Matânia Paulo

texts.pt:
Matania Paulo M. is 58 years old. She is a single mother and has 2 children. She lives on the 16th Kilometer in Boane. She is a fashion designer. She makes and sells clothes from her home. She is new to the program and she is pursuing a loan in the amount of 4.000 MT that will be paid back in 5 months. The loan will be used to purchase more material needs for her line of business, such as fabric, threads, buttons, ec.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Matânia Paulo M. tem 58 anos de idade,é mãe solteira de 2 filhos e vive no KM 16 em Boane. É modista , faz e vende roupa em sua casa. É nova no programa e pretende um empréstimo de 4.000 MT para pagar em 5 meses para aplicar na compra material para a sua actividade(tecidos, linhas, botões, etc.).

loans.use: Compra de Materia Prima

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret I., who sells timber wood, is 42 years old. She is married with 4 children, and lives in Benin City. She buys timber logs and sells to builders and furniture makers. She has been with LAPO for 3 years, and has 6 years of experience in business. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy more timber logs to sell.

loans.use: To buy more timber wood to sell.

loans.name: Aidé

texts.es:
Serving others is very important and is a very noble perspective, which is found in Aidé, who having received studies as a nurse, she observed that it was necessary in her town to open a little pharmacy with the goal of attending her community’s needs. Today after a year has passed since her decision, she feels satisfied by what she has achieved, and the good service that she offers her clients motivates her to continue. Despite everything, she still sees an economic deficiency many times within her family that prevents them from getting out of debt and into a state of plentitude. So additionally she came to lend her services in a little hospital; many times it is very hard to take on this double job, but although her husband also works, the income still tends to be insufficient. In spite of the tiring and immense effort that she makes, she is motivated to put a smile on her little children’s faces, and they motivate her to keep working to ensure a more promising future. For this reason she plans to hire someone to help tend customers in her pharmacy while she keeps dedicating herself to both of her jobs. Aidé requests a loan to invest in the purchase of greater merchandise and also to improve her store’s infrastructure. Support a hardworking and persistent woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

El servicio hacia los demás es muy importante y es una perspectiva muy noble en Aidé, quien habiendo tenido estudios de enfermería observó que era necesario en su localidad aperturar una pequeña farmacia con la finalidad de atender las necesidades de su localidad y hoy al cumplir un año de haber tomado esta decisión, se siente satisfecha por lo que ha logrado, la buena atención que otorga a sus clientes la animan a seguir progresando, pero a pesar de todo ve todavía las carencias económicas de su familia que muchas veces no le permiten desempeñarse a plenitud y de manera adicional viene dedicándose a prestar sus servicios en un pequeño hospital, muchas veces fue muy duro para ella asumir este doble rol y a pesar de que su esposo también trabaja los ingresos suelen ser insuficientes. A pesar del cansancio y del inmenso esfuerzo que realiza se motiva al obtener la sonrisa de sus dos pequeños hijos, quienes la animan a seguir trabajando para asegurarles un futuro prometedor. Por esta razón piensa contar con el apoyo de una persona que le ayude en la atención de su farmacia, mientras ella sigue esforzándose en su trabajo.Aidé solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de mayor mercadería y también para el mejoramiento de su infraestructura.Apoya a una mujer emprendedora y luchadora.

loans.use: Purchase a greater quantity of medicines and improve the infrastructure that houses her little pharmacy.

loans.name: Yoeum

texts.en: Mrs. Yoeum H., 26, is married with three under school-aged children and works selling variety of grocery products to the people in her area, making on average around $5 each day in revenue. Her husband is employed by a private company and typically makes $3 each day. Mrs. Yoeum H. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for her business’s transportation. This will enable her to purchase grocery products from a market further away. It will make her work faster, easier and will save her a lot of money.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for her business's transportation.

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.fr:
A seamstress by profession, Mrs. Sylvie A. is married to a photographer and has 2 children. After repeated failures in setting up a workshop, she repositioned herself within the trade by making and selling women’s clothes to store-keepers in central Africa. The profit margin on each sale is not insignificant and in fact is her motivation to pursue this on a larger scale. To satisfy her clientele, she has approached our institution in order to obtain a loan over a period of 12 months. She was born around 1978.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Couturière de profession, elle est mariée à un photographe et mère de 02 enfants.Après des échecs répétés dans l’installation d‘un atelier, elle s’est repositionnée dans ce métier en confectionnant et en vendant des vêtements pour femme aux commerçantes de l’Afrique centrale.La marge bénéficiaire tirée sur chaque opération n'est pas négligeable et constitue d’ailleurs sa motivation pour une activité à grande échelle.Pour satisfaire sa clientèle,elle a fait recours à notre institution afin d’obtenir un crédit d’une durée de 12 mois. Elle est née vers 1978.

loans.use: To buy 10 pieces of rich Bazin cloth and embroidery supplies

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi M., 58 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 1999. During 8 years of participation, she used her borrowed money on breeding the chickens and pigs. She always has around 10 pigs in the pigsty. Her big backyard is used for breeding chickens and ducks. She sells eggs from chickens and ducks to earn money to repay weekly. Besides, she also gets help from her 2 children who are working now. Her average income increases year by year. Now, her monthly income is 200-220 USD/month. This time she wants to borrow 950 USD to buy more pigs. She is living with her husband and her youngest children in Yen Tri, Y Yen, Nam Dinh.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị M., 58 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1999. Trong 8 năm tham gia, chị M. vay vốn sử dụng chủ yếu cho việc chăn nuôi lợn gà. Đàn lợn nhà chị M. luôn có trên dưới một chục con. Khoảng sân rộng sau nhà được chị M. tận dụng cho việc nuôi gà, vịt. Trứng gà, trứng vịt có thể bán lấy tiền trả tuần, bên cạnh đó là sự hỗ trợ của 2 con đã đi làm. Thu nhập tăng lên qua các năm, đến nay mỗi tháng bình quân gia đình chị M. thu khoảng 200-220USD. Vòng vốn này chị M. xin vay 950USD để mua lợn con về chăn nuôi. Chị M. hiện sống cùng chồng và người con út tại xã Yên Trị, ý Yên, Nam Định.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 36-year-old man who works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. He has 3 children. Ali is a car mechanic. This is the third time he has applied for a loan through Al Majmoua. He wants to buy material for his business. The increased income generated from the input of this loan will help him pay his children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy material for his auto repair business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 28 years old, married, and has two children (ages 2 and 9). Fatuma owns a small food store, which she started in 2003. Everyday she works from 6am to 9pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $290 from her sales.

She is requesting a loan to open a small cafe.

loans.use: to open a small cafe

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia B., 30, wife of M., 35, lives in Arifwala, Pakistan, where she owns a two-room brick house. She is a mother of four children. Her husband manufactures a cloth washing soap, an enterprise he has operated for the last five years. She is now seeking a loan for his soap business in order to expand his income and improve the financial condition of his house. Safia recently repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution of Pakistan.

Safia has been joined in her loan group by two other members: Abida Shaheen, who wants to expand her spare parts business, and Azra B., who wants to buy a donkey cart. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses and improve their financial conditions.

loans.name: Laneh Kuru Group

texts.en:
This group is called Laneh Kuru (Believe in God in Temne). Its members are Aminata B., the group leader, who sells clothes and shoes and Sallamatu K., who sells second-hand clothes. They want a loan of Le 2,000,000.00.

This group has experienced the benefit of getting a loan because through a previous loan from SMT their businesses have kept on growing. Having now repaid their last loan, they are asking for a new loan from Kiva to help them further expand their businesses.

Aminata is 49 years old. She was born in Lunsar, about 50 miles west of Makeni. She is currently residing in Makeni where she trades in clothes together with her five chilren. Her husband remains in Lunsar, where he farms together with his other wives.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes, and second-hand clothes to expand his business.

loans.name: Asia's Tujuane Group

texts.en:
Asia is 37 years old, married, and has 4 children, ages 18, 12, 8 and 6. She has been in the trading business since in 2006. She works from 6am to 7pm at her business everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Asia now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Sikudhan, Vaileth, Lenarda, Salome, and Nuru, who also own businesses.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla A. est âgé de 43 ans, marié et père vde 3 enfants. Il tient depuis plus de 6 ans, à Danyi, un village situé à environ 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise, un commerce. Il espère par ce crédit, approvisionner sa boutique afin de satisfaire aux exigences de la clientèle et aussi gagner plus pour la survie de sa famille
texts.en:
Komla A. is 43 years old, married, and the father of three. He has been in commerce for over six years in Danyi, a village located about 170 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. He hopes to use this loan to supply his shop in order to satisfy customer demands and also to earn more for the survival of his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, boxes of milk, sugar, and cooking oils

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene, de 42 años, es madre de dos hijos los cuales le inspiran  a seguir adelante, ella junto a su esposo Exaltación (chofer de cargas pesadas) quien la apoya en todo, y sobre todo en su negocio, son los encargados de brindar todo lo necesario a sus hijos, es por eso que se esfuerzan mucho en su trabajo. Ella tiene su negocio de venta de jugos en un puesto del mercado Bellavista, realiza esta actividad desde hace varios años atrás y le va muy bien hasta ahora.El motivo por el que solicita este préstamo es para mandar a construir un kiosco y con el tiempo espera que su negocio se convierta en un muy lugar conocido y de mucha concurrencia.
texts.en:
Irene is 42 years old and mother of two children, who inspire her to continue working to improve their lives. She and her husband, Exaltación (who is a driver of heavy shipments), who supports her in everything and especially her business, together are responsible for offering to their children everything that they need. It's for this reason they work so hard in their jobs. She has a business of selling juices from a stand at the market Bellavista. She has done this activity for several years and it has gone very well for her so far. The reason why she is requesting a loan is to contract the construction of a pavilion over her stand. With time she hopes that her business will become a well-known place with many returning customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a pavilion for her business of juice sales.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha se dedica a la crianza y ,posterior, venta de chanchos hace muchos años, cuenta con muchos años de experiencia aunque no le basten los ingresos para poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, tiene en total 7 hijos, de los cuales 1 ya se independizó y los demás viven con ella, de estos 6, 1 es reciclador ( ve como sea ayudar en casa) y los restantes 5 estudian, 4 en el colegio y la otra preparándose para la Universidad, por lo que la señora Martha se ve prácticamente obligada a realizar más que un doble esfuerzo al recurrir al lavado de ropa los fines de semana como otro medio de ingreso para su hogar. Lamentablemente, de los últimos 10 pequeños chanchos que adquirió, 9 se le escaparon al no contar con un corral debidamente ambientado para tal fin, lo que fue en detrimento de su ya, de por sí, precaria situación.

La señora Martha requiere de 600 soles en aras de poder cercar su corral de crianza de chanchos para prevenir que se escapen así como para la compra de éstos y su alimentación en vísperas navideñas, que es la temporada que más se vende chanchos durante el año.
texts.en:
Martha has been raising and selling pigs for many years, giving her that many years of experience, but her income is not enough to provide her children with the best in life. She has a total of 7 children, of whom 1 is independent and the others still live with her. Of the 6, one is a recycler (just so that he can help the household) and the other 5 are attending school. Four of them are going to school and the girl is getting ready to attend university. Martha feels she is obligated to put in twice the effort so she takes on work on weekends washing clothes, as another means of income for her household. Unfortunately of the last 10 pigs that she purchased, 9 of them escaped and got away because she doesn't have a proper enclosure for them. It is a detrimental and precarious situation.

Martha requires 600 soles so that she can build a proper enclosure for her pigs, to prevent future losses. She will purchase more pigs and feed to prepare for the holiday season, which is the time of year when she sells most.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pigs and feed.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with one son. She is a Technical school graduate and worked for a while as a design engineer, but was unable to earn a stable salary. Seeking another source of income, Ludmila decided to start her own small business. She rented a kiosk and began selling household chemicals. Recently, however, Ludmila decided to make a change in the type of products she offers and start selling knitted wear and caps. She believes this new area of trade will help her generate additional profit.   

Ludmila has been in business for 15 years and can easily guess the preferences of her clients which helps build customer loyalty. Her integrity and perseverance have helped Ludmila keep her business stable throughout all these years. Presently, Ludmila has around 10,000 Grivnas of working capital. Her monthly profit amounts to 2,500 Grivnas. Ludmila would like to get a loan for 6,000 Grivnas to buy more clothing products. She is planning to purchase knitted wear and warm caps that always sell well in Ukraine in winter. This loan will help Ludmila’s business continue to grow ensuring the well-being of her family and helping to provide an education for her son at a good college.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Zinaubu

texts.en: Sinabu   is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand the business.  Sinabu is 35 years old and is married with a husband that is a builder. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send the children to school. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: selling charcoal

loans.name: Bahati  A.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This 26-year-old Bahati K. from Tukuyu. She is single, and since 2005 has made a living running a clothes shop. She buys clothes wholesale and sell them retail to her customers.

She works at the business for nine hours a day, seven days a week, earning about $750 a month from her business. Bahati is requesting a loan of $775 to buy additional clothes for her business. In the future, her goal is to increase quantity and range of items she has to sell to her customers. Bahati thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of clothes for her business

loans.name: Zarbibi

texts.ru: Махмудова Зарбиби проживает в городе Турсун-Заде. Возраст 52 года. Замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Муж работает на стройке , подсобным рабочим.Сама она занимается бизнесом. торгует клиенкой . Опыт работы в данной сфере уже 4 года. Для того, чтобы обеспечить такую большую семью им с мужем приходиться много работать. Таким образом она развивает свой бизнес. И теперь она хочет получить кредит , который она использует на приобретение стройматериалов и оплату аренды. Стройматериалы использует для пристройки навеса. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zarbibi M., 52, is married and has 6 children. Zarbibi lives in Tursun-Zade. Her husband works as a helper at a construction site. Zarbibi has been selling plastic covers for 4 years. She applied for this loan to purchase building materials and to pay rent for her stall. Zarbibi will use the building materials to build a shed for her stall. She will repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase building materials and to pay rent for the place of business

loans.name: Adeleke

texts.en: Adeleke O. sells video CD's (VCD’S). He is 38 years old and married with 5 children. He is requesting a loan amount of N100000 to purchase more VCD’S to sell. He says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more VCD’S

loans.name: Baffour Kwasi

texts.en: Baffour Kwasi Tuffuor is 21 years old. He is single and loves work. He is in his final year of senior high school and he is writing his mock exams. He has been a general photographer for the past five years. He is reading general Arts in school and next month he will be taking his final exams. He owns a photography and video shop called ‘Cobby’s photo’ where his clients pose for their photographs. He also goes to occasions like parties and concerts to take photographs of his clients. He is requesting a loan to buy additional tools and materials like a camera, flash, video camera etc. to expand his operations. He belongs to a village bank called ‘Sunkwa’, which means ‘Pray for Life’. He hopes to receive GH¢800 to make his business progress.

loans.use: To buy additional tools and materials like a camera, flash, video camera, glass etc.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
El señor Héctor López vive con su esposa la señora Isabel  y su hija de mediana edad; el trabaja como mecánico de una Institución Medica desde hace 20 años.
Tienen una hija a la cual le están solicitando el pago de una colegiatura, pago que se realiza cada seis meses; motivo por el cual el señor Héctor al igual que su esposa  están solicitando este crédito ya que desean cubrir este pago y así seguirle proporcionando a su hija un mejor futuro mediante la educación.
texts.en:
Héctor López lives with his wife, Isabel, and their middle-aged daughter; he has been working as a mechanic at an Institución Medica for 20 years. They have a daughter for whom they are requesting school fees, which are payed every six months; this is why Héctor and his wife are requesting this loan, since they wish to cover this cost and continue providing their daughter with a better future by means of education.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying school fees for their daughter

loans.name: Kwaku

texts.en:
Kwaku A. is married with three children and has received no formal education. Kwaku produces and sells palm oil at Frami near Abura, which he has done for five years. He uses his income to help pay for his family’s bills and various expenses. Kwaku’s wife also works as a trader in the Abura area.

Kwaku will use the loan as additional capital to help meet the demands of his customers. He will purchase more palm fruits for the production of the palm oil. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kwaku plans to reinvest in the business for the expansion of his trade.

loans.use: To buy more palm fruits for the production of palm oil

loans.name: Muiddinhoja

texts.ru: Муиддинходжа парень, который торгует на рынке города Худжанда.Его ассортимент составляет мужская обувь.Он привозит товар с оптового рынка Истаравшана. Муиддинходжа в этот раз на один месяц решил снизить сумму займа в связи с достатком товара, а в следующий месяц планирует увеличить связи с поездкой за летним товаром.На снимке Шодмонов Муиддинхлджа на месте торговли.
texts.en:
Muiddinhoja is a young man who trades at the Khujand town market. He carries a range of men's shoes, which he brings in from the wholesale market in Istaravshan. This month Muiddinhoja decided to decrease the amount of the loan he takes out to buy inventory, and next month increase it to buy summer goods. Muiddinhoja is at his stall in the photograph.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shoe sales

loans.name: Prode Group

texts.es:
La Alcancía PROD. (Pro Desarrollo Económico) esta formada por 10 socias que en su mayoría vive en el AA HH San Martín en el Distrito D. LOS OLIVOS – LIMA – PERÚ, se encuentran en su cuarto ciclo y cada una D. sus integrantes son madres D. familias que se levantan muy temprano para dedicarse a sus negocios (venta D. pollo, productos D. belleza, entre otros) y luego  por la tarD. estar con sus hijos, el préstamo D. cada una D. ellas es para seguir invirtiendo en sus negocios.
La señora Q. C., Nelly D. 40 años, es la fundadora del grupo ( la señora D. verD. en la primera fila D. la foto); ella venD. pollo en el mercado Huandoy en Los Olivos, y junto a su hijo José Luis, quien venD. CDs por la mañana y maneja un mototaxi por las tardes, han decidido sacar adelante a la familia. Con su esfuerzo y sacrifico, ella desea terminar D. construir su casa para poder alquilar cuartos y hacer profesionales a cada uno D. sus hijos.
Por otro lado encontramos a la Tesorera del grupo, la señora R. S., Flor (la señora D. buzo azul D. la primera fila)  una joven madre D. dos pequeños D. 7 y 3 años  quien con el deseo D. obtener una casa propia  para sus hijos; ya que vive con sus suegros; sale todos los días por las mañanas a vender sus productos D. belleza, lencería, etc. 
Por ultimó y no menos importante esta la Secretaria del grupo la señora F. P., Esmeralda ( la señora D. rosado en la primera fila); ella se dedicaba en un principio a vender D. todo ambulatoriamente, pero con su gran esfuerzo a conseguido tener su propio puesto D. pollo en el mercado, al inicio fue difícil por que no sabía como picar el pollo pero ahora le encanta su trabajo, con el préstamo recibido por EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD sigue invirtiendo en el negocio para que en un futuro pueda comprar su terrenito y hacer profesional a sus tres pequeños.
texts.en:
The PROD. (Pro Economic Development) group consists of 10 members, the majority of whom live in San Martín, district of Los Olivos, Peru. The group is on its fourth loan cycle, and every one of the members is a mother who gets up very early to dedicate herself to her businesses (selling chicken, beauty products, among other items) and in the afternoon spends time with her children. Each member will use the loan to continue investing in her business.

The founder of the group, Nelly Q. C. (the woman in green in the first row of the photo), sells chicken in the Huandoy market in Los Olivos, and along with her son José Luis, who sells CDs in the mornings and drives a mototaxi in the afternoons, works hard to make headway for her family. With her hard work and sacrifice, Nelly wants to complete construction on her home so she can rent the rooms and make professionals out of all her children.

The treasurer of the group, Flor R. S. (the woman in the blue sweater in the first row), is a young mother of two small children, ages 7 and 3, who wants to have her own home, since she currently lives with her in-laws. She goes out every morning to sell beauty products, lingerie, etc.

Finally, but no less important, is the group's secretary, Esmeralda F. P. (the woman in pink in the first row). She used to sell all kinds of items outdoors, but with a lot of effort she was able to get her own post selling chicken in the market. At first it was difficult because she didn't know how to carve the chicken, but now she loves her job. With the loan from Kiva partner EDAPROSPO she will continue investing in her business so that in the future she'll be able to buy a small plot of land and make professionals out of her three small children.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow their businesses

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael S. is twenty-six years old. He is single and independent. Though Michael has no child, he caters for two of his younger siblings. He lives alone in a rented apartment in a town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital and is a commercial and farming town.

Michael is a trader. He trades in a shop selling all kinds of electrical goods such as radios, fans, television sets, etc. His shop is located at the roadside. Michael procures his goods from Kumasi. He has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy more goods to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy electrical goods to increase his stock

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina V. is from the village of Water Fall, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 36 years old. Gina is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a sari-sari or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc., in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Gina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Gina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and pay for tuition for her children. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Water Fall, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: San Antonio De Luricocha Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Antonio D. Luricocha inicia su primer ciclo con 15 socias, las socias son del distrito D. Luricocha que se ubica a 15 minutos D. la ciudad D. Huanta, las actividades principales D. la zona son la agricultura y ganadería, los productos principales son palta y tara.
 
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. joyas, golosinas, medicina natural, bebidas, comida, abarrotes en general y crianza D. animales.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 9,000 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, bebidas, golosinas, animales menores.

Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar sus negocios y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The San Antonio D. Luricocha Cooperative Bank is beginning their first cycle with fifteen members. The members are from the Luriocha District that is located 15 minutes from the city of Huanta. The main activities of this zone are agriculture and ranching. Avocados and peas are the main agricultural products. The members of the cooperative engage in different businesses. They sell jewelry, candy, natural medicine, drinks and general groceries. They also work in animal husbandry. The members need to borrow different amounts of money such as 300 soles, 400 soles, or 600 soles. The total amount of the loans requested from the Cooperative Bank is 9,000 soles. The loans will be used for the purchase of rice, sugar, drinks, candies and young animals. The members’ dream of expanding their businesses. They hope that their children will be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, drinks, candies and young animals.

loans.name: Ametauna Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo “Ametauna” están representadas por la señora Bleidy y conformada por 13 miembros dentro D. los cuales la mayoría son gente joven pero con muchas ganas D. trabajar como lo demuestran en sus puestos D. venta D. productos como empanadas, refrescos, cosméticos por catálogos, venta D. abarrotes, venta D. masetas, joyas y atención en café Internet. El nivel D. la competencia en  el rubro comercial es elevada pero ellas saben como salir adelante gracias a su dinamismo y ganas D. salir adelante. El crédito esta destinado para el crecimiento D. sus negocios comprando más mercadería, insumos y herramientas que ayuden generar una mayor utilidad que servirá para proporcionar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a experiencia los miembros del grupo gozan D. ella gracias a créditos anteriores en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital, pero el mejor antecedente que presentan es su juventud que se refleja en  su dinamismo y las ganas D. salir adelante.
texts.en:
The “Ametauna” Group are represented by Mrs. Bleidy and consists of 13 members, among whom the majority are young people with much desire to work. This is demonstrated by their vending booths, selling products such as meat pies, soft drinks, cosmetics from catalogs, groceries, jewelry, and by service in an internet cafe. Their level of competence in the area of commerce is high and they know how to get ahead, thanks to their dynamism and desire to advance themselves.

This loan is to expand their businesses, buying merchandise, supplies, and tools which will help generate greater profits and proviD. their families with a higher standard of living.

Concerning experience, the group members have earned it thanks to previous loans from entities similar to the Agrocapital Foundation. But the best antecedent they offer is their youth as reflected in their dynamism and their desire to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: OPERATING CAPITAL FOR SEVERAL SMALL BUSINESSES

loans.name: Utamurod

texts.ru: Юсупов Утамурод проживает в районе Яван. Возраст 47 лет. Женат, имеет  5 детей. Сын находится на военной службе. Сам Утамурод занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Оне также занимается животноводством, откармливанием и продажей скота. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Utamurod Y. lives in the Yavan region. He is 47 years old, married and has five children. His son is doing his military service. Utamurod is involved in offering taxi services. At the same time, he raises animals, tending and selling livestock. The loan request is to purchase more livestock.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Las Cumplidas Group

texts.es: Las Socias del Banco Comunal LAS CUMPLIDAS  son del mismo barrio, todas tienen negocios propios y saben como salir adelante, la representante del grupo es la señora Nancy y al igual que sus compañeras es una persona dinámica y muy trabajadora , ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa  u otro tipo D. mercadería en la feria D. Barrio lindo y por las noches venD. comida al paso el resto D. sus compañeras también se dedican a la venta D. productos como abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, juguetes, pan, zapatos y otros productos D. acuerdo a la época o a la moda. La competencia dentro D. su rubros es alta pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican.
