El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento D. sus negocios con la compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cumpliendo su tercer ciclo con la institución demostrando capacidad para administrar sus recursos y ganas D. trabajar para sacar adelante a sus familias.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank Las Cumplidas (The Dependables) come from the same neighbourhood; each one has their own business and they know how to get ahead. The representative of the group is Nancy; just like her colleagues she is a dynamic and very hard-working person. She sells clothes and other types of merchandise in the Barrio Lindo market and at night she sells fast food. The rest of her colleagues sell products such as groceries in the neighbourhood stores, toys, bread, shoes and other products according to the season or the fashion. Competition in their line of work is high, due to this they know how to keep their business going. This loan is intended to increase the growth of their businesses through the purchase of merchandise, raw materials and tools to improve their incomes which will allow them to give their families a better quality of life. In relation to their lending experience, the members are due to complete their third cycle with Kiva's field partner institution, demonstrating capacity to administer their resources and desire to work to keep their families going.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Karla Patricia S. se ha destacado por vender sandalias en el mercado El Bisne de la ciudad de Chinandega donde las oferta a sus clientes que a diario le visitan en su establecimiento para adquirir las sandalias.

Ella ha solicitado un crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de las sandalias porque a su alrededor tiene mucha competencia y por tal motivo debe de ir adelante en el negocio que requiere de constante inversión.

loans.use: Compra de las sandalias

loans.name: Ramathan's Group

texts.en: S. Ramathan is the leader of his lending group in Mukono. He is a friendly and hard working man who sells agricultural products at Mukono Central market. He also has a cosmetics shop that is managed by his wife, and together they strive to make a better living for their family. Ramathan has 10 children, all in school except one who is still a baby. He is grateful that the loans have helped him take care of his family using the profits and savings from the increased capital. He buys most of his produce from the villages around Mukono and sometimes the farmers bring the produce to his stall themselves. Ramathan needs a loan to help buy more produce for resale at his stall.

loans.use: To buy more produce for resale.

loans.name: Farhad Gardashali

texts.en: Farhad has been in the house repairing business for 7 years. He lives in the Fuzuli region. He is married and has 2 children. He currently needs a loan of 2,000 AZN, which he will use to purchase things that will improve his business.

loans.use: purchasing things that will improve his business

loans.name: Tursinoy

texts.en:
Ever since their marriage, Tursinoy and her husband have made a living buying and selling sheep. They do their work with lots of care because they enjoy it and because it allows them to meet their expenses and provide an education for their son. This hard-working mother buys her sheep in nearby towns, feeding and raising them until they are large enough to sell. Her dream is to give her beloved son security and an education. She has applied for a loan to make this dream possible by buying more sheep. She needs your help, and thanks you in advance for your kind support.      

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To expand a small flock of sheep

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie is a 33-year-old farmer from Surallah, South Cotabato. She enjoys working in her rice field to earn a living. She started farming in 2008. She has five children; the eldest is 14 years old. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to be able to obtain a loan. She requested 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy fertilizers and farm inputs. She is thankful that CEVI is offering a loan that has a low interest rate. This loan will be very helpful to sustain her business and family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and farm inputs

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Maria es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria A.” desde hace 1 año atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y tiene 6 hijos. Estudió primaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de maná.
Maria nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar maná y maíz.
Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su alimentación y trabajar mejor con su negocio.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Maria has been a member of the “Gregoria A.” cooperative bank for one year, in the Ilave district of the Collao province in Puno. She is 48 years old, married, and has 6 children. She completed her primary school education, and dedicates herself to the buying and selling of maná (marzipan-like candy dough). Maria tells us that with her first loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement of 500.00 Peruvian soles, she was able to increase her working capital. She will request a loan of 1,000.00 soles in order to buy maná and corn. Her dreams for the future include improving her food and her business. What she likes the most about working with her cooperative bank is being able to save money.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase mana and corn.

loans.name: Maricile

texts.en: Maricile Q., a resident of Pisaan, Bonifacio, is 26 and married to Arnel, a driver who is pictured with their daughter. The couple is blessed with three children, all of whom are still minors. Maricile knows that she needs to help her husband support the family. Upon hearing the good news about it, she joined Paglaum MPC. She wanted to access capital. As a new Paglaum member, she was given a 4,000 Philippine pesos loan to finance her business. She deeply hopes that someday she can give a better future to all her children and also hopes for her business to prosper.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari (general) store

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 47 years old and a single mother to two boys. She lives in Kawangware, a slum area where she has put up an open-air stall to sell second-hand clothes. She sells her clothes to small-scale retailers around the Kawangware area. This is a very highly populated area and, thus, she gets many customers to sustain her business.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend. She has never before borrowed from other sources. This will be her first loan with KADET. Salome plans to use her loan to add more clothes to her business inventory.

She also hopes that she will enlarge her business and distribute clothing to other small retailers.

loans.use: Salome wants to buy more bales of second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es:
Jhon, de 26 años, es un joven que desde muy pequeño luchó por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres, junto a su hermana Alva de 20, Carlos de 18, Yonatan de 15 y Paola de 13 años, y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro con tal de cumplir con su deber como hermano mayor.

A la edad de 16 años tuvo que afrontar solo el abandono de sus padres. Al ser el hermano mayor se vio obligado a dejar sus estudios secundarios y empezó a trabajar como “triciclero” (transporte de personas en triciclo), ya que era la única forma que tenía de llevarles un alimento a sus hermanos. 
Con el paso del tiempo logró juntar el dinero necesario para comprarse un motocarro, con el cual ha logrado sacar adelante a sus familia, pues con los ingresos que le genera esta actividad le puede pagar los estudios universitarios y secundarios a sus hermanos, quienes ven en él a un padre, motivo por el cual le tiene mucho cariño y respeto.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que le brinda en sus horarios, ya que tiene que estar al tanto de que sus hermanos tengan todo lo que necesitan, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer hasta altas horas de la noche trabajando, ya que tiene que llevar la mayor cantidad de dinero a su casa. 
Con el tiempo, espera tener un negocio más estable, tal vez un bodega, pero todavía no se decide, ya que sabe que más adelante sus gastos serán más fuertes.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Jhon con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesto a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es muy responsable, ya que no quiere quedar mal ante el resto de sus compañeros. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados hará arreglar las llantas de su motocarro, ya que con el paso del tiempo se han ido desgastando.
texts.en:
Jhon is 26 years old. From an early age, this young man has fought to provide the best for his family. He lives in the house he inherited from his parents with his siblings: Alba (age 20), Carlos (age 18), Yonatan (age 15), and Paola (age 13). He is willing to work very hard in order to fulfill his duties as the oldest brother.

At the age of 16, Jhon had to confront by himself the abandonment by his parents. Being the oldest brother, he was forced to leave high school and begin working as a tricycle driver. This was the only way he knew to be able to feed his siblings.

Over time, he managed to put together enough money to buy a motorcycle taxi, which enabled his family to get ahead. With the income he generated from this business activity, Jhon was able to pay for the college and high school expenses of his siblings. He looks after them like a father, which is why he gains much admiration and respect.

What he enjoys most about his job is the freedom his schedule provides since he has to be aware that his siblings have everything they need. Jhon has been in business for eight years and believes the hardest part of his job is having to work late at night. During that time, he usually has a large amount of money that he has to take home. With time he hopes to open a more stable business, such as a grocery store. He is still undecided, knowing that later there will be larger expenses.

This is Jhon’s second loan with MFP. He knows that he must make his payments on time and is willing to do so. He is very responsible in his Communal Bank and does not want to lose face with the other members. With his loan of 700 soles, he will purchase tires for his motorcycle taxi because they wear out over time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase tires for his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Diouma

texts.en: Diouma M. is a 70-year-old woman from the village of Maka near Diourbel in Senegal. She is married and takes care of a child. In the eight years that she has been a member of the Village Bank "Mbarry Gouytane," she has been able to pay back her loans on time. Diouma has  long experience in raising cattle and is requesting a loan to buy more cattle.

loans.use: To buy more cattle

loans.name: Namadi

texts.en:
Namadi J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer to sell at home.  Namadi is 47 years old and is married with a husband who is a teacer. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy crates of beer to sell at home.

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en:
Loveth is a native of Edo State, Nigeria. She is into the business of tailoring and sells sarongs. She has been in this business for 17 years. She sews lovely Nigerian and western styles for her customers. She hopes to own a world class tailoring stall in the future. She has been able to care for her family with the proceeds of her business. She is blessed with children. She is 36 years old.

Loveth needs a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cassava

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en: Sourn S., age 30, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She sells second-hand clothes, earning an income of about USD 6 per day. Her husband produces wooden furniture, earning an income of USD 13 per day to help cover the family expenses.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more equipment to produce wooden furniture.  In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the education of her children.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy equipment to produce wooden furniture.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en la ciudad de Ferreñafe, conocida a nivel nacional por sus comidas típicas, se encuentra ubicada a veinticinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de 10 años a la reparación de motores de artefactos menores y también a la venta de respuestos como un complemento a su trabajo, el se inició en sus labores ayudando en un pequeño taller donde aprendió de su oficio y poco a poco, conforme fue adquiriendo experiencia, se independizó y decidió formar su propia empresa, actualmente ya tiene un grupo de clientes fieles los cuales siempre lo recomiendan con algun conocido, por lo que su negocio goza siempre de muy buena acogida.

José Luis desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas respuestos, de modo que pueda tener un stock permanente de las piezas que necesita para realizar mejor su labor, por este motivo el se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en el logro de su meta trazada.

José Luis es un hombre honrado y con muchas ganas de superarse, el desea seguir implementando su taller conforme su clientela crezca para asi poder percibir mas ganancias y salir adelante. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran alguien responsable y que siempre esta dispuesto a ayudar a los que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
José Luis is 36 years old and lives with his family in the city of Ferreñafe, which is known at the national level for its traditional foods. The city is located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 10 years he has worked repairing motors of small appliances, and he also sells spare parts as a complement to his work. He started out helping in a small workshop where he learned the trade; gradually he acquired experience and started to work independently and decided to start his own business. Currently he has a group of loyal customers who always recommend him to others, and so his business is well received by the public. José Luis wants to expand his business with the purchase of more spare parts, so that he can have a standing inventory of the parts that he needs to do his work. For this reason he has seen the need to request for the first time a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa that he will invest to achieve this objective. José Luis is an honest man with a strong desire to succeed. He wants to continue equipping his workshop as his customer base grows, so that he can increase his earnings and get ahead. In the neighborhood where he lives his neighbors and acquaintances consider him to be someone who is responsible and is always ready to help others in need.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy small parts to improve his business repairing small motors

loans.name: María Arlinda

texts.es:
María Arlinda L. O. de 27 años desde el 2000 inicio con cien dolares su negocio de venta de ropa y calzado el cual por medio del trabajo arduo y los préstamos se ha desarrollado.En la actualidad además de invertir en estos rubros tambien distribuye electrodomesticos. 

Ella asegura que adim le apoyado mucho tanto economicamente como en su crecimiento personal al participar del proceso de capacitación en el que sea visto motivada y le enseñan como incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
María Arlinda L. O. is 27 years old. In 2000 she took 100 dollars and started her business of selling clothes and shoes. Through hard work and loans it has developed. At present, in addition to investing in these things, she also distributes appliances. She maintains that ADIM has supported her financially and in her personal growth. Participating in the training has motivated her and taught her how to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For merchandise such as clothing, shoes and appliances.

loans.name: Midori

texts.es: Midori, de 41 años, vive con su esposo y  sus 3 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 1 año atiende en su negocio de venta de abarrotes ubicado en su casa. Se dio cuenta que en el lugar por donde vive no había muchas tiendas que abastezcan de comestibles a los vecinos, así empezó con el negocio. Y durante los fines de semana se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno y también  los vende sacrificados, cuya carne la comercializa  en su tienda. En la actualidad  ha percibido los frutos  beneficiosos en sus rentas por lo que  esta pensando en  incrementar  su capital de trabajo con mayor cantidad de  mercadería.Es la 16ava vez  que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete que será  muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, además agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo, pues le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Midori tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en comestibles que le permitirá  abastecer  su tienda.
texts.en:
Midori, is 41 and lives with her husband and 3 children in their own home. A year ago she started a business selling groceries from her home. She realized that there weren't many stores in the area selling groceries to the neighbors, so she started the business. On weekends she also spends time buying and selling cattle, including butchered meat which she sells in her store. So far she has been profitable and is considering increasing her operating capital with more inventory. This is the 16th loan she has had through MFP and promises to be very responsible with her payments. Additionally she is thankful to everyone who made the loan possible as it will be quite useful in growing her business. Midori plans to invest the money requested in more food inventory to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase edible goods for sale in her store

loans.name: Oké

texts.fr: A. Oké est née en 1940 et vit depuis vingt cinq ans environs au quartier Abokicodji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Oké est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et majeurs. Aucun de ses enfants n'est donc plus à sa charge. Oké est une veuve qui vit seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Il y a près de dix ans que Oké mène comme activité la vente de fagots de bois à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Oké vend de l'essence au bord de la voie, à la devanture de sa maison. Oké s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du Bénin. Oké a déjà obtenu deux prêts de ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Oké désire une évolution de son activité. C'est pour cette raison que Oké sollicite un troisième crédit, en vue d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en:
Oké A. was born in 1940 and has lived for about 25 years in the Abokicodji neighborhood of Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. She is the mother of four grown children, all of whom went to school and none of whom are now dependent on her. She is a widow who lives alone and supports herself. For about ten years she has sold firewood from her home, and as a side business she also sells gasoline by the roadside in front of her house. She gets her supplies in upcountry Benin. She has had two previous loans from ALIDé, both repaid in full. She wants to grow her business, and for that reason is seeking a third loan so as to increase her stock in trade and increase her turnover.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood

loans.name: Gbadechiré Emilienne

texts.fr: K. Gbadechiré Emilienne est née le 19 Septembre 1979 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à DADA Jean, un soudeur, Emilienne est mère de deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. Seulement un enfant est à sa charge. Depuis environs sept ans, Emilienne réside à Ekpè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, avec sa famille. Le couple se partage les diverses charges familiales. Emilienne n’a pas fréquenté l’école, mais a appris la coiffure. Emilienne exerce cette activité depuis onze ans et vend également des mèches et des produits pour cheveux dans son atelier. Emilienne désire augmenter le stock de ses produits et équiper son salon de coiffure, de produits divers et variés afin d’attirer plus la clientèle. Eu égard à cela, Emilienne sollicite pour la première fois un prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Gbadechiré Emilienne was born on 19 September 1979 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Jean Dada, a welder, Emilienne is the mother of two children, of whom one has received schooling. Only one child is in her care. For about seven years, Emilienne has lived in Ekpè, in the commune of Sèmè-Podji, with her family. The couple share the various family expenses. Emilienne did not go to school but learned hairstyling. She has been carrying out this profession for eleven years and also sells hair extensions and hair care products in her workshop. Emilienne wishes to increase her stock of products and equip her hair salon with different and varied products so as to attract more customers. For this reason, Emilienne is asking for a loan from ALIDé for the first time.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase hair extensions and hair styling products.

loans.name: Cenelia Del Carmen

texts.es: Cenelia del Carmen tiene la edad de 36 años. Es madre soltera. Tiene 5 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Es así que se genera los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su hija, Siempre disfruta de su trabajo porque le gusta cocinar, además que le ayuda cubrir los gastos educativos de sus hijos. Afirma que este negocio es rentable y siempre está dispuesta a continuar trabajando, en adelante desea tener un restaurante grande. Este es su préstamo numero 7 y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, agradece a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de sus ricas tortillas.
texts.en:
Cenelia del Carmen is 36 years old. She is a single mother. She has 5 children in her care. Her economic activity is selling and making tortillas. This is how she generates the necessary income to support her daughter. She always enjoys her work because she likes to cook, and also because it helps her to cover her children's education expenses. She reports that this business is profitable and she is always ready to keep working. In the future, she would like to have a big restaurant. This is her 7th loan and she is very pleased to know that she has financial support. She has always shown herself to be responsible with her repayments, and she is grateful to the people who will be managing her loan, as it will be very useful for the development of her business. With the requested loan, she will invest in the purchase of ingredients for making her delicious tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for tortillas

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina A., age 46, is a vegetable vendor in the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. Lina is just starting this business and plans to expand it over time in order to gain more income. She is married and has three school-aged children.  

Lina joined ASKI earlier this year to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Lina is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional vegetable products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetable products to sell

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El señor Miguel Ángel tiene un negocio que es la venta de huevos en su casa de habitación. Es padre de un niño de un año y junto a su esposa se encuentran luchando para salir adelante con este negocio. El realiza la compra de sus productos a diferentes repartidores de huevos de contado, además si solicita alguna pulpería del producto que el ofrece, se encarga de llevarlo en su moto, sus ventas son de contado y al crédito. El señor está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel has a home-based egg selling business. He has one son and he and his wife struggle together to get ahead with this business. He buys his products for cash from different egg distributors. He also delivers them, on his motorcycle, to stores that request them. He sells for cash and credit. He is asking for a new loan so that he can invest in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth B. is a 40-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a general store and a food-vending business. She lives in Brgy. 2, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and food-vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 7,500 PHP.
Lilibeth is now borrowing 24,000 PHP so that she could purchase more stock to sell. This will be her eighth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 24,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Lilibeth aspires to improve her family's living conditions and ensure its future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Zeban's Group

texts.en:
Zeban belongs to a mid-sized city called Vehari, which is located in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She owns a three room brick house there and lives in it with her family. 

She is married to M. A. who works in the field and sows wheat and rice etc. He owns a small piece of land and sells his finished products to different markets. 

Zeban is a very talented lady. She embroiders dresses and earns a good income. She has a good knowledge of this art and produces quality work that helps her receive regular orders every month. Her income allows her to manage the family's finances with her husband.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount her husband will buy seeds, fertilizer, and other supplies to increase the productivity of his crops. Zeban is hopeful that her husband will put forth all the effort necessary to gain a positive result from his business.

loans.use: buying seeds & fertilizer for sowing wheat & rice

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique was born in 1982. She is single and takes care of one child who is 3 years old.  Angelique has owned a small shop where she sells different goods as her picture indicates.  Among these goods, it includes juice, cosmetic goods, cooking oil etc.  Angelique has been in this business for about eight years and her shop is open from 7 am until late in the evening. 

Although Angelique has been in this business for such a long time, her capital is too low to expand meaningfully.  To end this, she needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  If given this loan, she will purchase a variety of foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, Irish potatoes, beans, etc.  With these additional goods for sale, as they are highly demanded by a large number of customers, Angelique hopes to help her husband building their own house and continue building a secure future for their families.

loans.use: a variety of foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, Irish potatoes, beans, etc

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Juan Antonio F., inicio su negocio en el mercado la estación con venta de mercadería en general y con capital de C$3,000.00 productos de sus ahorros, actualmente su negocio es de distribuidor de gaseosas,  jugos y aguas purificada y se encuentra establecido costado sur de la terminal de buses, iniciando sus labores desde las 6 am. Y finalizando hasta 6 pm. 

El señor F. se siente muy agradecido con CEPRODEL porque  con los préstamos que le ha otorgado ha logrado a incrementar su inventario
texts.en:
Juan Antonio F. began his business at the La Estación market selling general merchandise and with 3,000 Nicaraguan Cordobas (NIO) of his savings. His current business is distributing sodas, juices and purified water and he works from 6am to 6pm at the southern side of the bus terminal.

Mr. F. feels grateful for CEPRODEL because he has been able to increase his inventory with the loans that they have provided to him.

loans.use: To buy sodas, juices, and purified water

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is married with one son. She and her family live in Melitopol. Marina runs a small business selling warm, colorful blankets. Presently, Marina has about 50,000 Grivnas in inventory; her net profit is about 5,000 Grivnas each month. 

Marina has been in this trade for twelve years. During this time, Marina’s business has proven to be competitive. Marina has been successful because of her hard work and persistence. Recently Marina helped her son to start a similar business.  

Marina would like to receive a loan of 15,000 Grivnas to increase her assortment of merchandise so that she can provide more items and better service to her customers.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Jairo Manuel

texts.es:
Jairo Manuel está solicitando su segundo credikiva, esta entusiasmado porque su negocio Abner A.C. Manufacturas Cuero y Textil”, donde se dedica al diseño, elaboración y comercialización de manufacturas en cuero y textiles tales como finos calzados para dama y caballeros, gorras y elegantes botas, se ha fortalecido con ese capital en efectivo del anterior credikiva; ahora tiene nuevos proveedores y se incrementaron sus ventas; su sueño se encamina a mejorar su infraestructura con una mejor maquinaria e idearse un punto de venta, para incrementar la rotacion de sus productos y continuar mejorando la productividad. El se siente sinceramente agradecido por el apoyo que ha recibido de sus financiadores a través de Kiva y con los funcionarios de la Fundación por su oportunidad en el servicio y su amabilidad en la atención. Con su nuevo credito invertirá materias primas en un 20% y con el resto comprará una maquina guarnecedora y un horno alogeno para mejorar el ensamble. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Jairo, ingrese al siguiente enlace:

http://kiva.org/lend/181179
texts.en:
Jairo Manuel is requesting his second loan through Kiva. He is enthusiastic because his business, Abner A.C. Textile and Leather Manufacturers, has greatly grown from his first Kiva loan. He designs, produces, and sells leather and textile products such as footwear for women and men, hats, and elegant boots. He now has new suppliers and his sales have increased. His dream is to improve his infrastructure with better machinery and devise a selling period, to increase the rotation of his products and continue improving the quality.  He is sincerely grateful for the help he has received from his financial bankers through Kiva and the employees of the Foundation for the opportunity to serve and their attentive friendliness. He will use 20% of his loan to buy essential materials and the rest will be used to buy a halogen oven to improve the assembly process. If you would like to know Jairo's story, click on the following link:


http://kiva.org/lend/181179

loans.use: He will use 20% of the loan to buy essential materials and the rest will be used to buy a halogen oven to improve the assembly process.

loans.name: Villasoria

texts.es: Villasoria, D. 55 años, es una madre D. familia entregada a su trabajo y sobre todo muy  noble, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Después D. vender productos nutricionales por muchos años, ha decidido vender jugos a pedido D. sus clientes.  DesD. entonces prepara estratos D. frutas y jugos, negocio que le ha resultado  mucho más dinámico y rentable. Es por ello, que todos los días, acuD. al  mercado muy temprano por la mañana con la finalidad D. abastecerse D. frutas y verduras frescas, es así que lleva 2 años realizando esta labor y lo que considera es que le gusta mucho la interrelación con sus clientes ya que la mantiene entretenida, además D. las ganancias que percibe le hace sentir muy independiente. En adelante, anhela instalar una fuente D. soda acondicionando la parte exterior D. su casa. Es su 2do crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, para no perjudicar a las integrantes D. su banco comunal, al que le tiene mucho aprecio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará otra extractora D. mayor capacidad, para mejorar su atención hacia sus clientes.
texts.en:
Villasoria, age 55, is a mother who is devoted to her work.  Above all, she is very honest.  She lives in her own house with her husband and their two children.

After selling nutritional products for many years, she has decided to sell juices by order from her customers.  Since she maD. this decision, she prepares fruit extracts and juices.  The business has turned out to be much more dynamic and profitable for her.  Every day she goes to the market very early in the morning to stock up on fruits and fresh vegetables.

She has been doing this work for two years.  She really likes the interaction with her customers because it keeps her entertained.  Also, the earnings that she gets make her feel very independent.  Later on she is eager to set up a soda fountain outsiD. of her house.

This is her second loan with MFP.  She pledges to make her payments punctually so that she does not disappoint the members of her communal bank, whom she holds in high regard.  She will use the loan to buy another juice extractor with a bigger capacity in order to improve her customer service.

loans.use: To buy a juice extractor

loans.name: Gotita De Amor Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Gotita de Amor y se ubica en el Estado de Morelos en México. Su comunidad se distingue por su fiesta celebre que es el 30 de agosto donde llega gente de diferentes lugares a celebrar juntos al santo patrón del pueblo Santa Rosa de Lima. El grupo está conformado por once integrantes.La señora Ana Isabel es integrante del grupo, se dedica a la costura negocio que inicio hace quince años con una máquina prestada con el fin de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de sus hijos. Solicita el préstamo para comprar  una máquina de coser eléctrica. Tiene 39 años de edad, estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria. Es casada y tiene un total de cuatro hijos de: 22, 19,17 y 2 años de edad respectivamente. Sus clientes le llevan ropa a arreglar, maestros de primaria le mandan hacer pedidos  porque les gusta la manera de como los atiende y el trabajo que les realiza. La  señora Ana Isabel se siente contenta porque con este préstamo podrá comprar su maquina de coser eléctrica y poder sacar sus pedidos que ya tiene para esta temporada de invierno. Con los siguientes prestamos quiere comprar otra máquina de coser, sus planes son tener un taller de costura, y contratar gente de su misma comunidad que trabaje con ella para darles empleo y poder ayudarlas, con sus ganancias desea comprarse un terreno para sus hijos y dejarles un patrimonio a futuro.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Gotita de Amor' (Droplet of Love) and is located in the State of Morelos in Mexico.  Their community is known for the famous fiesta which takes place on August 30th, when people come from all over to celebrate the Patron Saint of the town of Santa Rosa de Lima. 

This group has 11 members.  Ana Isabel is a member of the group.  Her business is sewing.  She started her business fifteen years ago with a borrowed sewing machine as she wanted to help her husband with their children's expenses.  She is requesting this loan to buy an electric sewing machine.

Ana Isabel is 39 years old.  She studied up to the third year of her secondary education.  She is married and has four children aged: 22, 19, 17 and 2.  Her customers bring clothes to her to mend.  Elementary school teachers send her orders because they like her service and the work she does.  She feels happy because this loan will allow her to buy her electric sewing machine and fill the orders that she already has for this winter season.

Ana Isabel would like to use subsequent loans to buy another sewing machine.  Her plans are to own her own sewing workshop and to hire people from her own community to work with her so that she can give them work and help them.  She would like to use her profits to buy a plot of land for her children that she can leave them as an inheritance in the future.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba B. is 60 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. 

For 20 years she has had a business baking and selling the national bread “lepeshka”. It has now become the family business, as the children of Mahbuba are grown and they are helping their mother. 

Mahbuba is a cheerful, hard-worker despite the difficulties she faces. She has received and repaid 12 loans from IMON, which have helped create stability for her business. Today, Mahbuba is requesting for a loan of 7500 TJS. She is planning to purchase the flour and coal required for baking the national bread “lepeshka”. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales and earn more so she can provide her children with a good education.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase the flour and coal required for baking the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Priscila Nohemi

texts.es: Priscila tiene 39 años de edad es casada, tiene  2 hijas y tres hijos, ella esta solicitando su primer crédito en Asociación ASDIR  ya que se dedica a la venta de telas ella se caracteriza por ser una madre luchadora  ya que lleva 10 años de tener este negocio y desea esta ayuda para poder brindarle a sus hijos una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Priscila is 39 years old and married.  She has two daughters and three sons.

She is requesting her first loan with the Asociación ASDIR.  She sells fabric.  She is known for being a tenacious mother.  She has had this business for ten years.

She wishes to have this assistance in order to be able to give her children improved financial stability.

loans.use: To buy materials for sewing

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José es un señor de 54 años de edad, dedicado a la carpintería, vive con su hija en Usulután, departamento de Usulután, don José posee un taller desde hace 10 años, y tiene también una pequeña tienda que comenzó hace un año.
Él solicita un préstamo para comprar madera para el taller y para mercadería de la tienda, esta inversión contribuirá a que él mejore sus servicios de carpintería, realizando todos los trabajos también con la tienda estará más estable teniendo al alcance todos lo que el cliente le solicite. 
Su aspiración es generar del negocio mayores ganancias con las cuales pueda cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, salud y otros gastos generales.
texts.en:
José is a 54 year old gentleman who works as a carpenter. He lives with his daughter in Usulután in the Department of Usulután. Don José has managed a workshop for ten years and also has a store that he opened a year ago.

He is requesting a loan to buy wood for his workshop and merchandise for his store. This investment will help him improve his carpentry services, complete all of his jobs, and also keep his store stable by offering everything his customers request.

His aspiration for his business is to generate more revenue so that he can pay for food, health care, and other general expenses.

loans.use: Purchase  wood for his carpentry workshop and merchandise for his store

loans.name: 'put Together Women' Group

texts.en:
Famatta G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers, called 'Put Together Women'. She is 36 years old, divorced, and has two children who are between the ages of 16 and 9 years. She also cares for two siblings.  She was not able to attend school due to a lack of financial support. She describes herself as a friendly woman.

For 10 years, she has been selling soft drinks, cold water and juice in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more crates of soft drinks, containers of water, and juice. Her dreams are to grow her business and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soft drinks, containers of water, and juice

loans.name: La Caridad 4 Group

texts.en:
Roseline is one of the group members from La Caridad 4 (The Charity). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner. She says that her most difficult challenges are to work hard and have an improved business in her village, where she enjoys attending to the Church.

Roseline is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business where she sells miscellaneous products. She will buy clothes and accessories. She will use the profits to invest in her business. She is planning to have a stable life. In the meantime, she plans to continue to enjoy being at her home and taking care of everything. She is excited to have this loan because she wants to invest more, get a low interest and save money for the future.

Roseline's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities are a free trading zone, a cement factory, and others. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and unreliable electricity.

loans.use: to buy clothes and accessories

loans.name: Zumradkhon

texts.en:
Zumradkhon is married and a loving mother of two children. Her husband works in Russia. She sells fabric and women’s clothing at the market. Zumradkhon started her business by helping her mother and now has her own outlet and stable customers. Over the past five years of running her own business, she has gained a lot of experience. Zumradkhon would like a loan of 7000 Somoni to purchase new fabric and clothing, which will help her expand her business.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase new fabric and clothing

loans.name: Maria Gertrudis

texts.es:
Maria Gertrudis desde la linda Bogotà, ciudad capital de Colombia , nos dice que  le fue muy bien con su anterior credikiva, porque respondió a todos los encargos que sus clientes habian anotado en su guia especializada de productos; asi mismo adquirió articulos en promocion con las que pudo ofrecer mejores precios a sus compradores y aumentò la rotaciòn de su mercancia.  En la actualidad está estudiando belleza integral y esto es una gran novedad, porque adicionará un ingreso mas,  una vez aprenda y promueva el servicio a domicilio de manicure, pedicure y asesorará a sus clientes respecto a productos que para su imagen requieren y que ella misma puede venderles. Su mensaje a los financiadores es el siguiente: “Gracias por la oportunidad que me han brindado, por creer en mi y por tener ingresos adicionales para mi familia.” Ahora está aplicando a su segundo credikiva y necesita hacer adecuaciones locativas para su propósito de diversificarse, por eso ha recurrido a este financiamiento.
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Maria igrese al siguiente enlace:
 http://kiva.org/lend/204888
texts.en:
Maria Gertrudis is from the beautiful city of Bogotà, the capital of Colombia.  She says that she did very well with her previous Kiva loan because she was able to fulfill all of the orders her customers placed with her through specialty catalogs.  In addition, she purchased sale items so that she could offer them at better prices to her customers and increase her product rotation.  

Maria is currently studying cosmetology.  This is a big step for her because she will be able to earn more income.  Once she learns how to administer manicures and pedicures and begins providing these services from her home, she will be able to advise her customers as to what beauty products they require and then be able to sell them.  

Maria has the following message to the Kiva lenders: “Thank you for the opportunity you have given me and for believing in me.  As a result, I have extra income for my family.”  Now she is applying for her second Kiva loan and needs to make a few adjustments to her purchases so that she can diversify.  It is for this reason that she has returned to secure financing.  To learn more about Maria’s story, please click on the following link:  http://kiva.org/lend/204888

loans.use: To purchase a variety of merchandise to diversify her inventory.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Prak K. is 48 year-old widow who earns a living by planting rice crops on her own farmland annually. From her crop business, she can make around $2.50 a day to provide for the family’s needs. Currently, she lives with her elderly mother and her daughter, who works as a garment factory worker and has a specific salary every month. 

Prak K. really wants to have a house that she owns, but she doesn’t have sufficient money to buy one. So now, Prak K. would like to request her loan to add with her current savings in order to buy a small wooden house with zinc roofing.

loans.use: to buy a small wooden house with zinc roofing

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a widow with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rhoda is 37 years old and both her children are in school.

Rhoda has a recycling business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy recyclable materials.

Rhoda has been in this business for four years.  In the future, Rhoda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy recyclable materials.

loans.name: Tseelei

texts.en: Tseelei is 44 years old and lives with her two daughters in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her older daughter gave a birth recently while her younger one goes to a local secondary school. She manages a household goods for kitchen tools trading business in her town. She started her business in 1998. Since then her business was quite successful which allowed her to increase her working capital to 1,500,000 MNT. Now she sells all kinds of household goods that fulfill her customers demand. She is planning to expand her business in the future. She is a polite woman who says, "I want my children to be educated and have better jobs." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase kitchen tools from China.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen tools for her business from China

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is a widow, age 32, with 2 children, both attending school. She has been in farming for 3 years producing milk, maize and vegetables for the local market. She has one farmhand on her farm.

Roseline has made a second loan request of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the dairy income will improve her family livelihood. She is optimistic the business will continue to grow.

She mentions animals feed shortages during dry seasons and diseases as the challenges to business.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Siyathuthuka Group

texts.en:
Maria is 79 years old and single with 8 children between the ages of 22 and 42. She runs a foods market business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni in South Africa. In the photo she is raising her hand.  
  
She has been in this business 2 years, selling fruits, vegetables and chips at her home. She also receives income from the government old age pension funds. Maria requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy fruits, vegetables and chips. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her  generate more profit and be used to take her children to tertiary level. In future she would like to improve her life and her family and grow her business.

loans.use: To buy fruits, vegetables and chips.

loans.name: Fasokounawolo V Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Fasokounawolo V sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles polygames à Koba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le petit mil, le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, AWA, assise tout de bleu vêtue, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40.000FCFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Fasokounawolo group are married women who average 39 years of age and three children each. They all live in polygamous families in Koba, a village located in the commune of Massigui in the prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali).

They have partnered with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in an attempt to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. They grow millet, rice and groundnuts, and this is their fifth loan cycle with the MFI. 

Awa, sitting and dressed in blue in the photo, will use her loan to purchase inputs and small farming equipment, and to pay for the plowing of about 0.5 hectares of millet and groundnuts.

After the harvest, the crops are sold in the city of Massigui to a clientele composed of both men and women. Awa expects to earn an average profit of approximately 40,000 FCFA by end of season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and small farming equipment

loans.name: Mohamed S.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Kenema, in eastern Sierra Leone. Teachers of this school have come to SMT for a loan of 4,900,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) in order to improve their standards of living. Some of them will use this loan to buy house-building materials, some to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay school fees for their children. At the end of each month, the school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting their repayment amount and pays SMT.  

This is the first loan that this school has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. Mohamed is the leader of this group of teachers, and he has been in the teaching profession for five years now. The 37-year-old was born in Tertihun, in eastern Sierra Leone, and is married with four children. Mohamed has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Rosalyn has a shop that sells fish such as sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy fish to sell.
Rosalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Rosalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: 3.2 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thúy makes a living by farming and raising poultry and cattle, and is applying for this loan to expand her businesses. She is 30 years old, married and has two children. She also leads a four-person loan group called the 3.2 Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which is located in Thanh Hoa City, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province. This is the first time the group has applied for a loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Thúy has been operating her business for five years and is handicapped mostly by a lack of capital. With the profits made possible by this loan, she hopes to earn enough money to provide for her kids and expand and improve her business by buying new supplies and equipment.

loans.use: to expand several small businesses.

loans.name: Ismat

texts.ru:
Исмат женат и любящий отец 5 детей. Он воспитанный и добросовестный человек. Более 3 лет он занимается скотоводством. Его жена помогает ему в этом бизнесе, когда он уходит на рынок за покупками скота она ухаживает и кормить их. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль, чтобы обеспечить свою семью и устроит своих детей в учебных заведениях. Исмат хотел бы получить займ в размере 4600 Сомони для покупки скота и пополнение оборотного капитала. Он благодарен всем кредиторам за их помощь и милосердие.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Ismat is married and is a loving father of five children.  He is a well-mannered and conscientious person.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for over three years.  His wife helps him with this business and looks after and feeds the livestock, when Ismat goes to the market to buy livestock.  He wants to expand his business and maximize his profits in order to provide for his family and place his children into schools.  Ismat wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 4600 Somoni for the purchase of livestock and increasing turnover.  He is grateful to all creditors for their help and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Doan

texts.en: Doan, who was born in 1983, is married to a driver and the mother of a small child. Since 2006 she has participated in SEDA for agricultural loans, her last one for 6,758,000 Vietnamdong (vnd), and always meets her repayment schedule punctually. Doan now wants to raise pigs to earn more money and so is requesting a loan of 8,502,000 VND to buy pigs and food for them.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
From Baray district of Kompong Tom province, Mrs. Men is a 49-year-old widowed woman who has earned a living by planting rice crops and potatoes with her son for many years in their existing farm. Besides this, Mrs. Men has also operated a small business in her village as a tailor for clothes made of both modern cloth and traditional cloth. She always has a lot of clients come to her store in order to send their cloth for sewing as they need. From this business, Mrs. Men could generate an income of approximately $2.50 USD each day to cover her daily expenses. 

Recently, her potatoes are not growing well because they are ravaged by insects and lawn. Because of that obstacle, Mrs. Men has decided to seek a loan to buy insecticide which she will use to protect her crop and also hire domestic laborers to cut down lawn. In the future, Mrs. Men hopes she is able to get a better standard of living, decorate her old house and send her son to be educated in a university degree.

loans.use: to buy insecticide to protect her crop and hire domestic laborers to cut down lawn.

loans.name: Desa

texts.en:
Desa is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Desa has a junk shop that buys and sells papers, bottles and metals. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy recycled papers, bottles and metals to sell.

Desa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Desa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy recycled papers, bottles & metals to sell

loans.name: Fareeha Naz's Group

texts.en:
Fareeha Naz is 32 years old.  She couldn’t complete her education due to financial constraints and had to leave her education after matriculation. She is married and her husband operates a grocery store in the market. He sells daily use items such as spices, sugar, cooking oil and lentils, at reasonable rates. He is very good in his customer dealings and has a good number of loyal clients who do shopping from him regularly.
 
Fareeha supports her husband financially by sewing clothes. She is very skillful and receives regular orders every month. She has given birth to a son and 3 daughters. All of them are studying except the youngest daughter who is only 3 years old. 

Fareeha has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk that will allow him to fulfill his client orders on time and earn extra income.  He has been operating his business for many years and Fareeha is confident that an investment will bring more profits to her family and improve its living standard. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Fareeha Naz.

loans.use: to buy groceries to resell

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es: La Sra. Hilaria es madre soltera tiene 02 hijos, es una mujer trabajadora, luchadora que día a día trabaja para sacar adelante su familia; ella se dedica a venta de caña de azúcar en su triciclo por las calles de la ciudad de Camaná - Arequipa, tiene en esta ocupación mas de 1 año y gana S/. 200 nuevos soles semanales aproximadamente. El crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en la compra de más caña de azúcar para así aumentar sus ventas. Su principal sueño es tener su puesto de venta en el mercado central de Camaná y que sus hijos sean profesionales. Ella esta muy agradecida con el crédito otorgado y la confianza depositada en su persona.
texts.en: Ms. Hilaria is a single mother of two children and a very hard-working woman who struggles daily to help her family get ahead.  She sells sugar cane from a tricycle cart in the streets of the city of Camaná - Arequipa.  She has been in business for over a year and earns approximately 200 PEN a week.  She plans to use the loan to buy more sugar cane to increase sales.  Her main goal is to have a stall at the central market in Camaná and to help her children become professionals.  She is very grateful for the loan and the confidence shown in her.

loans.use: To buy goods (sugar cane) to sell.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is dedicated to his agriculture business. He has been planting corn crops and has been in this line of business for five years. Aside from the farming business, his family also has a variety store where his wife is in charge of improving it. Mario has been characterized as a person who is hardworking and kind to his local community.

Mario said that the income he generates from his farming business goes immediately to cover their obligations to other traders where they get their farm supplies and some amount is used for their daily household expenses and payment for their electric bills monthly. He would like to improve his farm land so that his yield will increase but because his income is not enough, he is asking for additional capital in the amount of P27,000. This amount would be a big help in maintaining and improving his farming business. Mario is hoping that he could make his farm land more productive so that he could earn a greater income to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies needed in his agricultural business

loans.name: Ayesha's Group

texts.en:
Ayesha is married and has two daughters. They are studying in different classes. Ayesha is very supportive and sells bedsheets along with her husband. Her husband sells bedsheets by taking them on his bicycle while she sells to her local community clients. Both of them work very hard to put three meals on the table for their family every day.

Ayesha has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her family business. With this loan she will buy bedsheets in larger quantities that will allow her to sell a wider variety of bedsheets for higher profits. She is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for many years. She is confident that loan investment will help her in further growing her business.

Note: In the picture, the lady who has raised her hand is Ayesha.

loans.use: To buy bedsheets for her bedsheet selling business.

loans.name: Wambwa Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wambwa Group in Western Kenya! Joyce is the facilitator of the Wambwa group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Joyce takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Joyce had a very good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joyce was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joyce and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Joyce will repay the loan.

In 2012, the members of Wambwa group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Wambwa group members appear in the photograph along with the field officer who appears on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Lhagvadulam

texts.en: Lhagvadulam is 26 years old and lives with her husband and three kids in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business, her elder two kids are school students, and the younger one is a kindergarten student. She started her hairdressing business in 2009 by renting a hair salon. Because her hairdressing business can be managed by her husband, she rented a grocery store to increase her family income; however, she does not have quite enough supplies to run it and she needs a vehicle to run her businesses efficiently. She is requesting 3,800,000 MNT to buy freezer, some grocery products and a car.

loans.use: To buy freezer, some grocery products and a car

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар жительница района Шахритус. Возраст, 51 год. Замужем. Имеет одного ребенка. Она предоставляет услугу. У нее имеется чайхана, то есть столовая. Кроме того она занимается растениеводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений и топлива.
texts.en: Dilbar lives in the Shahrituz region. She is 51 years old, married and has one child. Dilbar manages a "chaihana", a Tajik teahouse. She has also been farming for more then six years. Dilbar is taking out this credit to purchase fertilizer and fuel for the upcoming planting season.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Kitilit

texts.en:
Kitilit is 32-years-old, married to Maxine and they are blessed with three children. He has been operating a tailoring shop for the last 4 years where he mends fabric into new clothes for his clients and gets a monthly income of Kenya shillings 10,000. 

He is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD and he plans to use the funds to purchase more stocks of fabric and thread for his tailoring business. He plans to us the profits to expand this business so that he can be use the profits to save for his children’s education. 

His dreams is to open a large clothing store and employ many more tailors to make clothes which he will sell in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fabric and threads for his tailoring shop.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. For the past three years, she has run a food stall in South Sudan. 

Amer is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and oil. She will use the extra income from her loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and oil

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: MAURA: Es una señora sonriente y luchadora, madre soltera de 2 hijos adolescentes que estudian su secundaria. Con el propósito de brindarle a sus hijos una vivienda segura y digna, con gran esfuerzo ha iniciado la construcción de su vivienda de concreto. Solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: como bloques, hierro, cemento, alambre de amarre. Ella sueña con terminar de construir su vivienda de concreto.

loans.use: para comprar materiales de construcción: como bloques, hierro, cemento, alambre de amarre

loans.name: Anoko

texts.en:
Madam Anoko L. is a widowed woman for 9 years because her husband has found another women who he considered more beautiful and who has a very comfortable situation. As this was not enough for him to humiliate Anoko as “ugly woman”. The man has rather at the dependence of her, putting then Anoko is a very miserable situation. Before this very pitiful situation, she has collected back the haberdashery of her mother which she manage with vigour and determination for 8 years. With her secondary education level and her large experiences, Anoko has shown the proof of a good manager through her three respective credits of $200, $350 and $550 obtained and regularly repaid without incident. So, by the actual project, Anoko is requesting a credit of $1000 to buy in whole the articles of haberdashery to growth her businesses. This will help her to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her children. She could then be happy and deserve entirely all the respect that needs the struggling woman.

Madame L. Anoko est une femme divorcée depuis bientôt 9 ans parce que son époux a trouvé une autre femme qu’il a jugé plus belle et ayant une situation très confortable. Comme cela ne lui suffisait d’humilier Anoko de vilaine, l’homme a de surcroît abandonné tous les quatre (04) enfants à sa charge, mettant ainsi Anonko dans une misère totale. Face à cette situation très pitoyable, elle a récupéré la mercerie de sa mère qu’elle gère avec vigueur et détermination il y a 8 ans. Avec son niveau d’études secondaires et ses larges expériences, Anonko a fait preuve de bonne gestionnaire à travers ses trois crédits respectifs de $200, $350 et $550 obtenus et régulièrement remboursés sans incident. Ainsi, par le présent projet, Anonko sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter en gros les articles de mercerie pour accroître ses affaires. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et de facto améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants. Elle pourra désormais s’affirmer et mériter pleinement tout le respect qu’à droit une femme combattante.

loans.use: To buy in whole the articles of haberdashery

loans.name: Vai

texts.en: Vai A. S. is a hard working person.  Vai goes to her farm everyday to check and get goods to sell at the market.  Vai also uses loan to buy knives, spades to do her job at her plantation.  Vai has different varieties of products at her plantation such as taro, banana, yams, breadfruit, Samoan coco (for tea) and many more. Vai also gets help from her family in running the business.  Vai is so happy to work on her farm, as this is the source of income she gets to help out with the family daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase farm equipment, fertilizers. pesticides

loans.name: Muslum

texts.en: Bialov Muslum Mahmud Ogli is a local farmer in Saatli region. He has a family of 4 members. Intolerable living conditions made him start his business, animal breeding, in 2003. Now, to expand his business, he needs to buy another sheep. Therefore, he applied to Aqroinvest CU for a 700 USD loan.

loans.use: To expand his business he needs to buy another sheep.

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Aníbal is 45 years old and is married to Celsa. They have 2 children who both study in the national school of the area. They all live together in their own house in one of the towns in the city of Encarnación. Aníbal and his wife have a store in the central market of the city as it is the most commercial area of the zone. They sell basic products such as oil, flour, sugar, grain etc and they have done this for 6 years. They started in a very small stall but thanks to good business sense they now have a very large and well stocked store. Their main clients are those who make food in the central market who buy their raw ingredients from Don Aníbal. They would like to enlarge their business by buying a larger variety of products from Argentina (which borders Paraguay) the prices are lower and it is only a few hours from Encarnación. The products he would buy with the loan would be dairy products, coffee, powdered milk, wine, flour etc.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Aníbal tiene 45 años, está casado con la Sra. Celsa y tienen dos hijos, quienes estudian en un colegio nacional de la zona, viven todos juntos es una casa propia ubicada en uno de los barrios de la ciudad de Encarnación. Aníbal y su señora poseen un local comercial en el mercado municipal de la ciudad que es el mayor centro comercial de la zona.
