Venden artículos de primera necesidad como aceite, harina, azúcar, fideos, granos, etc. y ya llevan 6 años de antigüedad en el lugar. Comenzaron con un pequeño local y gracias a su buena administración, hoy día ya poseen una despensa bien surtida, sus principales clientes son comedores de la zona que adquieren su materia prima en el almacén de Don Aníbal. Ellos están deseosos de ampliar su negocio, por lo que desean comprar más variedad de productos para la venta, los mismos desean adquirirlos de Argentina (país que limita con Paraguay) pues allí los precios son más bajos y queda a pocas horas de Encarnación. Los productos a adquirir con el crédito son golosinas, productos enlatados, café, leche en polvo, vino, harina, etc.

loans.use: To buy dairy products, coffee, powdered milk, wine, flour etc/Compra de golosinas, productos enlatados, café, leche en polvo, vino, harina, etc.

loans.name: Ruhadiyah

texts.id: Ibu Ruhadiyah bersama dengan suaminya, Sunarto, menjalankan usaha membeli barang-barang rongsokan untuk dijual ke pengepul. Mereka tinggal bersama serorang putri mereka, Sumiati, yang berumur 12 tahun namun tidak sekolah. Mereka tinggal di kos-kosan Rp 140.000,00/ bulannya. Setiap hari mereka berangkat jam 6 pagi berbekal gerobak yang berfungsi sebagai tempat barang-barang rongsokan yang mereka beli. Setiap hari mereka berkeliling menempuh jarak kurang lebih 2 km. Setiap harinya mereka mendapatkan untung Rp 50.000,00. Itu masih belum terhitung dengan biaya hidup perhari mereka. Harapan mereka adalah kehidupan yang lebih baik. Anak mereka bisa bersekolah dan memiliki rumah sendiri.

loans.use: Membeli barang-barang rongsokan untuk dijual ke pengepul

loans.name: Hortensia

texts.es:
Hortensia T., married mother of four children, belongs to the Villazón de Villa Association. Before she had a kiosk where she sold sweets and candies on the edge of the city of El Alto, which helped her establish contacts for selling products that she makes of vicuña wool, including sweaters, shawls, and others. Two years ago she stopped selling candies to focus exclusively on exporting vicuña wool, primarily to the Norwegian Mission, one of the most important buyers of this product. Currently Hortensia is one of the most important providers of this raw material, which is why she needs additional cash to increase her export volume. Only by doing so will she be able to increase her income and ensure the well being of her children, establishing a prosperous business she will be able to leave to her heirs.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Hortensia T., casada y madre de 4 hijos, pertenece a la asociación Villazón de Villa Adela, anteriormente tenía un kiosco de venta de dulces y golosinas en la ceja de la Ciudad de El Alto, que también aprovechaba para realizar los contactos necesarios para la venta de aquellos productos que ella confeccionaba con lana de vicuña, como ser chompas, mantillas y otros. Hace dos años dejó esta actividad para dedicarse exclusivamente a la exportación de lana de vicuña, principalmente a la Misión Noruega, que es uno de los compradores más importantes de este producto. Actualmente Hortensia es una de las proveedoras más importantes de esta materia prima, por lo que necesita de más capital con el fin de incrementar los volúmenes de exportación, solo de esta manera podrá mejorar los ingresos que percibe y asegurar el bienestar principalmente de sus hijos, estableciendo un prospero negocio que podrá heredar a su descendencia.

loans.use: Increasing export volume of vicuña wool to foreign markets

loans.name: Adamsay

texts.en: Adamsay is 35 years old and married with 4 children.   She started her business by selling onions and chicken stock.  With her previous loan of about US$ 100, Adamsay diversified her business a bit.  Her future plan is to own a space in the market of Magburaka town in Sierra Leone where she can expand her business further.  She said she would like to receive a loan of $175 to increase her stock. She presently runs her business within her house and most of her customers are her neighbors.

loans.use: to purchase a market stall for her business in the long run; more inventory in the short run

loans.name: Mohammad Hashim

texts.en:
Mohammad Hashim lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and is the sole breadwinner for his family.

He has a carpentry shop with a number of talented apprentices, but he needs to complete his tools of the trade, so he wants to take out an individual loan to buy new carpentry tools. In that way he will be able to attract more customers and make a good income to help his family whom he dearly loves.

loans.use: To buy new tools for his carpentry shop

loans.name: Amanecer Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
Waking Up Always, Amancer por Siempre, is made up of 17 women whose intention in life is to generate income to assure the welfare and education of their children.

They take part in different activities like craft and fabric painters, cloth vendors, florists and mainly selling toys. For this end, they travel to the interior of the country to buy the merchandise and subsquently sell it at the fair in the city named "The High One", or El Alto.

For this reason, it is necessary to build up capital to take advantage of carnival season and sell water games, famous squirts, globes, water bames and other things to generate bigger and better resources for their business.

Amanecer por Siempre, es el deseo de 17 mujeres cuyas intenciones en la vida son las de superación parra poder de esta manera generar los ingresos para asegurar principalmente el estudio y bienestar de sus hijos

Distintas actividades las caracteriza, como ser la artesanía en tela y pintura, el comercio de ropa y prendas de vestir, repostería, floristería, pero uno de los principales es la venta de juguetes. Para este fin, muchas de las socias deben viajar al interior del país para adquirir su mercadería que posteriormente será vendida en sus puestos en la feria de la ciudad de El Alto.

Por tal motivo, es necesaria la capitalización de estas socias, para aprovechar la temporada de carnavales, que es especial para la venta de juegos de agua, como los famosos chisguetes, globos, bombas de agua y otros, lo que permitirá generar mayores y mejores recursos para su subsistencia.

loans.use:
This loan is necessary to build up capital for the associates. They will take advantage of the season of Carnival and sell water games, famous squirts, globes, water bombs and other things to generate bigger and better resources for their business.

es necesaria la capitalización de estas socias, para aprovechar la temporada de carnavales, que es especial para la venta de juegos de agua, como los famosos chisguetes, globos, bombas de agua y otros, lo que permitirá generar mayores y mejores recursos para su subsistencia.

loans.name: Prek Svay Ii Group

texts.en: All of the people in the picture are the borrowers from the Prek Svay II Village Bank in Kandal Province. Mr Nem N., 45, is a farmer and banana seller and also the Village Bank president. He is married with four children; three work in the factory near his house and one is a student. He would like to request a loan of $2800 in order to buy a pig as well as more bananas to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a pig and more bananas to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a mother of four children and all her children are currently in school. She is twenty nine years old and has been selling frozen fish, meat, and charcoal (one of the main sources of fire for cooking in most Ghanaian homes) in Obuasi.

She wants to use this loan to purchase more bags of charcoal and boxes of frozen fish to avoid price hikes. She also wants to rent a store, as she currently shares a store with her sister who is doing the same business.

Janet is a member of the group called David. David members guarantee for each other to repay their part of the loan on time.

Janet is pictured above wearing a red dress along with her sister.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of frozen fish and meat

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha, 30, is married and has four children (ages: 9 months, 3, 8, and 10). She runs a business selling chicken feed and cosmetics. She sells these items from 8am to 6pm daily. From this business, which she started only 6 months ago, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $115.

Mwanaisha is requesting a loan to purchase more stock of chicken feed and cosmetics to. Her group is named Jitahidi and the members are mutually responsible for repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of chicken feed and cosmetics

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel is a young man with the desire for continuous self-improvement, which is why he finished his studies in computer sciences. His wish is to be able to start his own computer assembly shop. His efforts have given him and his sister the possibility to improve a food stand in a nearby street market. They rent it out and have turned it into their source of income. He is requesting a loan in order to keep improving his stand and rent it out at a better price. Help Miguel move forward with his efforts of self-improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Miguel, es un joven con muchos deseos de superación y mejoramiento continuo es por ello que terminó sus estudios técnicos en computación y su deseo es poder tener su propio taller de ensamblaje de computadoras y sus esfuerzos le ha dado la posibilidad de mejorar junto con su hermana un puesto de comidas en el mercadillo cercano a su casa para poder alquilarlo y que éste sea una fuente de financiamiento importante para ellos, solicita un préstamo para continuar mejorando el puesto de mercado que tiene y poder alquilarlo a un mejor precio. Apoya a Miguel a seguir adelante con estos esfuerzos de superación.

loans.use: Improvement of rental space

loans.name: Lesbia Elisalda

texts.es:
Sra. Lesbia Elisalda B. P. was born in the town of Bluefields. She is 38 years old and is married to Sr. Miguel Ángel Hernández who is a taxi driver earning minimum wage. His wages do not cover the cost of basic necessities. They have four children in high school.

For the past four years Sra. B. has been selling used clothing to passers-by who pick out her store because she offers a variety of clothing (children’s clothes, sheets, men’s and women’s clothing for all ages). With the income from this business, she pays for the education of her children.

Sra. B.’s customers are asking for more children’s clothing, but at the moment she does not have sufficient capital to buy any more packages. For this reason she is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase a package of clothing for children. By investing in this way, she will increase her income and satisfy the demands of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Lesbia Elisalda B. P. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 38 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Miguel Ángel Hernández quien trabaja como taxista el cual devenga un salario mínimo que no cubre todos los pagos de los gastos básicos, ambos tienen 4 hijos menores de edad que cursan estudios secundarios.

La Sra. B. vende ropa usada hace 4 años teniendo como clientes a los transeúntes que la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de ropas (ropa para niños, sabanas, ropa para hombres y mujeres de todas las edades) con el ingreso de su negocio paga los estudios de sus hijos.

La Sra. B. tiene mas demanda de ropa para niños y por el momento no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar mas pacas de ropa para niños y por esta razón quiere comprar 1 paca de ropa para niños a $ 300.00 dólares la paca, con esta inversión aumentara sus ganancias y podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase one package of clothing for children.

loans.name: Leah's Heshima Group

texts.en:
Leah is 29 years old, married, and has 2 children, ages 7 and 4. She became a clothing seller in 2006. She works from 9am to 10pm at her business everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Leah hopes this loan can help her buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with chicken sales, clothes sales, and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila is a member of “Banco Comunal Kusikuy”. “Kusikuy” means “be happy” in Quechua. She is married, 39 years old and has 2 children. Luzmila buys cereals from wholesalers and people who bring cereals to her house, then she grinds them at her brother’s mills; she pays a minimum to use the machines, and she sells to state institutions. She also owns two vehicles which she rents out daily as taxis in the town of Ayacucho.

Luzmila needs a loan of 1050 soles to be invested in the purchase of different cereals. It is her dream to make more progress with her business and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Luzmila es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa alégrate en quechua. Luzmila es casada, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Luzmila compra cereales de los mayoristas y también de personas que le traen a su casa, para luego procesarlos en los molinos de su hermano, a quien da un pago mínimo por el uso de sus maquinarias, sus ventas lo realiza a las instituciones estatales. Además Luzmila tiene dos carros que alquila diariamente para que realicen servicios de taxi en la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Luzmila necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales variados. Los sueños de Luzmila son progresar más con su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of cereals to increase sales.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen inició el negocio porque necesitábamos dinero para sacar adelante a nuestros hijos que estaban estudiando y como eran cinco nuestra situación era más difícil y teníamos algunas deudas que cubrir. El negocio lo inició un cuñado, pero como el se fue de la ciudad y vio su necesidad, se lo traspasó en el año 2001 y desde entonces les fue muy bien, ya que mucha gente los conoce por estar ubicados en un lugar donde hay mucho tránsito de vehículos. Hace dos años le dieron el primer crédito a través de KIVA y desde entonces han crecido ya que amplio el local y compró más sillas y mesas para poder atender más personas.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $700 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar materia prima que le permita seguir elaborando pollos asados para darle un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carmen started the business because she needed money to support her children who were in school. Because there were five of them the situation was more difficult plus she had debts to cover. The business was started by a brother-in-law but because he left and went to the city and she saw a need, he signed over the business to her in 2001. Since then things have gone very well because many people know them and they are in a highly-trafficked location. Two years ago they were given their first loan through Kiva and since then they have grown because they were able to increase the size of the space and purchase more chairs and tables to be able to attend more clients. She needs a loan for US$700, which will be repaid in six months, to buy the products that will allow her to continue to roast chickens and offer good service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products needed to run the business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.es:
Lydia M. García  tiene la edad de 30 años, su estado civil es  soltera, ella tiene una niña de 13 años de edad que esta cursando recientemente el  primer año de secundaria, su compañero de vida labora como guarda de seguridad, los sueños que Doña Lydia tiene es de poder surtir la pequeña pulpería  y una venta de comida  para que  pueda tener mayor afluencia de clientes y también que el negocio se mantenga activo  y poder ofrecerle a sus clientes lo que necesitan de sus productos,  otros de sus deseos es poder darle a su vivienda mejoras ya que esta no representa las condiciones adecuadas, de tal manera que producto de las utilidades de su negocio pueda concretizar sus sueños familiares y de mejoría en su vivienda de gran importancia para ella y su hija.

El tiempo que  tiene  el negocio es de 10 años la actividad económica a la cual se dedica es la venta de comida como es: gallo pinto, maduro, tajaditas y empanadas y en su pequeña  pulpería  distribuye los productos como: golosinas, galletas, refrescos y pan,  doña Lydia empezó  por que ella había decidido experimentar la compra  venta de golosina y poco a poco fue introduciendo mas productos a su negocio, otras de las cosas por la que decidió experimentar fue la venta de comida en la que ofrecía el servició de comida con horarios de  almuerzo y cena que  al ver que esta tenia demanda pensó en la idea  de establecer dicho negocio que en poco tiempo se convirtió en otra fuente de ingresos y  de trabajo, Doña Lydia desea el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para invertir en la compra de granos básicos, aceite y verduras que serian productos para el consumo diario de los clientes, así como productos para el hogar relacionados con la pulpería.
texts.en:
Lydia M. García is 30 years old, single and has a 13-year-old daughter who recently began her first year of secondary school. Lydia’s life partner works as a security guard. Lydia dreams of being able to stock her “pulperia” (convenience store) and her small eatery so that she can attract more clientele. She wants her business to remain active and to offer her clients the products they need. She also wants to be able to make some home improvements as the condition of her living space right now is not adequate. Profits from her business will allow her to realize her dreams for herself and her daughter.

In the 10 years she has had her business, she has dedicated herself to the sale of food such as: “gallo pinto” (the traditional Nicaraguan breakfast of rice and black beans), “tajaditas” (fried banana chips), and empanadas. In her convenience store she sells candies, cookies, soft drinks and bread. Lydia began by deciding to experiment with selling candy. Little by little, she added other products. She also decided to try serving food for lunch and dinner because she saw there was a demand for such a service. A short time after establishing her business it became another source of income and work. Lydia wants financing so that she will have capital to invest in the purchase of basic grains, oil and vegetables with which she will make meals for her clients. She will also purchase homecare products to sell in her pulperia.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to purchase food staples and homecare products

loans.name: Piyalo

texts.en: Mrs. P. is married and the mother of five children. She has sold food for ten years now. She sells chips made by yam “Koliko” every evening. Most of her income comes from that activity which she uses for her family needs. She also helps her husband pay for the rent and invests in education for their children. As school has started, she believes she should buy additional food and respond better to her family's demands. On top of that, she can also sell better during the end-of-year parties and Christmas. Thus, she is requesting a loan of 500 dollars that she will use to buy more yams, potatoes and other staple foods. She says she will be able to pay back her loan within 16 months. She thanks you for your assistance to her vital small business.

loans.use: Local food Restaurant

loans.name: Zahida Parveen M.nazir Group

texts.en:
Zahida Parveen Baji resides in a shrine city named Pakpattan, Pakistan.  She owns a two-room brick house in this holy city, and has been living in it for the past 20 years.  

She is the mother of six children: four sons and two daughters.  All of her children are getting an education in a local school.  Her husband's name is M., and he runs a grocery shop in the community.  He has a good reputation with people.  Most of the people in the community come to him to buy groceries. 

Zahida Baji is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighbors, charging $2 per dress.  She invests her income in her children’s education and her husband meets the financial expenses of the house.  She has successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now she is applying for a loan to buy more groceries for her husband’s grocery shop. 

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members.  Muniran Baji wants a loan to buy blankets to resell.  Irfana Baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes.  Sabran Baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.  Razia Baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. 

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
MARIO TIENE 45 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES SOLTERO, TIENE 2 HIJOS DE 25 Y 23 AÑOS DE EDAD. 
LA VIVIENDA EN LA QUE HABITA ACTUALMENTE ES ALQUILADA.                                                                                          DEBIDO A QUE EL SECTOR DE LA CONSTRUCCION ESTA EN CONSTANTE CRECIMIENTO EXISTEN MUCHAS PERSONAS QUE SE DEDICAN A ESTA ACTIVIDAD,PERO AUN ASI ES BAJA LA OFERTA DE MANO DE OBRA EN ESTE SECTOR. EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA COMPRA DE UNA MAQUINA MEZCLADORA. DE ACUERDO A INFORMES DE INFOCRED EL SR.MARIO PRESENTA UN BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO EN EL SISTEMA FINANCIERO; EN NUESTRA INSTITUCION ES EL SEGUNDO CRÉDITO AL QUE ACCEDIÓ, MOSTRANDO EN EL PRIMERO UN EXCELENTE COMPORTAMIENTO.
texts.en:
Mario is 45 years old, single, and has two children ages 25 and 23. He currently lives in a rented home. Due to the fact that the construction industry is constantly growing, there are a lot of people who work in construction. Despite the growth, the wages of a manual laborer are still low. This loan will be used to buy a mixing machine. According to Infocred reports, Mario has a good credit history. This is the second loan that he has taken out from Kiva partner Fundación Agrocapital, and he demonstrated excellent repayment with his first loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy mixing machine

loans.name: Khonbobo

texts.en:
K. Khonbobo is 34 years old. He is married and has 3 children. Khonbobo is very diligent and hard-working man. Using his car, he has been providing taxi services for five years. In addition, he also sells farm animals. He buys young calves, feeds them for 2-3 month and then sells them at the markets. This business is a decent source of income for Khonbobo and his family. Moreover, Khonbobo sells cows to butchers who provide the city's markets with valuable fresh meat at affordable prices. The client plans to use the loan in order to purchase more young cattle and fodder for them. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months. With your support, Khonbobo will continue to progress.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: María

texts.es: María es casada, vive con su esposo, hijas y nietas en la casa que heredó de sus padres. Ella es toda una empresaria, pues desde hace 10 años que murió su madre se dedicó a atender  el puesto que ella dejó, aprendiendo muy rápido el movimiento que hay en los mercados, logrando así incrementar su capital de trabajo, lo que le dio oportunidad de atender pedidos mayores y viéndose en la necesidad de contratar a dos personas que la puedan ayudar en la venta de carne de pollo y en la entrega propicia de los pedidos que tiene para algunos restaurantes de su localidad. A pesar de estar todos los días en la misma actividad, ocuparse en su trabajo la llena de vitalidad, aunque lo cansado es trasladar estos pedidos a lugares muy lejanos, por ello, es que su próxima meta es adquirir un carro que no solo le facilite las cosas, sino también que la ayude a incrementar sus ingresos y dejar de pagar el transporte diario que gasta hasta hoy. María está en su décimo préstamo con MFP, desde hace 6 años, lo cual le agrada pues  encontró, no tan solo a mujeres dentro de su banco comunal, sino que encontró amigas, que es lo más importante. Invertirá 1000 soles en la compra de mayor cantidad de pollos para atender los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Maria is married and lives with her husband, daughters and grand-daughters in the home that she inherited from her parents. She is a businesswoman—when her mother died 10 years ago, Maria took over the store she left behind. She had to quickly learn the rhythm of the market and how to increase her capital. Increasing her capital gave her the opportunity to complete more orders and hire 2 people to help her. She sells chicken and also delivers it to several nearby restaurants. Even though every day the work is the same, her job gives her energy. However, it is tiresome to make deliveries that are far away; because of this, her next goal is to purchase a car. This will make her job easier and also help her increase her profit and stop paying for transportation every day. This is Maria’s 10th loan with MFP in the past 6 years. She is very grateful and she found not only other members within her community bank, but actual friends, which is the most important thing. She will invest 1,000 soles in wholesale chickens to fill the orders that she has.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: chickens

loans.name: Franck Koévi

texts.fr: Né en 1966 à Anfoin, Mr Franck Koévi D. – A. est marié et à en charge cinq (05) personnes. N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école faute de soutien et de moyens financiers, il s’est lancé dans l’exploitation et la vente de graviers utilisés dans la construction des maisons. Afin de mieux rentabiliser son commerce, il sollicite un financement pour assurer un ravitaillement constant et satisfaire ses fidèles clients. Les profits tirés l’aideront à couvrir les charges de famille et améliorer les conditions de vie de l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
Born in 1966 in Anfoin, Mr Franck Koévi D. – A. is married and responsible for five (5) people. Not having has the chance to go to school given a lack of financial means, he got into the business of mining and selling gravel needed in the construction of houses. In order to better increase the profitability of his business, he is asking for a loan to ensure a constant supply and satisfy his clients. The profits from the sales will help him cover the family costs and improve teh living conditions and the education of the children.

Translated from French by Isabelle Barres, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mining and sales of gravel

loans.name: Mayeth

texts.en:
Mayeth F. is a 21 year-old mother of two, and her partner Fritz is a laborer. The couple works very hard to support the needs of the family. Mayeth joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) two years ago and used a previous loan to buy and sell dried fish.  

She is now requesting a new loan to start a new venture, buying fancy jewelry for resale.  Maryeth hopes to sell even more expensive jewelry in the future and dreams of growing her enterprise to save enough money for her children’s future and to have a stall in the market where she can display her wares.

loans.use: To buy assorted jewelries.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, distrito D. Juli, provincia D. Chucuito, en el departamento D. Puno. Tiene 65 años D. edad, es casada, madre D. 04 hijos.  No tiene estudios.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 12 años.  Ella se dedica a la crianza D. truchas por lo que su primer préstamo que solicitó fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para comprar alimento para las truchas.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, comprará mallas y otros materiales que necesita para su trabajo; con lo cual pretenD. incrementar sus ganancias y seguir ayudando con los gastos familiares, así como en los estudios D. sus hijos. 

Ella desea seguir trabajando, y se compromete a pagar sus 04 cuotas D. manera puntual, para lo cual agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por su apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sabina is a member of the communal bank “Maria Asuncion Galindo” in the District of Juli, Province of Chucuito, in the Region of Puno. She is 65 years old, married, the mother of four children, and uneducated.

She has been working with the movement Manuela Ramos for 12 years. She is in the raising of trout, for which her first loan in the amount of 300 PEN helped her to buy food for the trout.

With this loan of 1500 PEN she will purchase mesh and other materials that she needs for her work, with which she hopes to increase her income and continue helping with the family expenses, such as the studies of her children.

She wants to continue working, and she commits to make her four payments punctually, and she appreciates Manuela Ramos for the support provided.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase balanced food for trout

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.ru:
Мутабар Умарова торгует на вещевом рынке города Истаравшана. В ассортимент ее товара входит детская и подрастковая одежда, которую она привозит из Кыргызстана. Торговля-основной источник доходов в ее семью.
У Мутабар двое детей, а ее муж уже 3 года, как уехал на заработки в Россию. Регулярно, он старается отправлять часть заработанных им денег своей семье.
Мутабар нужны деньги для товарооборота, с этой целью она подала заявку на получение займа в размере 1200 сомони сроком на 3 месяца.
texts.en:
Mutabar U. has a trade outlet at the Istaravshan town clothing market. She carries a variety of goods, including clothing for children and teenagers that she brings in from Kyrgyzstan. This business is her family's main source of income. Mutabar has two children, and her husband has been away for three years working in Russia. He regularly tries to send part of the money he earns to his family. Mutabar needs money for inventory, and with this goal in mind applied for a loan in the amount of 1200 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover of inventory

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
With special skills in technology, particularly in cellular phone upgrading and repair, he is our featured story. He is Mr. Jaime M., 33 years old, married and residing in Bitoon, Aguada, Ozamiz City. He is blessed with two children who are still minors. His wife also works together with him as the store manager for their employer’s cell phone units and cell phone accessories display stall in one of our shopping centers here in Ozamiz City.
He started this kind of work five years ago. He learned this skill from a vocational school (TESDA). They also are engaged in selling cell cards, games and music down loading on mobile phones. With a good credit record on his first loan, now he is applying for an amount of P40,000.00 as his second loan under the regular loan program. He wants to add to their capital in their cellular card-selling business and also to purchase additional equipment to be used in their cellphone repair shop. His future plan in business is to establish his own stall for cell phone and cell  accessories displays and cell phone repair.

loans.use: Additional capital for cell phone business

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah A. is 43 years old, married and has five children, two sons and three daughters, all of whom are currently in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in Ghana's Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband works in a sawmill. Hannah is a trader who makes a living selling food items such as plantain, cassava and yam. She sells from a table top at the local market, and travels to nearby towns to buy items in bulk for resale. She is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. She has been in business for 10 years, and hopes to expand her business and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy food in bulk to resell to her customers

loans.name: Armando Jorge

texts.pt:
Armando Jorge X. nasceu no distrito da Manhica (a 72 km a norte de maputo), masculino de 40 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 8 e 13 anos, todos a estudar.
Estudou ate 10 classe e parou divido as condições financeiras dos seu pais. 

Vive com sua família e mais 3 pessoas sob sua responsabilidade.
Saiu de Manhica no ano de 1983 com seus pais e chagado a boane nunca mais saiu distrito.

É técnico de frio e faz actividade de compra e venda de eletrodoméstica assim como recondicionar artigos avariados. Compra cada geleira a 7.500,00MT e vende a 12.000,00MT, ganha mensalmente 8.000,00MT e consegue poupar algum valor na sua conta bancaria.

Já teve empréstimos numa Associação de credito, este é o seu primeiro com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 12.000,00MT com os quais pretende comprar eletrodomésticos para vender. Conheceu a instituição através de amigos. Compromete se a pagar o credito sem problemas.

Armando pretende fazer um workshop de material convencional, onde clientes possam mandar reparar seus aparelhos de frio e construí 3 casas de aluguer.
texts.en:
Armando Jorge X. was born in the district of Manhica, 72 km north of Maputo. He is 40 years old, married and the father of four children aged 8 to 13, all students. He studied until tenth grade, and then stopped due to his parents' financial situation. He lives with his family and three other people that he has taken in and supports. He left Manhica in 1983 with his parents, arrived in Boane and has never left that district. He is a refrigeration technician; he buys and sells household appliances and reconditions damaged goods. He buys each refrigerator for 7,500 MT and sells it for 12,000 MT, earning 8,000 MT per month, and manages to set aside some funds in his bank account. Armando has already had loans with a credit association. This is his first loan with Hluvuku-Adsema in the amount of 12,000 MT, and with it he plans to buy household appliances to sell. He found out about this institution through friends. He promises to pay back the loan without problems. Armando plans to build a workshop where customers can bring their freezers and refrigerators to be repaired, and to construct three houses to rent out.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stocks in his shop

loans.name: Martina De La Concepcion

texts.es: Martina de la Concepcion N. C. tiene 52 años. Hace más de 38 años que se dedica a este negocio. Su actividad económica es brindar los servicios de costura. Martina dio inicio por una amiga que la apoyo con la idea, de elaborar prendas de vestir, a pesar de la difícil situación que Martina enfrento por ser madre y padre de sus 4 hijos, es una mujer que ha experimentado que el cuido de sus hijos y mantener su negocio, a pesar de esto logro ofrecerles a sus hijos el sustento diario. Martina necesita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo como telas, hilos, tijeras, alfileres entre otras cosas. El sueño de Martina es que establecer un taller adecuado para confeccionar sus prendas y que se puedan exhibir en otros países.
texts.en:
Martina de la Concepcion N. C. is 52 years old. More than 38 years ago she began her business. Her work is to provide her services as a tailor. Martina started her work with the help of a friend who supported her idea to make clothing. Despite her difficult situation being both mother and father to her four children, she is a woman who has experienced that the care of her children and successfully running a business, despite the challenges, offers her and her children with daily sustenance. Martina needs a loan for business capital such as fabric, string, sewing needles, and pins among other things. Martina's dream is to establish a proper workshop in which to make her clothing and that she can show her work in other countries.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Ofelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ofelia L. es una dama que labora en el departamento de León por medio de la venta de ropa que ella posee en su propio establecimiento ofreciendo todo tipo de ropa tanto para damas, caballeros y niños.

Se ha destacado por ser una excelente comerciante vendiendo la mercadería a los clientes y hoy en día atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en la compra de mayores cantidades de ropa y por ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito y así adquirir de sus proveedores la ropa para su comercialización.
texts.en:
Ofelia L. works in the district of León selling clothing from her own establishment. She offers all types of clothes for women, men and children.

It should be pointed out that Ofelia is an excellent businesswoman when it comes to selling her products to her clients. Today she has come to CEPRODEL to request a loan to acquire more clothing for resale from her suppliers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
Fernanda B. is a 43-year-old businesswoman from Camarin, Caloocan City who loves to multi-task. Her husband Gilbert, 45, is a jeepney (bus) driver. They have six children; one is in college, two are in high school, and the three others are in elementary school.

Fernanda has a general store which has been around for about fifteen years. Much of her time and effort is focused on this business but she also gets to engage in direct-selling of shoes, cosmetics, and apparel provided by prominent direct-selling companies (Natasha, Boardwalk, etc.). All these business activities give Fernanda a sure income of almost Php 15,000 a month.

A jolly and friendly woman, Fernanda joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007. She was happy to learn that most of her neighbors were also members of the cooperative. She has learned from the CCT the value of saving for the future. She wishes to see all her children finish their education.

Fernanda applied for a new loan with the cooperative amounting to Php 12,000 as additional capital for the continuity of her businesses.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Julia es casada, tiene 62 años y 5 hijos, Julia junto a su familia tienen un Colegio llamado Raúl P., Julia es la Promotora D. la institución educativa.
Julia necesita un préstamo D. 3500 soles dinero que será invertido como parte D. pago D. un local.
Los sueños D. Julia son implementar una clínica para su hija y comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Communal Bank “Alianza” (Alliance). She is 62 years old, married, and has 5 children. Julia and her family operate the Raúl P. School. She serves as the Director of this educational institution.

Julia needs a loan of 3500 soles to be used as partial payment to establish a site for the school. She dreams of starting a clinic for her daughter and buying a house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Partial payment to establish a site for a school

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de pagne

loans.name: Jovia's Group

texts.en:
B. Jovia has a hotel business in Ntungamo that she has been running for three years. She has six children and some of them are at university. Jovia needs a loan to help buy more foodstuffs to prepare and to pay the school fees of her children. She is a hardworking and determined lady. She has a challenge in her business, because she a lot of debtors as customers affecting her cash flow. Nevertheless, she has been able to make 100,000/= in profit a week because of her quality services.

Jovia is the leader of her group in Ntungamo. She would like to expand her business in the future so that she can have more space and prepare a greater variety of foodstuffs.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en: Ruth N. is a hard-working and very friendly woman who has made a living running a tailoring business in Kitega for the last 25 years. She is a married, has eight children and also cares for several orphans. Due to increased competition in her business, the number of customers Ruth serves has been falling, along with her profits. She believes she can turn this around with a loan to her group, pictured here. She will use her portion of this loan to buy more cloth and materials, thereby increasing the number of items she has to sell. Her goal is to earn enough money to allow her children to stay in school and go to college.

loans.use: To buy materials for a tailoring business.

loans.name: Issam

texts.en: Issam is a single man living with his family. He's 33 years old. He owns a private electric motor, which he has used to provide electricity for his town since 2007. He has been involved in this field for the past 10 years. Today, Issam is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase an electric cable to expand his work.

loans.use: To purchase an electric cable
